description:
Their garlic bread with cheese melted on top is the best thing ever. It's like a garlic-y cheesy pillow! Light, soft and fluffy..it's bomb af. I try to eat as many as I can, but realize there's pizza to be consumed as well. 

I've had their Chicken Florentine, Hilda's fav (pesto pizza), California, special combo and meat lovers. All are good, but I say Chicken Florentine and Hilda's fav get my top vote. 3 or 4 slices, the pillow bread and a few cups of water and I'm gouda. Pizza size ranges from small to extra large, and they even give you a guesstimate to how many peeps a certain size will feed. My office and I usually have the pizza delivered and recently dined in rollin' 8 ppl deep. We ordered 2 extra large pizzas, cheesy bread and salad and had a good amount of leftovers for later. 

Goat Hill pizza is pretty unique compared to other pizzas I've had. They have a wide array of pizzas to choose from, as well as a few pastas, sandwiches and salads. I always get excited when there's leftover pizza from them in the office fridge. They never disappoint! Good eats and reasonably priced. Definitely give them a try!
author: Vicky L.

description:
I don't know where to begin. It was against my little daughter's judgement to not go there, which I wish I had listened. 

I was served by a guy with greasy hair, sweaty too perhaps. He asked me if I had seating preference. I said no, he sat us right in the front area where the pizzas were made. I thought we would get better service since he would pass us to get to other tables. 

Took him 15 minutes to take our order. He didn't ask what kind of sauce  we might want or even size of the pizza. When I asked him about what the meatballs were made of, the explanation was a slur that i had to figure it out myself. 

So we ordered 1 appetizer and 1 small pizza. I didn't like the vibe already. My pizza took a long time than usual to get to our table, served by the cook, which came before the appetizer. I had to wave the guy who was 'serving' me asking for the wings. He took it from the counter and gave us. God knows how long it had been sitting there, but it was still hot. He apologized for the delay cos it was 'rush' time. 

He never once asked if we needed anything else, or water refills or anything. I had to get my own 'to go' box and walked to the front to pay, of course no one was there. A lady finally came and i told her my displeasure and how unhappy i was with the service. She meekly said sorry....more like a whisper...unapologetic. 

I didn't tip. I felt that I paid too much for a small pizza and some wings. Really disappointed with the service, felt very undervalued. This happened 2 hours ago, 10/03/2018 between 6:30-7:30pm. 

I tried to support local restaurants but I guess these workers didn't feel the same. Never again...
author: Elly G.

description:
Goat Hill is solid for pizza.  I've been searching for a FAVORITE pizza place in the city and was hoping Goat Hill would be it.  Unfortunately I'm still searching, but I still can say this place is worth getting pizza from. 
 I've dined in and ordered delivery, all has been great.  Dinner in the restaurant was nice.  Our server was very nice and the food came out pretty quickly 

PIZZA
Meat lover's- salami, pepperoni, sausage
California- tomatoes, artichoke, garlic
Special combo- everything
Margherita
Mediterrenan- spinach, feta, red onion, garlic

Personally, I don't really like meat on my pizza so I liked the California best...but really everything is good!

I don't have enough pizza loving friends, but one day, I would love to check out Monday night all you can eat.
author: Lyn C.

description:
Stopped by while there was heavy construction going on outside of the restaurant. I walked in to order a pizza to go, at the front counter only to discover there was nobody there. The chef finally notice my appearance after I made a couple of grunts and  eventually the cook rang a bell for the cashier. Custom ordered a small personal size pizza  half special combination substituted goat cheese for ricotta cheese and half pepperoni pizza. Yum!

Just a tip if they broke down the barrier wall that divides the dinning area from the to go area; there probably would be a better view of seeing customer walk in through the front door. 

The guy behind the register was very polite. He seemed a little frantic though when taking my order, like his mind was in limbo. However, he did tell me he was adjusting coming back to work from vacation. I can understand that.
author: Elijajuan F.

description:
Limp salad with dressing that tastes of xanthan gum--a bad-smelling emulsifier in bottled dressings. we went to Goat Hill countless times when my kids were growing up, and the salads were fabulous--very fresh and with delicious home-made dressings.

Now they're cutting corners and the salads are no better than you'd expect at some fast-food place.
author: Susan A.

description:
I found out that the server overcharged me 10% of gratuity when I check my credit card bills!!

We ordered a garlic bacon Alfredo pizza, meatballs as a side, and some drinks.

Food was alright. Tasted better than Pizza Hut but not as good as Pizza from an authentic sit-down restaurant. I would even argue that Pieology tastes better than goat hills.
author: Philip H.

description: Why local pizzeria? We always smell the delicious sourdough crust and feel enticed and then get SUPER let down by the horrible service. I mean wow last night our waitress didn't even literally say one word to us, ignored us most of the way and then didn't give us any dining ware for our salads or cups for our drinks. This isn't even the first time that we've come here where it was like this...it's always lackluster in the service department. Maybe understaffed? Maybe need to get new staff? I have no idea but it's bad I know that for sure. We just couldn't believe how bad it was, it wasn't even busy which blew my mind even more. Oh and we also got charged for a medium pizza and received a small so you see where I'm going here...there is no one paying attention or caring it seems like. Maybe save this for a take out only location if you must have pizza in the area.
author: Guisela L.

description: I work a few blocks away so I wander over here for lunch sometimes, usually around 1:30 or 2pm.  At that time, on weekdays, it's super mellow.  I usually sit in the back room, near a window, and it's just chill.  Only a few customers in the room, if any.  I just love it when I want to relax away from work.  But, the real thing we have to discuss here is that Goat Hill makes custom slices of pizza.  I don't think anyone else is doing this in San Francisco?  You can order a slice with whatever you want on it, as opposed to most places that sell slices where you need to pick from whatever they have made.  I just love this about Goat Hill, because I usually like combos that most by-the-slice places don't sell. Chicken sausage spinach or bacon meatball mushroom or whatever I feel like coming up with.  Custom pizza slices AND table service?  Consider me a fan for life.
author: Dave M.

description: A great family friendly place with tasty Italian food. Particularly good for kids, as they give toddlers crayons to keep them busy
author: Shane O.

description:
In a nutshell: food 5/5, price 4/5, service (waitress) 5/5, wait time 2/5 

I came here with my apartment mates to check it out. Sourdough pizza?... yes please! I was super hyped and starving when we arrived. We were ready for food and excited since we were literally the only customers in that restaurant. 

They have nice seats inside and a pretty decent wine list. We were greeted and sat down immediately which was nice. The waitress handed us menus and gave us water. 

The pizza was superb for about 35.00 we got half meat special and half goat cheese and tomato. It was delicious and the crust was soft, chewy and crispy all at the same time. 

My only critique is the wait time. We were literally the only people there but we ended up waiting for over 40minutes  for our pizza, which just seemed a bit too long. The waitress explained there was a mix up with the back house when the cooks switched chefs but to be honest since the cooking area is opened the chefs were the same. And it looked like they were just goofing around and didn't see our order for the first 20 minutes we were sitting there... 

This place would have definitely been 5 stars for me, if their service was on point. But at least their pizza was worth it.
author: Emily T.

description: The best pizza in town ..............:-) so I ordered my pizza   Customer service was great   when I got home I was surprised that it was still warm and it was so delicious!!!
author: Cubana Q.

description:
Goat Hill has been darn near the best since the 90's as I remember. The staff is always pleasant, the food aroma can be smelled from across the street and it is delish. 
I enjoyed the Mediterranean Pizza and they showed me so much love with a fat slice! 
Eh...parking on the weekends can be hard due to the transplants, but still Goat Hill is a great place!!
author: Vonny K.

description:
I am delighted to have FINALLY found this place, despite its long history as a Potrero Hill institution (opened in 1975!). I can't speak to how the current establishment compares to the pre-remodeled ways; however, my experience since coming here 3 months ago has been nothing but ADDICTIVE. 

First, service is efficient AF. Regardless of what time of day or day of the week, the servers are attentive. The manager, Lily, is both amiable AND competent. She clearly knows how to captain this ship and is always such a pleasure to encounter at dinner time. Her superior managerial capabilities are especially evident on busy nights. Being a hotspot for families with small children means that occasionally the staff can be a tiiiiiiiiny bit grouchy (but honestly who wouldn't be after an entire week of screaming mini-humans). But regardless of their moods, the staff is always quick and attentive. That's phenomenal management. 

Finally, their food is obesity worthy. I kid you not. I come here as often as I one can before one's body starts to rebel. Their pizza crust is crispy on the bottom, chewy in the center, and both on the crust. The sour dough elevates all the flavors of the pizza to a different level. Other pizza joint ain't got notthin' on Goat Hill. I also LOVE LOVE LOVE that they offer daiya (vegan) cheese for those of us that are lactose intolerant who are looking to enjoy a pizza gas-free (sorry I'm not sorry) without compromising on flavor. And for those judgy-mc-judgers who think "EW Vegan?! No thank you" I'll say it had my family fooled. And, because their pizza dough is vegan, everyone in the family, regardless of dietary restrictions (even the salad options are great for Gluten-Free peeps), are able to come here and have a killer time. 10 points for Gryffindor!

Since I discovered this place I've been going almost every other week and the pizzas just keep getting better an better. The Californian is my fave -- add mushrooms and olives and it'll give the opioid crisis a run for it's money (sorry too real?).

The place can be a little crowded but honestly what great place isn't. Expert tip, they take reservations! Use it. Seriously. You won't regret it.
author: Marissa S.

description:
All-You-Can-Eat pizza on Monday nights at Goat Hill Pizza reminds me of my childhood (like Cici's pizza buffet for those who have unfortunately experienced it, but 100x better). For around $12, you get unlimited salad and as much pizza as you want from the lovely staff walking around serving up hot and fresh slices. There are a huge variety of toppings, from basic sausage, pepperoni, and cheese to loaded baked potato, buffalo chicken, etc. 

I've gotten delivery from here as well, and it's quite fast and fresh. The sourdough bread crust is really unique to San Francisco, and you can get interesting toppings combinations as well. While GHP definitely isn't necessarily your woodfired, artisinal pizza made with imported water from New York, they don't try to be. It's just a really solid pizza joint filled with the friendliest staff who remember your name and make you feel at home.
author: Denise L.

description: Porky Pie.  Just get the Porky Pie.  I don't even like pizza (I know... say whaaaat?!), but I love the Porky Pie and I sure as hell would go back for it.  Nice big garlic cloves with lots of flavor.  I wouldn't even mind adding a few more toppings to it (e.g., mushrooms and spinach), but it was damn good as is.  The Chicken Florentine unfortunately, paled in comparison.  It wasn't as flavorful and I found the chicken way too dry to be enjoyable.  So... just get the Porky Pie, you won't regret it.  Best pizza decision I ever made.
author: Carena N.

description:
As a guy who grew up in the Bay Area, I love my sourdough! 

Goat Hill is the only one I know of using this for their crust in SF. They are always consistently good and I've had pies from all their locations. 

If you have a hankering for a pizza, don't hesitate to dine-in or have it delivered. Fresh and tasty!
author: Matthew R.

description:
So this experience was nothing less than surreal, we've been here before and the food was great. This however, was not that night. We stroll in and the guy who's manning the oven was super nice and more than willing to make a pizza to go, totally get it that it's about to close. 

Enter bratty girl who hates her life aka cashier, she proceeds to tell us we can only order slices - even after the guy who's actually doing the work (making the pizzas) corrects her and tells her he is fine with making us to go.

So she agrees after tedious bickering back and forth, to let us order a pizza. Only to let us know they're out of goat cheese. 

Fine - totally get it we'll take what's available. So we ask for a substitute for ricotta (plenty in stock). Here comes the surreal experience I mentioned earlier. She charges me $33 for a medium "custom pizza" when we ordered the Hilda - more than willing to take the cheese they had on hand. Mind you a medium hilda is $23.95. So she clearly charged me more than $8 more to accept an ingredient as a substitute for something they ran out of. Are you kidding me!?!? 

I expressed my strong displeasure with her up charging me  and she proceeds to tell me that "it's just the way the system works".

Honey, I wasn't born yesterday - I've worked in the food industry during my undergrad and that has nothing to do with the "system"

Needless to say she got no tip, well deserved.
author: Dominick S.

description: It feels good being here!  It is clean and tidy with lots of natural light!  The staff are very pleasant too!  I always enjoy the excellent green salad  to start; today followed with a veggie pizza .
author: Dom B.

description:
The Monday-night all-you-can-eat pizza is a good way to spend the evening. We've been there about a dozen times. The later you go, the better the pizzas they bring out. The earlier you go, the more kids there are and the pizzas are more plain (a lot of cheese-only pizzas for the brats). So, if you like their more exotic pizza offerings, go about an hour and a half before they close. 

The service is just OK. 

The ambiance is much better since they remodeled, but this place is f'ing *loud*.  It's echoey and the remodel didn't help (no sound baffles like acoustic tile or anything like that).  I bring earplugs. If noise bothers you, come prepared.
author: Tim W.

description: Ever since they remodeled it hasn't been the same. We miss the open family and dedicated staff that knew what service was all about and what good pizza actually tasted like. The old crew will be missed because this is definitely not the go to local pizza place anymore. Hope one day soon they bring back the people that used to work there instead of deny them their jobs because the owner was looking for a "new flair". Just sad but I guess that's how bad business owners look at things. Hope u enjoy it if u go there anyway.
author: Maria B.

description: I've taken some time off, then went back a month ago.  The salad bar is no longer there.  I loved that salad bar.  They will make it for you in the back, but not the way I like to fix it from the salad bar.  Aside from that, their all-you-can eat pizza on Monday nights is still on point.  Every specialty pizza that came out of those ovens, we got to try.  And they were all delicious!  We love Goat Hill Pizza!
author: Angela K.

description:
Was at the library nearby, then the hunger hits me!!! Dam... I am hungry!!!... saw a flyer about the the history of Protreo Hill night sponsored by Goat Pizza...  apparently you can go to this event and you can buy pizza for $3/slice. Uhm... from the flyer, it looks like this place been here for awhile...thinking I should check it out.

Journey 3 blocks from the library then voila...Goat Pizza!!!

The pizzaria:
Good for take outs or dine in. For dine in this is a good date place! Nice clean and there is even a section with the view of da city! Apparently they just finished a major renovation. Every is new. 

I ordered a small 10' pizza and a side salad and rootbeer. I must say this pizza is rock'n! 

The staff is nice keep checking on me.

I'm typically not a pizza guy but man I eat the whole dam thang!!! Haaa... yummmy!!!

Super like
author: IHeartMambo S.

description: One of my neighborhood's proudest spots.  Of all the pizza joints in the city, this is my favs. Besides the best sourdough crust in town, the ingredients are always fresh and the vibe is always cool.  This is my favorite pizza place.  It's unpretentious, a great bargain, quality food...
author: Penelope C.

description: Really wanted this to be my new pizza place cause we just moved close by and I had heard good things about it. Very disappointed with service, pizza was ok. I placed an online delivery order on their website and proceeded to wait two hours! I called them and the guy while nice, put me on hold twice making me feel like they never checked the online order. He said the delivery man came to my place and tried ringing the doorbell (I have a camera and an obnoxious bell, no one rang) and tried calling me, no missed calls. I asked if I could get anything back from wasting two hours on the order when I could have picked it up by that point and he gave me a "discount". Go elsewhere, the service isn't worth it.
author: Adriana H.

description:
Flavor 5 * 
Thin crust 4 *
Ambience 3 * 
Crust: Edges were fine, crispy. But the center--flaccid!  when I fold my slice of thin crust I like it to crack and stay firm. This was undercooked. 
Ambience: Please 86 that pale unappetizing pale drab institutional bile green paint. Research indicates that red, orange, yellow and brown tones excite appetite. What happened to the cute piano?!  
Great flavor,tho.
author: Lee B.

description: I was lucky enough to have my friend pick up the Hilda pizza and bring it over to my house for us to enjoy. I loved the fresh pesto and the tasty goat cheese, they really complimented each other especially with the flavorful tomato sauce. I don't normally eat pizza crust but I did finish a majority of the sourdough crust, it definitely adds something special to this pizza. I can't wait to try the Porky Pie next!
author: Danielle D.

description: I have been eating at Goat Hill for over 40 years. I went on 7/15/2018 for my birthday gift pizza with my family. Since the renovation I have notice a change in quality and service has gone down. Sorry Goat Hill your pizza is not that good. It was great once but since all the changes that have been going on your pizza it needs to go back to 1975. I would call what you serve now is close to freezer bought pizza.
author: Bombiz V.

description:
I love Goat Hill! They're very family friendly, and the food is lovely.

The service can be a bit spotty, but given how much our kids (and we) love it it's hard to hold it against them too much
author: Fran K.

description:
No need to get here early on Monday's anymore: all you can eat is nothing like it used to be. No more salad bar, no placemats and markers for kids, no ice cream chest. And we waited 30 minutes for a pizza to even show up! Since the place was empty, they told us they just were waiting for more people to come. 
What used to be our favorite place is now stripped of its soul. All of the staff have been fired, new ones have no idea what it used to be. What was the center of the neighborhood is now a bland pizza clone.
What a shame.
author: Michael G.

description: Good pizza, great customer service. They were very quick too, I called 30 minutes earlier and by the time you walk up that hill from the boba guys on 16th ave, the pizza was ready for pick up.
author: W Y.

description: Order of pizza, wings and bruschetta, came with out condiments, requested dressing, napkins, plates or utensils, can't believe tipped the driver
author: Hector G.

description: Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. I'm the Head Coach of a baseball team and I entrusted Goat Hill Pizza to provide 4 XL pizzas to my Little League team's end-of-season party. This was like a $150 order for which I prepaid a 20% tip! They failed to deliver the pizzas on-time and when I called they lied to me telling me the pizzas were on their way (which they were not)! 30 minutes after the pizzas were due to be delivered, they finally admitted that they messed up and were just starting to make the pizzas now. By the time they would have arrived they would have been an hour late! Too late for hungry youngsters. Due to this experience I will be telling everyone who will listen, to BOYCOTT every Goat Hill Pizza around. Good job GHP, now a team of young boys know to never eat Goat Hill Pizza. I trusted you, you let us down.
author: Chris K.

description: Great tasting pizza, friendly staff, but a bit expensive for pizza. Otherwise, I would have given this place five star. Will definitely come back every other blue moon :P
author: Brendan N.

description: Ive tried this place round about 6 times before writing a review: so this is it. The pizza is SF typical pricy. 5.50 for a topped slice. I was here on a Monday evening the last time. They offer all you can eat for 16 dollar. I had to wait nearly an hour to get about 2 slices in total. They walk around and you can choose of whatever they have. Being a vegatarian and not a fan of weirdo artichoke pineapple pizza, I didn't like that way a lot. In the end it's so slow that ur saving time gets more important to kill ur hunger. I left after 60 minutes being frustrated about this ripoff. I won't eat here again. This is pure money greediness and not customer focussed. The new management bought a brand that doesn't stand for what it stood before.
author: Lenny L.

description:
Y'all I am SO disappointed. We've been coming here for seven years and tonight's meal was horrendous. One pizza was forgotten and two others were burned. The salads were smaller than size and they no longer sell
Beer pitchers. 

Since the remodel, this place has gone downhill.
author: Bri C.

description: We were in town for the weekend. We called ahead and they took our order before they were open at noon, great! We specifically arranged for delivery at 12:10 pm. They arrived at 11:46 am and the delivery person was annoyed AT US for not getting the pizzas right away! In the meantime, we had to have pizzas sitting there since our lunch break was not until 12:15. Pizza was just okay.
author: Julie P.

description: Since they did the remodel job the whole atmosphere has changed it's horrible in there the service was horrible the hostess who sat us down was very rude like she was doing us a favor. the waitress was OK just forgot about us and left us we literally had to flag her down to get our check we will never go there again. We miss the old goat hill and staff. we've been going there for over 30 years very disappointed where did the piano go
author: Mona R.

description: Way overpriced for what you get.  Especially their Gluten-free pizza - over $30 for the smallest size GF Veggie pizza and it tastes like cardboard.  Do not recommend.
author: Mia M.

description:
For many years we had pizza delivery from Goat Hill and were happy with it. Recently they seemed to have changed delivery maps. We were on the edge of several of the locations map. We started to have to get "manager approval" from our location. Ok a bit of a hassle and a few extra minutes. Well today we called the SOMA location. "No you're location is in Potrero Hill delivery." Ah ok we've always ordered from SOMA but fine. Call Potrero and get put on hold while "they discussed it with their manager". No you're in the West Portal locations delivery area. Fine. Call the West Portal location. "No Potrero Hill should deliver to you."

That's fine we will take our business elsewhere.
author: Chad M.

description: I've been coming to Goat Hill for about 10 years. There new renovations and closure for the summer was hard bc I couldn't get the best deal in town on my Mondays. But now they're back! It's a whole new crew but they're still the same. The pizzas were plentiful and hot and I had a total of about 7 slices on Monday for their all you can eat $11.99 special. They changed a few things: no more salad bar but bring you salad with endless dressings and helpings, new artwork, new staff, much bigger takeout and they now deliver (no more ordering from West Portal!). Goat Hill, Welcome back to the hill. We missed you!
author: Annette K.

description: Wow. What happened to this place?! We were one of 4 tables seated in this place tonight and it took more than 20 minutes to get our salad, which ended up having rotten pieces of lettuce in it. 2 seconds after the salad came, the pizza came. This is unacceptable. I'd have liked to have eaten the salad first. Service was terrible, too. Will not be back!
author: K. N.

description:
10-14-2017
  Nice sunny day, I decide to come here after i discovered the restaurant sunflower opens at 5:00pm, I didnt want to wait any longer to eat so i came here,  i seen it looke at little different on the outside of the building, they remodel the place, i looks nice so far, i ordered the HILDAS FAVORITE, OH MY IT WAS DELICIOUS, WITH SOME WINE,  emerald did  awsome  assisting me.
author: Chardae B.

description:
We had a friend in town so decided to take him to some cool places round Dogpatch.  The other pizza place I really like was closed so we came here instead.  The placed looked legit and if you get seated in be back you can get a decent view of the city.  We ordered the caprese salad and the garlic bread with cheese for starters.  The salad looked pretty but tasted basic.  Thankfully they provided our own bottles of balsamic vinegar and olive oil, cause it needed a few dashes of each. The garlic bread wasn't toasted enough so it wasn't crispy.  Tasted ok, but I was expecting more from it.

We got the combination pizza with the hopes of it tasting fantastic but again was just pretty average.  The crust was a bit too hard for my liking and after having a piece I was already wishing we would have got the meat lovers.  The side of marinara helped slightly but not much. 

Service was good though, but probably won't come back.  Just being honest.
author: Nyla K.

description:
I'll admit I don't really like pizza, mainly because I don't really care for the carbs in the crust most of the time. The pizza here is a whole different story.

The crust? Thick but sooo soft and fluffy! A little bit of crunch on the outside part and gooey soft on the part under the sauce and toppings. I don't think I've ever legitly wanted pizza crust before.

I had the Meat Lover's pizza (salami, pepperoni and Italian sausage), which I was pleased to find was actually generously topped with meat. A little greasy but protein-lovers will be happy!
author: Jessie L.

description:
First the pizza options they have are all so delicious in their own creative ways.  How they serve the pizza on a pizza stand in the middle of your table sets such a warm pizzeria environment. 
Second, I love love love the salads here. It's a taste of freshness I can not forget about. Whether it's at the salad bar or you're ordering from the menu.
Thirdly, they have an all you can eat pizza night on Monday's which is great for people who enjoy tasting a bit of everything on the menu. This place is honestly my favorite pizzeria in San Francisco.  You can make big table reservations, and the food is fantastic with a warm fun ambiance around. 
P.s you can make your own pizza. A closed mouth never gets fed ;)
author: Edgar H.

description:
I've been living in the area for a long time now and finally got myself to eat here. We ordered a large meat lover's pie for pick-up. 

I was unimpressed. 

The dough is way too thick for my taste. There's not much going on with the sauce, and the cheese is also underwhelming. I held a couple of toppings like the bell peppers and olives. Thankful they got my order right! 

The only time it really tasted good was the next morning when I was hungover and the pizza was straight out of the fridge. Because that salty-ness after a night of too much wine always hits the spot, but otherwise. Pizza is meh-ok.
author: Priti K.

description: Isn't it a Nancy Pelosi's side business to launder money for California democrats? It is conveniently registered in Panama. Who cares about your pizza?
author: UIM V.

description: Goat Hill Pizza is a hidden treasure, way more options than just pizza - just make sure you don't even get your bumper close to the bus zone - $275 ticket!
author: Ron J.

description: Very good sourdough  pizza! Service was ok. Pizza was tasty,  no dessert.  Nice location. Venue was clean. Staff was friendly
author: Kyle F.

description: Quite good!  Crisp, sourdough-tinged crust with good ingredients and flavor... Delivery is always hit-or-miss -- this was a hit!
author: Don N.

description: Goat Hill management: please get together, figure out why your previous regulars are no longer returning after your remodel, and fix it. I work in the neighborhood and would go to Goat Hill at least once a week - I knew all the servers, service was quick, loved their lunch menu (especially the soup and salad combo), and the atmosphere was warm and welcoming. I returned a few times after the remodel (hopeful with each visit) and I don't know if I'll ever return. They let go of their entire wait staff, the remodel feels cold and empty, their menu is significantly smaller (no more soup of the day, just minestrone which is blah), and the service was extremely slow. I've spoken to a few other regulars who feel the same way and are also not returning - please turn it back around!
author: Amy L.

description:
To the waitress with an attitude,

I asked what's in orange soda. She gave me an attitude and said "it's an orange soda". Perhaps let's me know if it's house made, or brand or..

I asked how much spaghetti is "half" portion. She gave me an attitude and said "it's half, I don't know, you want it in Ounce or something". Perhaps point to a container, or give me something to reference to..



If you are having a shitty day, stay home.
author: Henry W.

description: I would love to give this place 4-5 stars because the pizza is delicious and the price is reasonable, there is usually not a huge line or huge crowd, which I like. The problem is the screaming children that I have regularly noted in the restaurant. Last night we sat down for a nice pizza dinner and two couples with toddlers came in. One of these kids was shrieking so loudly about every 5 minutes at a pitch that could cause hearing loss (I am an ENT so I know). I know this is a kid friendly restaurant, but I think this behavior was above and beyond the level of tolerability and appropriateness in public ,and the wait staff probably should have done something to keep it more under control.
author: Hollin C.

description:
As of writing this, I have had Goat Hill pizza twice within a week, but five times in life. This is always a solid choice for take-out around Portrero Hill. Goat Hill pizza has delicious crust, fresh vegetables, and delicious cheese. The goat that this cheese comes from is a winner. Kidding, I am still curious why it is named goat hill.

Chicken florentine- has chicken, spinach, and mushroom. The chicken was a little dry. Mushroom and spinach are a perfect combo.

Hilda's - goat cheese, pesto and fresh tomatoes. This is by far my favorite. The goat cheese is delicious on this pizza.

Mediterranean - spinach, red onion, garlic, and feta cheese. Delicious cheese.

Overall, this place has delicious pizza, quick turnaround time when you call in to order, and the cheese is what makes it. It is also convenient to find parking.
author: Jaime F.

description:
I was very disappointed by my last Monday night all you can eat experience. I have come here for many years on Mondays and have always loved it! It's usually a great way to taste many different kinds of pizzas for a great price. However this past Monday we were made to wait an average of 20 minutes in between tiny slices of pizza. Usually the slice size is fine because they come with a good frequency, but this week it seemed like they wanted to wait and see if people would leave so they wouldn't have to feed them that much. It was quite a disappointment. I left after an hour and a half of mostly waiting and I only ate about half as much as I would have normally...(which I guess wasn't the worst thing for my health... but who goes to all-you-can eat for your health anyway?)

There were not many customers here on this night which might have factored into the slower service. But it seems to me like they should have a formula down to ensure that the frequency of pizza offered remains consistent no matter how many people are there.
author: Ryan F.

description:
If you're in Potrero Hill and unsure of what to eat for dinner, this is a solid little joint you should check out. I am a lover of all things pizza related and I'm always on the lookout for amazing pizza spots. Goat Hill Pizza came up on my radar and decided I should check out this cute neighborhood spot. I was genuinely pleased with the quality of the food and overall experience Goat Hill Pizza offered. 

Food:
Hilda's Favorite 
goat cheese, pesto, fresh tomatoes    17.95

My girlfriend and I had the most difficult time deciding which pizza to order because they all sound to die for. We ended up going with Hilda's Favorite and boy was it a good choice. I am super picky with my pizza but this place pretty much nailed everything I love about pizzas. Great sauce, check. Yummy cheese, check. Fresh toppings, check. I  honestly can't wait to be back and try more of their specialty pizzas. 

Service:
Great service. Everyone was super friendly and cordial. My friend and I stayed here just chatting even after we were finished eating dinner. I never felt pressured to leave. This place is really welcoming and they'll treat you like a regular even if it's your first time.

Atmosphere: 
If I owned my own pizza restaurant, I'd want it to look like Goat Hill Pizza. This place is super cute, straight-forward, not a hipster restaurant wannabe. Cozy, warm, welcoming. Solid spot for catching up with a friend over wine and pizza.
author: Stefany Z.

description:
Don't know how this was my first time here, but it was. Was just planning to walk by and pick up some pizza after putting in a yelp to-go order. I kinda felt bad for ordering three different individual slices, but oh well. The staff was friendly and I was given my food promptly. From the looks of it, it is a very cozy, family friendly environment to eat.

I simply got a pepperoni and Italian sausage slice, and I must say, I have never had a pizza quite like it. They use sourdough for their crust, which gives it a ridiculously nice crisp and extra flavor to compliment everything else. Quality ingredients everywhere else as well. Cheesy, and smooth red sauce. I'm a big fan.

Clearly now one of my go-to pizza places. Pizza done right. Good work. I'll be back, often.
author: Bryant C.

description:
Came here after BSF one night and I just had a craving for pizza that night. So I got the dinner for one on having a medium Portuguese to satisfy my pizza craving and it sure hit the spot!  The pizza is hot and fresh w/tasty ingredients. The crust especially is chewy and enjoyable to eat. 

Service was decent, got seated, served and got my soda refilled promptly. Parking is scarce as it shares it w/many other restaurants and a big residential area on a hill.
author: Eric T.

description:
A good standard for delicious pizza in Potrero Hill. I have several fond childhood memories of coming here after a soccer game, for a birthday party, etc., and chowing down on some seriously good pizza.

Fantastic, relaxed ambiance, very chill and helpful staff, and extremely reasonable prices given the area. Always worth supporting a local business!!
author: Claire S.

description: This place is great. Stopped in for a slice and some soup and I was not disappointed. The waitstaff are friendly and helpful and the minestrone soup (despite having some California funky vegetables) was very tasty and the garlic bread they provide with the soup was too good to pass up. I had a plain cheese slice and the sour dough crust is really great. All in all a great option.
author: Debra R.

description: Location not opened. No sign in the window to show that they're even under construction. So don't waste your time looking for parking like I did. Make sure to call before because they didn't even put a sign up to say they were under construction and looked at me like I was dumb when I went in expecting to eat pizza lol
author: Hope Y.

description:
We went there for lunch and had amazing pizza!

Half of it was artichoke, chicken, tomatoes and other half was chicken, goat cheese and pesto.

I never buy goat cheese - it tastes strange, but in this pizza it was very delicious ensemble.
Definitely will be back for lunch or dinner with friends. Place is cozy and gives home feeling.
author: Marianna P.

description: Good pizza but service suck.  Theresa was  not very attentive to our needs.  We had to get our own box for leftovers and when we finally got the check, we waited forever for someone to get since we were using credit card.   Finally, I said f this, I used cash to pay for my birthday dinner since I had enough on hand. And when we complained to person at the cashier, I was getting a whatever attitude.  Owners of businesses need to hire better people if you're going to be in the food service industry
author: M L.

description:
Short summary: bomb wings, must get garlic bread (with cheese), pizza size example is above the kitchen

I came here with a group around 9pm on a Friday night. I'm just going to assume that we were being a bit loud and chatty but no one seemed to give us any death glares, whew. I had the best garlic bread with cheese I've ever tasted right in this little restaurant. Ah-mazing. I originally said "oh I'll just have half of a piece". Nope, I ended up eating pretty much half of the whole plate. 

The atmosphere was super cozy, food came out quickly, and the servers never hovered. I got my drink refilled when it got empty, but they stayed away for the meal. BEST part? We left around 11pm and in the Uber, we looked up the restaurant and realized they close at 10:30 :c They literally just stayed open and stuck around for us (we were the last party left in there just chatting stupidly) without rushing us at all! Props to the service :D
author: Lani C.

description:
The pizza is really just ok but the price is really not ok
I ordered a pizza to go. They asked for my name when I was ordering so I think they probably call my name when the pizza is ready. Obviously not. I was there waiting for 25 minutes, then I came to the front desk and asked. She turned back and got me my pizza. No sorry, no thank you, not even a smile. 
It was not a busy day at this place. 
I didn't finish the pizza bc it is too salty.
author: Yi L.

description:
My brothers live up the street so I've been here a couple times. It's so awesome! You can get pizza by the slice and it's delicious! You can get a meatball sub and it's delicious! On Mondays, you can get ALL YOU CAN EAT PIZZA and it's freakin awesome! In life, I haven't really been disappointed eating pizza but this place is a step above. 

The dough is sourdough or something so it is also very tasty. My mom who never eats crust at all the crust! You should for sure come here and get a pizza with whatever you like and it'll be worth it! No need to go more into the city to go to overpriced and crowded pizza places. This will be your new go to spot for pizza and you'll never look at goats the same again!
author: Jason W.

description:
Excellent service, great quality pizza. After walking up and down the hills of Potrero you do work up an appetite. Good sized slices, I shared a medium pizza with my kids. Half cheese the other the special Combination.

Wonderful experience. No crowd on a weekday afternoon. Street parking (good luck) Just walk, Uber or Lyft. One of the many delicious spots along 18th. Would definitely come again when in the area.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
It's a Wednesday night and my boy and I are looking for a bite. Since moving to Potrero a few months ago, I've wanted to try Goat Hill Pizza but never got the chance to. Sometimes I am wary about bringing my pizza aficionado friend places, as he's very particular about his pies, but I've heard good reviews so off we went. We ordered half Meat Lover for him, half Porky Pie for me. 

Meat lover is your standard salty, greasy, meaty goodness of pepperoni and sausage. 

Porky pie was generously spread with red onion, bacon, and whole roasted creamy garlic cloves. So fragrant! Some acidity would have been appreciated to cut through the unctuousness of the pie though. 

The crust was extremely crisp and thin in the middle, with nice chew on the outer edge. The roof of my mouth suffered 3 days and 3 nights following this meal, mostly due to my zealous consumption of pizza crust. 

Overall, a good pick for pizza in Potrero.
author: Shirley V.

description:
This is a great pizza joint!  As being a bit of a pizza purest, I was a little hesitant about the sour dough crust.  However, if I didn't know better I could not have guessed it.  

I got the lunch combo, large two topper slice with a side salad for $7.95.  It was a good slice and the cheese was melted properly.  Cheese on a reheat can be touch and go.  They got it right.  I also shared the two meatball appetizer.  This was the best thing that I ate.  Tons of minced garlic, a blend of beef and pork, and the mozzarella melted on the top made it just right. 

Good napkins

What did I learn today?  If you don't like beans in your salad ask them hold the beans.
author: Ryan C.

description:
My favorite pizza in the city! Love the crunchy thin sourdough crust with corn meal and the inventive flavor combinations. The ingredients are fresh and the pizzas are never greasy. The service is always friendly and quick.

We come here almost every month on Mondays for the all you can eat pizza nights. You can sample all their different pies plus some extra ones. There's a neighborhood feel to the place that I love!
author: Ly P.

description:
This pizza still holds up as the best pizza.
            I gave all stars before and I stick to it once again.      The seasonings and everything's are just incredible.  The staff and Goat Hill Pizza as a whole is just soo soo awesome.
I love the smiles I get coming in here and the servers serving my pizza.
They have the coolest attitudes and they serve my pizza so excellently.
I love the smell when I can smell that pizza coming to me. 
Even before it comes too me , mmm..That smell is soo good I feel sorry for people who haven't experienced the pizza here.
Please everyone do us a favor and check this place out.
THis place is my go to place for my volunteer group onebrick.org whenever we work the food bank, its always a must we come here every time. 

The parking is actually really good here also.

THis is also a great place for families also.
author: Luke S.

description: Nice neighborhood place in Potrero Hill.  We came on a Monday night when they have their neighborhood nights where for $13 you can as much pizza as you can handle plus the salad bar.  It's like dim sum for pizza!  They have servers going around with different types of pizza cut in smaller sizes.  You select the ones you want.  They started slow so we got what ever pizza came out, but they came out more frequently with more interesting pizzas later in the evening.  Unfortunately we were all pretty full by then with cheese and pepperoni pizza!   I'm usually a NY pizza snob, but the pizza here had fresh ingredients and a crunchy crust.  Service was friendly and that's something you don't usually get with NY pizza.
author: Ronny T.

description: Things have changed here.  My lunch pasta no longer includes salad, garlic bread, soup.  Also very little pasta, but for the same price as before.  Wait time was 20mins.  Never coming back, very disappointed.   They screwed up big time, and tarnished a good name.
author: Pose M.

description:
Been here twice now and on both occasions ordered pizza for take out. There wasn't anything mind-blowing, just good pizza. I especially liked the sourdough crust which was medium sized - it made the pizza nice and hearty. The toppings were generous and the pizzas always came to me hot, especially when I called in ahead of time. 

If you're gonna call in an order, be sure they have your name and order right before hanging up. I dealt with a new employee over the phone and almost had a scare when I showed up and they couldn't find my order of two extra large pizzas. It is off the beaten path, but a good spot if you happen to be in the area. Parking is very easy to find.
author: Josh L.

description:
The pizza here was a complete letdown, that'd be more justifiable if cheaper, but at almost 40 bucks, this pizza was extremely dry and the ingredients rather sparing, and even the selling point--the sour dough crust--was too burnt to be enjoyed.

On top of that, the delivery man took nearly 2 hours to get here, despite being promised in an hour to an hour and 15 minutes.

This place couldn't possibly be a front for Pelosi's money laundering, as the pizza is garbage, and no one would believe that such a place could ever be capable of handling so much cash.

Oh well, at least they have a cool box I guess.
author: Stevie D.

description:
I can't count the amount of times my work has ordered take out from Goat Hill so it was finally nice to try their pizza in person made to order without the delivery gap. 

While not surprised, it was definitely far better at the restaurant than delivered. The crust had a great bite, the toppings held together and overall a solid balance of savoriness. You were able to taste the pizza more, if that makes sense, and pick up on the smaller nuances that were lost in transit. 

Flavor combinations are varied so it should be able to satisfy a wide range of palates or you can build your own

Overall Thoughts

Brick and mortar pizza any day over delivery but still a delicious option either way
author: Eddie W.

description: This place is awful. I really mean that. To start off the restaurant walls are filled with creepy pictures of goats. Who wants that? And I waited so long for one pie. I waited so long in that creepy restaurant. And when I finally got the pizza I was thoroughly disappointed. It tasted so bad. The pizza tasted worse than every frozen pizza I've had in my life. Don't come here.
author: Daniel S.

description: The Potrero Hill location is back at it! This is my favorite pizza place -- it's unpretentious, a great bargain, quality food, with a sneakily beautiful view out the window.
author: Diane S.

description: Still the go to spot for sourdough pie! I've been eating here since 2001 and it hasn't change.  Special combination is still the bomb.  Staff really nice and if you're a local come early evening for family night all you can eat!
author: Robert C.

description: Our favorite sourdough crust pizza! The crust really is amazing, always crisp and cooked perfectly. They've got great combinations of toppings, our favorite being the Greek. They also deliver, which is almost as good as eating there, sometimes just needs to be heated up to get the crust nice and crispy again. They also give you a free pizza on your birthday, bonus!
author: Nicolas H.

description: I heard they have the best pizza and all you can eat pizza night have to go try it best pizza place ever
author: Tanisha B.

description:
+Cute warm and friendly ambiance.  Feels like a family pizza joint.

+Servers are really nice and they even have markers for the kids

+Sourdough thin crust OMG.  I love thin crust pizza and this was perfect, light and crispy and delicious.  If you're not into thin crust, move along.

-Cheese slid off when we picked up slices of pizza. We still ate it though
author: Mui K.

description: As a long time Potrero Hill resident, not sure what's going on with this "institution on the hill"  but it's not good. Our experience since they reopened after the remodel has been horrendous. Tonight was our third bad experience in the past 3 weeks. Whether it's ordering pizza for carry out that isn't ready after 35-40 minutes OR having to go back 2x in 10 days b/c we got home and our order wasn't correct (missing salad dressing, wrong toppings on pizza)....it's pretty clear something has changed at Goat Hill. But my favorite part was the manager woman who just said in a ho-hum manner, "sorry" clearly articulated she could care less. Very sad because this used to be a neighborhood gem. Goodbye Goat Hill, we'll be taking our business elsewhere....maybe others will do the same and you'll wake up.
author: Jon F.

description:
what the hell happened here?  used to be great pizza in a fun homey place.....but.....no more.....

-pizza no longer has the great sourdough/cornmeal flavor...you might as well go to a sbarros
-and why so many burnt pies now?
-some of the best pie in town is no longer
-remodel of the place has turned a warm neighborhood joint into a sterile-as-hell unwelcoming spot
-monday night all-u-can-eat not good anymore....no salad bar, less pizza varieties passing around, pies don't even come around as much
-staff seems like mostly new, mostly don't know how to do much, mostly inefficient as all get out and never checkin' up on ya

gone there hundreds of times over the decades, but no longer....three visits since the renovation and all three were strikes - 'yurout'
author: west h.

description: Sadly this place is no longer what it was. Have been a customer for almost 8 years. Now the staff doesn't even notice if anyone enters the restaurant. It took for ever to get the attention of someone to takre my order. Then another 35 minutes to be served a cold lasagna. Then another 30 min wait for a the second warm lasagne to surface. The staff is clueless and the foot is bland and boring. Not worth retuning.
author: Gab S.

description:
Stumbled in here and was probably one of the only places open in Potrero Hill on a Saturday night. Ordered the buffalo wings and a special combo pizza. Wings weren't oily or greasy and good wing size not overly battered. 

The pizza was bangin! Legit pizza. It's hard to find that good good pizza amid all the places you can get pizza but Goat Hill is one of those rare locations. They do not try to be fancy and keep it simple with good quality ingredients.

If I'm ever in the area again I know this place won't fail me.
author: Garreth G.

description: Monday nights on Potrero Hill will never be the same.  The All You Can Eat Night was not just gluttony, it was a community celebration.  ALL of the friendly staff have been replaced by sullen teenagers begrudgingly going through the motions.  Gone is the salad bar, the placemat art, the kids-for-free charge (Really?  Charging for the 2 small slices each that they manage?).  The pizza is not as good either--the characteristic sourdough crust is flatter and denser than before.  Having had so many special dinners there (my kids' go-to choice for birthdays and other special occasions) I'm not just disappointed, I'm heartbroken.  I was skeptical of other complaints I saw online--not one to begrudge change just for change's sake.  Sadly, it's worse than I could have imagined because all of the heart is gone from the place.
author: Victoria D.

description: Omg the wAit is horrible they don't honor the wait time. When we first got here they said 20min so I asked them they changed it to 45 min wait after waiting 25 min. Not nice at all.
author: gladys m.

description:
Goat Hill's pizzas are reminiscent of the ones from my childhood, & unfortunately I think that's why I didn't develop that universal love affair with pizza that humans seemingly share. I got the impression that our large-sized pie was not fresh, perhaps because the slices were dried out. At the edges, their sourdough crust is thick, doughy, & had the texture of being somewhat undercooked, but thankfully, was thin & nicely cooked where the toppings lay. 

We ordered: 
-- 1/2 order of spaghetti & meatballs: did not try, received a lukewarm, "it's okay" from dining partner 
-- 1/2 porky pie (bacon, red onion, roasted garlic, garlic cream sauce -- needed more sauce, was not as garlicky as the ingredients led me to believe) & 1/2 special combination (think: typical combo of meats & veggies -- toppings were not evenly distributed, nothing special about this special combo.)
-- root beer 
-- Total: $41 not including tip (which is much, much more than I'd like to spend for this quality.) 

We're not shy about polishing off an obscene amount of pizza, so the fact that there were 4 of the 10 not-so-large slices left is an indication that there will be no repeat visits in the future. 

I will say -- service was friendly & food arrived quickly.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
A dude plays the piano here. That is reason enough for a positive review. Dang son, we in Nordstrom or something? Live music while you shop (or eat). 

We came on a weekday evening, and the place was poppin'. Clearly a family favorite, neighborhood joint. Love all the framed children artwork on the wall. 

A group shared the house salad, cheese bread, and 3 pizzas (Hilda's Favorite, Chicken Florentine, and Special Combo). 

I read good reviews about Hilda's Favorite (get me in on some pesto, goat cheese, and tomatoes). I love pesto, so this pizza was definitely tasty. Though I actually preferred the Chicken Florentine (chicken, mushrooms, and spinach). I'm a sucker for some sauteed/ cooked mushrooms and spinach. 

I brought the leftovers home to eat the next day. And I cracked a sunny side egg atop the pizza to be all shishi, frufru, I'm-so-hip-with-my-runny-egg-on-pizza. And actually, it's really tasty. Crack an egg to jazz up any leftovers, mang.
author: Joanna L.

description: Goat Hill Pizza has been a fave of mine for about 16 years. It was homey, neighborhood pizza restaurant that wasn't pretentious and served great pizza. I loved to go for the all-you-can-eat Neighborhood Night on Mondays when servers carried whole pies around and you could get a slice of whatever toppings appealed to you. It was a great way to try different combinations. I would always go with a friend and be greeted Jorge, who always knew we wanted a carafe of the house wine. We'd get our table and head for the salad bar for some pre-pizza ruffage. Goat Hill closed this summer for renovations and re-opened last week. We went in tonight for Neighborhood Night and found the renovations to be rather insignificant. Someone apparently spent several months finding every possible way to remove all of the charm and warmth of what made Goat Hill welcoming, leaving a plain, nondescript echo of its former self in seafoam green. Jorge was nowhere to be seen, nor any other familiar face. When someone got around to coming to our table, we asked if the restaurant had changed hands and were surprisingly told no. They've expanded the kitchen in front to obviously cater more to take-out and delivery and put up an odd, cheap wall to separate the dining area. The salad bar is gone, replaced by unlimited salad that is brought to your table with a selection of all the salad bar toppings. This seems like a huge waste since I can't imagine anyone likes every topping on their salad, thus resulting in the leftovers needing to be thrown out.  Wine was no longer available by the carafe, but rather by the bottle. We begrudgingly ordered a bottle and asked for the salad. When asked what dressing we wanted from the usual Italian, 1000 Island, Blue Cheese, & Ranch varieties, we asked for just Balsamic. The young woman serving us said "we don't have that yet". Wha?! I'm thinking she doesn't know what Balsamic vinegar is and just said no rather than asking. At this point the number of detractors of this "new" Goat Hill had been enough. We apologized and told our server we changed our minds.  I doubt very seriously that my review will be the only negative review to come out of the destruction of what had truly been a wonderful family restaurant.  RIP Goat Hill. You will be missed.
author: Dana E.

description: They let me in and I ordered pizza, staff was awesome and chatted with me, mum enjoyed her pizza. great place to hangout. I will make mom come back soon.
author: Roxi R.

description:
I am not usually a fan of pizza but they use sourdough here and it is delicious!!!!

I got the chicken artichoke (extra large to share with 5 people)- comes with marinara sauce (not sure why I thought it would come with white sauce) but anyway it was still pretty good!!! They cut the slices smaller than normal pizza slices so it's easier to eat/share. They put a decent amount of the ingredients and it was pretty good quality. We also got a side order of a dozen wings with ranch - super juicy and easy to eat (the outside of the wings aren't the fried kind). 

Total was around $43 but it was enough to share with 5-6 people and we had couple slices leftover as well. 

If I was craving pizza I'd def come back here again!
author: Jessie H.

description:
Terrible.  

This place's reputation (much like its web site) was made in a different time.  A time where the pizza offerings in SF sucked serious ass.  If you want to travel to that time, eat this pizza.  It's like a doughy time machine to mediocrity and despair.

We ordered two pies, total cost was $55 for a medium and a large. What a waste of money.  

Go to Little Star, Arinell's, Pizza Hacker or literally the dozens of other places that are far better than this dump.
author: Saminda W.

description:
Don't do it.

You've been warned.

We were so excited to wrap up our work week by eating delicious pizza.

My husband ordered a custom pizza, and I ordered the Greek Gourmet. 50 bucks later, we received the following:

Weak crust, as in tasteless
Generic, out-of-a-can-tasting-sauce
Decent toppings

Gross, we regretted ordering it instantly.

Not sure who thinks this place is good. We could've ordered Little Star for the same price and had a Friday feast. Eff this, we threw it away.

Dominoes would've hooked up a better pizza than the disaster we received.

Never again. Nunca.

Asco.
author: Gabriela W.

description: Ordered 4 slices and they were all extra crispy and a shade or two above burnt. Super disappointed. I couldn't even eat the crust, which I like to eat first, because it was too hard from being overcooked.
author: Tameika E.

description: Awesome little pizza joint! Great tasting pizza and all for a reasonable price. I had the garlic cream sauce with garlic, onion, and bacon and it was lovely. A decent beer selection and super cute artwork of crayon drawings on placemats.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Forty YEARS, this is a real long lasting joint, Ima hoping Goat Hill celebrates 40 YEARS ! Great pizza (having had most of their variations) & appetizers (yum HOTwings) & salads. Maintaining quality and uniqueness is perhaps not as easy as Goat Hill has made it look, with all of the comings and goings of so many S.F. restaurants. Many restaurants fall prey to the whims of the 'foodie' scene, some fall prey to their own shortcomings, or the greed of the SF landlord. This is the type of joint that deserves celebration! Ima member of the "frequent pizza whatever program" they have, but I tend to lose the little card, so I ask for a new one each time I get a pizza, saving them in a safe place. 

Check out their beginnings: 

http://goathill.com/about-us

Go Goat HIll !
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Fabulous with kids! Gluten free crust!!
So good that a nine year old immediately recognized the name from a visit 2 years ago - and he cheered up! Yeah!!!
author: Javon F.

description: Tried calling to make an order for pickup, they took the order, name, and phone number then immediately put me on hold. After 10 minutes on hold I hung up and called back to find out they never even put in the order in.
author: Mac L.

description:
There is one thing I am picky about - and that is pizza. I hail from New Haven, CT, where we arguably have some of the best pizza in the US. 

I like my pizza thin, smoky, bubbly, tangy, and of course with a heavy hand of cornmeal covering the bottom. Ive tried my fare share of SF pizza, too. 

After moving in down the hill, the BF and I got one large pizza to-go and boy were we delightfully surprised. Goat Hill is REALLY GOOD. Like you can taste the love that went into making it. Something about the dough was really on point. 

The ambience is old school, no-nonsense, and there was a man playing piano! It was SO COOL! The spot even smelled like the pizzerias I grew up going to, something I had yet to experience in SF.

Though Goat Hill is a little pricier than I'd like, it's not unreasonable, just SF. Get your butt up the hill to this place and refine your pizza palette. You're welcome.
author: Ainslee S.

description: I was really excited to try this place as I am temporarily staying in Potrero Hill. Disclaimer: I am new to the area so the pricing may be comparable to other similar pizza restaurants in SF and I would just not know; however, the prices seemed really really high for 1 pizza. Being gluten free I know I will always pay a little more for pizza than for a regular pizza, but $22 for 1 medium gluten free pizza with just pepperoni on it was a lot more than I expected. It also was just only "good" I would not say it's nearly the best pizza I've had. I will not be ordering again. P.S. I didn't appreciate that the register said "God knows when you don't tip," look I am usually a good tipper but don't make me feel guilty for not tipping on a carry out order when it's $22 for 1 pizza.
author: Olivia H.

description: One star because the spaghetti was nothing special, the portion is too small, and the waiter was not patient.
author: Mandy Z.

description: Can't actually write a review about the food, but I can let you know that the service here is spectacular. Had to pick up a large sum of gift certificates (yes, they are old school with the paper) and it couldn't have been easier. I contacted them via email and David Sturno responded. He completely hooked us up by grouping the gift certificates into separate orders. Not only was he courteous, but was very quick to respond. His customer service skills were on point. We will definitely stay for the food next time! Thanks David!!
author: Kathy K.

description: I was back in San Francisco on a business trip this month and came here with some coworkers for a quick dinner before our evening event. I lived in San Francisco for 14 years and was always in search of pizza places that reminded me of the family restaurants back in New England.  This place definitely had that feel. Service was quick and attentive, and we had a pretty big group with folks arriving at different times. Everyone had drinks when they needed them and the pizza came quickly. It was SOOOO good, some of the best I've had in years.  Family friendly- they have coloring sheets for the kids (and adults!) and put the artwork up on the wall. Really feels like you're spending time in a friend's pizza parlor on the East Coast- but with that San Francisco hallmark sourdough crust.
author: Sooz K.

description:
Makes the best veggie lasagna. Most places cannot George egg plant right, GH has nailed it. Every veggie dish I eaten is amazing. It's true the parking is horrible but the food is worth the visit. 

My only dislike is it's time for NEW FURNITURE. SERIOUSLY. TABLES A WOBBLY, BENCHES AND STOOLS ARE EXTREMELY HARD. YHIS MAKES VISIT UNCOMFORTABLE.
author: Tippy T.

description: Neighborhood spot with a bit of old NY pizza joint vibe - except with a bajillion children's crayon drawings about Goat Hill Pizza for decor. Solid thin crust - 12 inch is perfect for 2 to share and they do halvesies! The margherita (not really on the menu but they can make it if you ask) was tasty but the crust center a bit soggy from the sauce. For the other half we made our own with artichoke and roasted garlic  and that was goooood. If no plans to make out with anyone for the rest of the day, DO get the roasted garlic. The best spot for pizza in SF East of the 101.
author: Snuffles B.

description:
Wait, do I really trust a restauyrant with a goat as it's logo? Well of course I do! Haven't you heard? GOAT = Greatest Of All Time. So Goat Hill Pizza must be the best pizza to grace this planet right? Well, it was good! Maybe their version of GOAT is goodest of all time...

Popped in here for lunch. Got myself a salad and a slice of pizza. Salad was pretty tasty actually. Loved that it came with peppercini's. I could eat those suckers for the rest of my life. Pizza was pretty okay too. I mean, all I ordered was just pepperoni and mushroom pizza. Can't really expect all too much from that, but it was definitely a pretty solid tasting slice of dough. 

Service was pretty nice, and the price for a slice/salad combo was definitely doable. Would I be back for more? Definitely.
author: Sean H.

description: Got pizza from here for several group events. Never disappointed. Good crust. Great ingredients/toppings. Lots of options. Easy to satisfy a lot of people.
author: Jen A.

description:
Wow, prices were recently updated - A huge percentage. I understand price increases but wow. It will be a long time before I order another pizza for take out.

I realized after looking at other pizza establishments that Goat Hill is right in line with other pizza establishments.  In order to be fair - I retract my " not so positive" comment. Staying in business in San Francisco is no small task and I would be sad to see Goat Hill leave Potrero Hill. Keep up the good work.
author: Cindy J.

description:
5pm, tomorrow is the 3rd of July and a day off from the office.

Me: "I'd like to order a pie for pickup"...gives relevant information.

Them: "it'll be ready in 20 minutes"

We both hang up.

At on or about 20 minutes my Medium, half Porky Pie half Meat Lovers and full order of Garlic Bread (w cheese) was ready.

Four Stars.
author: James G.

description:
It's bordering on five stars.  In fact, five stars it would be if it weren't for all the Potrero Hill brats bratting this place up at all times after four p.m.

Sourdough pizza crust always sounds better than it ends up being.  Always.  Always, that is, except when it's from Goat Hill Pizza.  The toppings are fresh, and you can do creative by-the-slice while you're sitting at a table enjoying the lovely view.  I've never had the pasta, but the salads are good as well.

If you're eating in, it can take a while for anyone to notice you're standing there like you're supposed to.  I don't feel like enough of a regular to just plop myself down in the back dining room, but I'm getting there.  Oh, and choose the back if you've got a choice.  Unless you can sit on the tiny side facing Connecticut Street.  Then choose that.  But only if you've got kids with you, because then they'll be as far away as possible from me.

Once you're seated, the service is excellent.  I've only had one vaguely bad service experience, and it wasn't really her fault because some muckety-muck was muckety-mucking everything uppity-up.  And there were tons of brats that day.

I like the old-timey piano, mainly because it's out of tune and constantly stacked with neighborhood flyers and circulars.  I want my cousin Greg to come one day just to play it.  But he'd probably be drowned out by the brats.

The logo is perfect, and the "Don't Worry!" ad campaign is iconicish and very effective (I came, didn't I?).  I'm vaguely sad that there are multiple locations.  If you want to feed your lovely children Goat Hill Pizza, be kind and please take it to go.
author: John S.

description: We ordered the veggie pizza it was inedible due to the insane amount of raw garlic on it. I also found a piece of pepperoni hiding in a veggie pizza.
author: Nathan R.

description: Nice pizza and fast service. Not the best pizza in the city but it is good and they get it out quick. Family friendly and a decent beer selection.  Nice views from the window seats. We had a Hilda and a Portuguese pizza and preferred the Hilda for flavor despite expecting the Linguese sausage to be a little more spicy than it was which took away from the overall flavor. Had the salad which is basically a boring mix of lettuce and some basic veggies. Save the room for pizza instead.
author: Mark L.

description:
My son and I are always on the hunt for good pizza, but this time; we didn't travel far. 

We stayed right in our comfort zone and had pizza at the well-known Goat Hill Pizza. 

My son is 8, so it took a little convincing for him to eat here. He kept saying "this doesn't look like a pizza place!"

As we were waiting to he seated another couple came in behind us. The waiter walks up and proceeds to look over me and my son. I had to let him know that we had been waiting before them. There was no apology given (hence the four stars) from the waiter. 

It was definitely an awkward moment, but I didn't want to ruin my son first experience at Goat Hill, so I didn't make a big deal

After looking over the menu we decided on a small cheese pizza for my son (his absolute favorite) and spinach ravioli stuffed with fresh spinach and feta paired with meatballs in a delicious meat sauce. 

Waiting for our food I checked in with my Yelp app and was notified that I could unlock a free appetizer of cheesy garlic bread (that Jeremy and I enjoyed very much)!

As conversation between child and I continued over yummy (FREE) cheesy bread, our food arrived. 

Everything was delicious!

The ravioli was amazing and the pizza was just right; no complaints from Jeremy. 

It was such a nice way to end a long week. 

And to put icing on the cake as we were leaving I asked Jeremy if I could take a picture of him in front of Goat Hill, and before he declined my offer a very nice passerby offered to take a picture of the both of us.  

Now isn't that PERFECT?
author: Tiffany F.

description:
My favorite pizza joint in the city.  Porky pie is my favorite.   Huge chunks of soft garlic, better than Escape from New York pizza.  

Our service for lunch was awesome and came by several times to refill our drinks.  I think our server last time was Emily. If you get her, you're going to be happy.
author: Calvin D.

description:
Nice location, good prices but the food wasn't good at all. I had a pizza with chicken, mushroom and spinach...the worst pizza ever!The chicken tasted old.
Never again!
author: Federica C.

description: We were very disappointed with our pizza. The crust was ok, but nothing out of this world. They skimped on the toppings and there was definitely not enough sauce. Plus, it was $25 bucks for a medium pizza that looked more like a small. No thanks!
author: Melanie B.

description:
Pizza and salad lunch special!!
Great Sourdough crust!
Best lunch deal!!
Always a treat.
author: Zeik G.

description:
A good pizza place in the City.

Still exploring my food options in SF, I was still finding my "go-to" pizza place. After getting suggestions from coworkers and cross referencing with Yelp, Goat Hill sounded like the best option. My friend and I decided to go check it out after work one day.

We ended up getting there sometime around 8:00pm, so parking and seating was no problem. With that, we were served pretty quickly. I'm not sure how it is on peek hours, but it wasn't busy on my visit. There was a lot to choose from on the menu, but I needed to check out of pizza of course, so we settled on the Porky Pie Pizza with a side of Mozzarella Covered Garlic Bread and an order of Anchor Steam Beer.

We received the Bread and Beer pretty quickly. The Bread was priced good for giant servings, smothered with Mozzarella. The only thing is, you need to eat it while its still hot, or the cheese would tighten up on you. While still eating our appetizer, our Pizza came out. Their famous sourdough topped with Bacon, Roasted Garlic, Red Onion, and Garlic Cream Sauce. The pricing is in the higher end compared to similar restaurants. I liked the pizza a lot. I personally didn't notice a difference with the sourdough crust though.

I would definitely come back and try more of the menu. Check them out sometime!
author: Robert O.

description:
I can't, for the life of me, figure out why this place is so popular!  I've been here about five times, over about the past eight years, and it never improves, and never impresses me.  In fact, the only reason I ever go here is because it is a favorite of two friends of mine who insist that we go here on Monday nights for the all-you-can-eat deal.

Fine.  I like my friends.  I don't generally care for their taste in food, and this is no exception.

The pizza crust is cardboard-y, flavorless, and there is seldom enough cheese on the pizza for my taste.  The sauce is just average, a bit too heavy on the tomato-paste-flavor for my preference.  I prefer a lighter, more fresh-tomato-y, less acidic sauce...and I prefer less of it on my pizza in general.

The toppings are fine, although I am someone who prefers plain cheese or margherita pizza.  They get very intricate with their blends of toppings on Monday nights, but honestly?  Unless you're omnivorous, you'll starve long before they walk around with enough flavors that you like.

That's the other thing that bugs me:  The all-you-can-eat deal is kind of, well, cheesy.  Or not, depending on how you look at it!  Here's the deal:  you get seated only if you have your entire party present, a server takes your drink order, and then you simply wait until servers walk around with different pies and offer you a super-tiny-sliver of a slice.  The plate they give you is paper.  No, I'm not kidding.  Yes, this is tacky and wasteful.  If I wanted to eat off of paper plates, I'd just order a pie to go, and go sit and eat it in Dolores Park, away from the uber-loud din at Goat Hill.

Simply put, there isn't enough pizza to go around.  As they get busier, it seems that the servers walk over to your table with less frequency, and so you sit there, hungrily awaiting the next slice of pretty much ANY kind of pizza, because at that point, you're starving.

And since the crust is so awful, you have to wrestle with your voice, who insists that if you don't like something, you don't have to eat it...but then you remind yourself that you don't know when (or if!) the next slice might arrive, so you should eat anything on your plate to ward off starvation.  Given the crust to rest-of-slice ratio, you'll be eating a lot of bland, empty carbs.

If you're like me, after a while, you get tired of waiting for a slice of something you'd want to eat to actually pass by, and eventually the noise gets to be too much, the chair gets too uncomfortable, and you just want to leave.  So you pay your $12.95 plus tax and tip, and head out...and realize as you walk out the door into the blessed fresh air and relative quiet that for what you paid for those 5 tiny little slices that maybe amounted to a real slice and a half of pizza, you could've bought an entire pizza somewhere else, wouldn't have had to wait for each bit to be doled out, and would've left without a headache from the noise.

Seriously.  I don't get why grown-ups who don't have kids and have access to neighborhoods other than Bernal Heights would pay $13 for this experience, unless they are endlessly patient, and have such a huge appetite that they somehow manage to eat their money's worth!

As for me?  Next time my friends invite us to join them for "pizza in the city", I'll cajole them to let me choose the place...after all, after 8 years, haven't I waited my turn?!
author: Amy L.

description: I love coming here for salad, wings and pizza. Cozy pizza place with great service. Typically we order the chef salad, wings (extra cooked) and a large pizza. We switch up our pizza so we're trying some different when we come in.
author: Irma R.

description: Called for delivery,  quoted for an hr and they came at about an hr and 15 minutes. Pretty dissapointed from the bat, no napkins, plates or cheese and chili peppers. $28 for a large special combo pizza. The pizza was mediocre. I was tols the large is 12 slices over the phone, it was 10. They soecialize in sourdough bread. Maybe thatsbwhy they are so spcecial and they got such good reviews for being different. The bread is heavy. Tried it once, Wouldn't go try it or call for delivery again.
author: Jessica W.

description:
The first time I visited Goat Hill was back in June 2006 for their Monday night pizza buffet. Since then, I've returned over and over again, and -- whether for the pizza buffet or for one of their thin-crust pies -- it's always been reliably delicious.

As a pescetarian, I particularly appreciate the range of vegetarian-friendly options offered during the Monday night pizza buffet. Last night I had 13 slices, 12 of which were different types of veggie pizza, including toppings like sun-dried tomato, artichoke hearts, spinach, green olives, goat cheese, bell peppers, and more. The non-vegetarian slice included veggies and anchovies -- perfect for a pescetarian like me! For the meat eaters, there also were several options available, including pies with linguiça, bacon, or chicken, as well as a meat lover's pizza.

Rounding out the Monday night menu is a salad bar with options like pepperoncinis, bell peppers, black olives, chickpeas, and onions. While the veggie quality/variety is nothing special, the salad bar offers a nice counterbalance to the pizza onslaught.

In my experience over the past decade, Goat Hill has been a consistently solid spot for pizza -- it's truly a neighborhood gem for Potrero Hill residents, and the perfect place for anyone looking for all-you-can-eat pizza on a Monday night.
author: Eric L.

description:
It hit me almost instantly, moments after taking a seat at Goat Hill Pizza:  "It's rare that I'm actually hungry".  

All those meals, all these years and apparently all I ever do is refill a half-full tank.  

Goat Hill Pizza on a Monday night is a great place to go when you're actually hungry.  Monday night is AYCE night where a ridiculously reasonable $12.95 buys you all the pizza you want and unfettered access to a simple, completely adequate salad bar.
