description: Solid pizza and they don't skimp on the ingredients here. They pile it on so each slice is substantial. The dough has a nice give to it and will keep your mouth entertained while you reach for the next slice. Don't believe goat is a topping here unfortunately.
author: John B.

description:
time for a new yelp ? or at least a different rating system. Sadly most American's have exceptionally low standards when it comes to good food.
here's what's wrong with this restaurant...
cheap food ingredients.
nothing was organic 
house salad consisted mainly of iceberg. very cheap salad dressing.(nothing homemade about this what so ever).
very poor wine list (in this town? how do they get away that?)
very basic beer selections
 no such thing as thin crust, i should have realized when calling for a res, "do you make thin crust?, response: "think we can do that for you" .... big red flag. 
very noisy & hot inside, a really uncomfortable dining experience.
author: Nick l.

description:
Monday is "Neighborhood Night" at Potrero Hill from 4:00-10:00 pm.

All-you-can-eat pizza and salad . . . 10.95
 
Children ages 6-12 . . . 5.95
author: HY L.

description:
SO I reactivated my yelp account to tell you guys how much this place sucks ass.

3 hungry BFFs exchanging Christmas gifts at a pizza parlor. I know right.

We used a Groupon which the place didn't know until the end so I'm sure the horrible service was not due to the coupon. A few things that went wrong in chronological order:

A) The kitchen brought out the wrong pizza, half of it anyhow since we're allow to order 2 different halves. BFF #1 gave a "do something about this since we have to wait another 15mins" look to John, our waiter. He offered garlic bread which was nice, but he brought out two dinky pieces for THREE people.

B) We politely asked the blond hostess to take a picture of us with our food. She said one second so she could seat the incoming family which was fine. She didn't come back at all. She only apologize insincerely and mentioned that she was going to take it for us as soon as she saw another customer taking the picture.

C) As John was cleaning our table, a fork fell off the white plate, grazed the victory roll by my left eye, and finally fell on the floor after my lap in slow motion as BFF #2 described. What is it with people here and insincere apologies?

Anyhow, the pizza was alright, nothing too special. If you have kids that scream a lot, you can bring them here to join the rest.
author: Eileen W.

description:
What a shame not to try this place after reading such great reviews. 
Service sucked, we didn't even stay. Waited 10 minutes to get seated and plenty of open tables not even "bussed" yet. Sat down and waited another 15 minutes. We got up and left, changed up our tasting pallets and went to sushi @ Umi, sooo good!
Maybe might try on a Monday night, when all you can eat pizza is on the menu.
author: DayDay D.

description:
Apparently I started this review 2 years ago. Looking at my draft all I had written was "The pizza isn't terrible."

Yep, that pretty much sums it up. 

This place is good in a pinch or if you have kids with you, but other than that, I don't think it's worth going out of your way for.
author: Deborah G.

description:
I know I am going to get it for saying this but I don't really care for Pizza.  Goat Hill is your typical pizza place with the normal options like combo, Hawaiian etc. The crust is chewy but that seems to be the trend unless you get some thin crust joint.    

For me what counts in a pizza place or most places is that they serve beer on tap and Goat hill delivers.  Its a very small assortment of beers but thats really all I need. 

Great place for kids and small parties.
author: Joseph M.

description:
Highlights:
1. Learning from the lovely owner there used to be REAL GOATS living in the backyard (which is now an extended dining room.)  There were 3 of them--the mama and two babies.  The owner watched the goat give birth to one goat...and then five minutes later (to their surprise), to ANOTHER!
2. Monday night pizza night---unlimited pizza for 10.95!
3. Delicious pizza!!!!!  And it kept coming out!  I was so stuffed when I left.  I loved the Hawaiian and the one with Spinach.  What I liked most about the pizza is that it was a cross between thick and thin crust.
4. Such amazingly kind staff.  Elena, the owner,  the man with the mohawk, and the woman with long brown curly hair were SO sweet.  I seriously felt like they were some of the nicest and most friendly staff I'd encountered in a really long time.
5. Caprese salad is so good!!!
author: Julia D.

description:
Solid 3 star place, pretty good, but wow, a lot of reviewers here have either A. not had great pizza (i.e. actual 5 star pizza)  or B. had sex while they were eating this pizza  or C. were writing their reviews for an over-embellishment and exaggerative writing class.

It's good pizza, but far from great.
author: Greg J.

description:
We ate here last Thursday night and they had a pianist who apparently comes in to play on Tues & Thurs evenings. I really enjoyed relaxing with a cold beer and listening to live piano music while unwinding from a long day at work.

But the pizza is what I'm reviewing and it was (is) very good. Excellent, unique crust that is crispy and tasty. We had sausage, pepperoni, fresh tomato, green bell pepper and red onion toppings. It was so good that I had left-over pizza for breakfast the next two days! Preheat the oven to 450 and stick a slice in once it's up to temp for about 7 minutes and it tastes almost as good as the night you ordered it.

We eat here every couple of months and it's all good. Friendly engaging wait staff, consistently delicious pizza, great pianist on Tues & Thurs, cold micro beers on tap ... what more can you ask for in a pizza joint?
author: Rex W.

description:
AMAZING DEAL:
GO for the Monday all you can eat pizza night special - $11. Such a good deal when my boyfriend can eat a whole and a half large pizza by himself. 

We got there at about 7pm and put down our names and waited for about 15 minutes. As soon as you step in there to put down your names, you KNOW you want to eat there. The smell of the fresh out of the oven pizza makes you hungrier 100x instantly. 

INCREDIBLY FAST SERVICE:
The waitress sat us down and told us about the salad bar in the back; and as we were getting up to get the salad, 2 waitresses came with hot pizza and asked if we wanted some. So after we got a whole plate full of salad, we sat down and enjoyed our pizzas.
Also, we realized we got the best seat in the house as soon as we sat down. It's the table for 2 right at the entrance of the kitchen where the pizza comes out HOT and WHOLE. Whatever's coming out of that kitchen, we got offered first. And they just KEPT ON COMING!!!! I had to turn down a few because my pizza plate was full of pizza that I couldn't eat fast enough.

SO MANY FLAVORS:
There were sooooooooooooooooo many choices of pizza. There were jalapeno pineapple ham/pepperoni, hawaiian, mushroom pesto, garlic mushroom, spinach salami, goat cheese mushroom, artichoke sun-dried tomatoes, chicken spinach, green and black olives, and so many many more I can't even remember them all. 
The best part was that the crust was really thin and crispy. I hate it when the crust gets all soggy and mushy when you bite into it. THIS is so crunchy and crisp I could eat the whole thing every time. 

Good for family, dates, children, dinner parties and pretty much everything! They have beer and wine and sodas too.

Are you reading this on a Monday?! All you can eat starts at 4pm, and pizza will keep coming out as long as there's customers! Now GO!!!!!!
author: Erica L.

description:
Let me boil it down... this pizza is not good.  Mainly the ingredients do not taste fresh, and the crust is so hard that you're getting more cornmeal flavor and unenjoyable crunch than pizza ever asks for. It tastes more like a frozen pizza that you cooked on a baking sheet in the oven for too long and it got that unpleasant cardboard-y-ness.

I can appreciate that this place is something of an institution, it's been around for a while, and I respect that. But I've been disappointed every time I've gone. The salads are never fresh, and in this city there's no excuse for lack of fresh produce...  It's also just as expensive as any of the fantastic pizzerias in town (Delfina, Pizzetta 211, Zero Zero, A16, Little Star, Una Pizza Napoletana, Pauline's... and more), so I really suggest going there instead.
author: Lucy B.

description:
Went for the all you can eat Monday night special, and not a bad deal for $11 a person.  Got some salad.  Salad bar had a lot of great toppings (garbanzo and kidney beans, bell peppers, tomatoes, mozarella cheese, olives, green and red onions), but I'm not a huge iceberg lettuce fan and that's all they had.

Pizza was good as well.  The linguica was good, as was the chicken and the pesto tomato.

It was a shame I couldn't eat more.  Probably from drinking too much beer.
author: Ken L.

description: California pizza with artichokes is amazing! I usually get this with their salad with feta cheese! Great pizza, good value, and delicious!
author: Cat K.

description:
Goat Hill Pizza gets a good rating from me for excellent service and customer loyalty program. Recently had them cater daughter's birthday party.  Ordered cheese, mediterranean pizza and basic veggie. 
PROS
--sourdough crust is delicious and has great texture
--fresh palpable garlic on the pizza was a bonus
-- great flavor combination on the mediterranean pizza
-- join their customer loyalty program get a free pizza on your birthday
-- on time delivery!!
CONS
-- veggie pizza was MEH; veggies were a little soggy not particularly fresh
-- pizza is not as tasty cold, be sure to eat warm, or re-heat
I would go back and sample other pizzas. Very friendly wait staff.
author: Halima T.

description:
Pretty tasty! I came here with my boyfriend as a result of the Scoutmob coupon (50% off of the meal, up to $10 off). We got:

-Bruschetta: Although it was simple, it was really, really good! Freshly chopped tomatoes on top of sourdough (I think? It didn't seem as chewy as French bread) drizzled in a lot of garlic olive oil. Whatever the choice of bread was, I loved it because it was crisp on the outside and soft in the side, resulting in a satisfying crunch that didn't hurt my teeth.
-Porky Pie Pizza: Holy cow, this thing had a ton of bacon and roasted garlic. Delicious although maybe not the best choice for a date. We ordered a medium and ate all of it (it was a pretty excessive amount of pizza for two people though). The day after, my stomach is currently hating me for consuming so much roasted garlic and bacon, but it was worth it. Sourdough crust was tasty and had good texture (not too chewy, not too hard).

Other details:
-Restaurant was busy, but not TOO busy. Food came out quickly
-Decorations were cute; there were lots of drawings by kids. It made the restaurant really feel like a neighborhood hangout.
-Service was friendly, but.. young? Our server didn't know that the Scoutmob deal was also valid on paper, and he seemed a little pissed that he was not informed about that detail by his manager. While he was nice to us, it was a little awkward seeing him get pissed over our coupon.
-Live piano man was a nice touch.

I would come here again despite the service faux pas.
author: Wendy S.

description:
Normally, I love walking into an all-you-can-eat pizza deals (i.e. Pizza Hut), where I could start munching down pizzas 60-seconds after entrance.  This is not the case at Goat Hill Pizza's Monday night All-you-can-eat special.  

You sit and wait, like an infant sparrow waiting for its mother to return with a nice fat worm, in this case, a pizza server.  Depending on where you get seated, you may have to go through the torture of watching other lucky tables taking all the pizza, seeing the server return to the kitchen with an empty pizza pan.  The route around the restaurant that the pizza servers took stayed consistent, always starting from a well fed table, running out before they could get to my table.  In an hour, I some how managed to capture 3 slices, but I was still hungry.  

As customers started leaving, servers reached our table more frequently, allowing me to enjoy their tasty pizza.  In the end, I became full, but it was way too much work.  I felt exhausted.  I'll stick to ordering their carryout.
author: トモ T.

description: I want to really like this place. I get delivery all the time but the restaurant is not that great. I really like their pizza but not the service. Talk about not being happy to work there. Training in customer service needed.
author: Aban E.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants in the City having dined here for over twenty years!  A very long time ago I used to be a staffer for a San Francisco politician, and one afternoon following a community meeting at the Potrero Hill Neighborhood House some of the fellow staffers and our interns decided to drop in on Goat Hill Pizza to gather our notes and unwind for the rest of the day.  I fell in love with this place back then, and I've been eating here ever since.  I haven't been dining here as frequently as I like as of late, but I've recently adjusted my lunch time stops and I'm planning on coming back more often now.

I love their pizza.  The Chicken Florentine is probably my favorite with chicken, spinach and mushrooms.  I sometimes will substitute the regular tomato sauce with pesto sauce and have garlic added on.  I like their crispy chewy sourdough crust, and Goat Hill is very generous on the toppings.  Goat Hill's small is the perfect size for me to devour in just one sitting.  Free refills on a large soft drink means I'll always have something to wash it down with.

Recently I tried their pasta for the very first time.  They only offer a spaghetti, a ravioli and a lasagna with your choice of sauce.  I had a ravioli with meat sauce and a salad.  The salad was a good mix of fresh, crunchy iceberg lettuce, spinach leaves and assorted greens with kidney beans, garbanzo beans, black olives and a single banana pepper on top.  The ravioli wasn't extraordinary but was good.  Their pasta sauce with meat is a bit on the thin side and the meat is ground up too fine to really distinguish it as meat.  The pasta came with two enormous slices of fresh garlic bread baked in the pizza oven.  The crispy and chewy garlic bread is excellent being very buttery and very garlicky.

In addition to coming here on my own, whenever I volunteer with One Brick at the San Francisco Food Bank located nearby this is the go-to place afterwards for cold beer, a vast variety of pizzas and socializing with other volunteers.  The staff at Goat Hill is very accommodating and they always set up a super long table for us in the back room.  Good times!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: Holy shit, what a delicious pizza place and awesome staff. I'm not going to talk about my experiences or anything about this, just trust me. It's good. Gotta hang out in Potrero more.
author: Rohan D.

description:
I tend not to review places I've only been once. But are you fucking kidding me? I stop in this place one night and not only is some old guy playing the piano (awesome) just inside the door but the pizza of the day is bacon, goat cheese, and tomato and they serve it by the slice. The bottom crust was super crispy, the toppings were like an inch high and so fresh... 

It was just good.  Period.
author: Bethany M.

description:
We got a pizza and it tasted like a dirty diaper, filled with burnt hair and Indian food.
Perhaps it was my SO's choice of toppings, sausage and mushrooms.
After picking all the gnarly, pig-taint sausage off, the yucky mushrooms remaining made it all but inedible.
Granted there was a mailer coupon so delivery and the actual pizza itself was free, (can't beat the price), thus the two stars.
When using the coupon, you were required to mention it, so she did, perhaps that's why it was so crappy.
It was so bad it caused us to get into a fight.
I think I got a plain cheese another time and it was decent.
author: G K.

description:
Good 3 star pizza, plus an extra star for the AYCE Monday. I'd known about this for years but assumed it was the sort of thing you might find in a buffet place, 2 or 3 pizzas to choose from but they all taste the same so who cares?

Not so, not so at Goat Hill Pizza. Instead, think Pizza Dim Sum in which the servers make the rounds with trays of piping hot pizza instead of rolling carts. And there definitely is strong variety... I preferred the garlicky ones (which were announced as such) but you can take your pick and you'll end up sampling six or 10 varieties before you become uncomfortably full.

The salad bar is nothing special but a nice break from the starch. And Anchor Steam on tap!
author: Otis M.

description:
Pizza was good. Zucchini soup was awesome. Service was even better. They even took a bowl of water out to our dog waiting outside with giant puppy dog eyes making us feel very guilty.  I think that would make a big difference if there were a couple of seats outside.  I am not a California style pizza fan but this was very good pizza.  The sourdough crust was very good but I am a thin crust lover.  

The service was absolutely the best part of the experience and we would return based on that alone.
author: April M.

description: Nice crust. A little expensive and a little overboard on the cheese (I know some people like that).
author: Chelsea F.

description:
Loved it. Great crust on the meat lovers, a colleague had a gluten free Mediterranean and said it was great so if that's your thing, apparently it drew a good review. The meats on the pizza taste fresh and I dig pizza that's a little extra on the tomato sauce and thought this qualified. Real good. 
4 stars bc it was pretty noisy, in part bc one dumbass patron talked loud as hell and acted like an overall oblivious dickhead. Also, had a widmer hefeweisen (sp) and thought it was poor. 

I will be returning when it's convenient to be near Potrero. 

Oh, and thought all the kids drawings were cool. Definitely has a family feel, like your kid's done with his little league game and he went 0-4 at the plate so bring him here for some damn good pizza so he doesn't cry himself to sleep and go postal like that kid in the movie Parenthood.
author: Dev S.

description:
I approve. They know how to do a pizza right.  No, not going to gyp you on toppings.  Nor overwhelm you with a thick ass crust.  I would say, every bite will make you think of blue skies with fluffy white clouds, while the sun shines as a church choir sings angelically.  Okay, perhaps I'm over exaggerating, but its a good damn pizza.  Highly recommend that you check them out.  

Also heard they have a all you can eat special on Monday nights for $10.95.  You get to try all their specialty pizzas and their okay salad bar.  Might avoid that, so I don't get a ginormous ass, but maybe I should still try it once.  And see if I can measure up to JLo or burn it off at the gym.  Hmmm, contemplating.
author: Janice F.

description:
This is hands down the best pizza in the city not only for the fresh ingredients, high quality and good service, but pure knock your socks off flavor. 

Eat this with an Anchor Steam and you're in Potrero Heaven.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com//static/20101006/i/ico/star_big_1.gif

Unfortunately, I have to give them a low rating. My house mates and I always eat pizza from this place, but the service was a real downer. The lady at the front sat a party of three of us in the back at the smallest table that was possible when the whole room was empty, and that included the front. She then got irritated and made an ugly face when asked about the Monday all-you-can-eat deal versus the regular menu. We were really hungry, but I can tell you I'll never order from there again. When I'm paying for a service, I'm not paying for someone's bad attitude with it. I decided to go elsewhere instead of having her serve us in that mode.
author: Monikah B.

description: Goat Hill has been around for many years, my family and I would go there when we lived close by, they were really good then,I  haven't eaten at Goat Hill in about 20 yrs.. I didn't even know that Goat Hill Pizza was still in this location,( since I don't live in the area) until my niece asked me to go to dinner with her and our kids. Service was pretty good, they were pretty busy but, we got seated quickly and that's a big plus (you can call ahead and make a reservation too!) our pizza was delicious and hot..the salad I ordered was huge, and really fresh. I actually brought the rest home. They're prices are fair and the place is clean! And...great for small kids, they accommodate them with paper and crayons. Glad they are still around!!
author: Susie C.

description:
probably one of the best pizzas i've ever had

ordered the veggie pizza with jalapenos and it had just the right amount of spice

the sauce was tangy and there was just the right amount of cheese

the crust was light and crispy on the outside but a little chewy on the inside and had great flavor. was really good
author: Hemesh P.

description:
The pizza here was pretty good - I like the crispiness of their crust. We had the chicken florentine pizza here. It contained grilled chicken and a LOT of spinach. As good as the crust and the toppings were, the flavor was just a taaad bit bland for me. I think that a pizza like this with so much spinach (which lacks flavor on its own and takes away from the flavor of everything else) needs a bit more sauce on the pizza. There wasn't much on mine, and the spinach unfortunately overpowered what little sauce there was. I typically opt for non-traditional sauce/topping choice (i.e. bbq pizza, white-sauce based pizzas, etc), but this time, I longed for more sauce!

The salad was just ok.. but what can you expect from a pizza joint, right?

I'll have to try other pizzas here next time. I'm sure it was just the unfortunate spinach-overload that made their otherwise-tasty pizza a 3 star rating. I'll add a star if other choices are better next time!
author: Kazu O.

description:
I went to this place on a recomedation with a group. The pizza wasn't out of this world but was a nice homey neighborhood pizza joint. i had a nice class of red wine which was more impressive to me than the pizza. I asked for a cab which the staff didnt really help me and had to walk across the street instead. 

I would recommend finding another pizza joint within the area.
author: Jayme C.

description:
I came here with a pretty large group of about 19 people. We waited awhile for a table which was understandable. The hostess at the front was really nice and patient and really made sure that we would all be seated together. The aroma that comes from the inside of this place is amazing! It was my first time there and I thought it was pretty good.

We were seated in the back corner of the restaurant which I didn't mind. The only issue I had was with the salad bar which really only had one type of salad mix and a limited number of toppings for the salad. The waiters and waitresses constantly came to the back with pizzas that were fresh from the kitchen! I read a couple reviews talking about the wait for service and pizza but let's be honest...that's just how their system is. My friends and I got a lot of pizza and there was only two times when we would be waiting a couple minutes before another pizza came by. I'm sure I had about 16 slices of pizza.

The pizza was delicious! The sourdough crust really adds something and I must admit that all their pizza combinations were delicious! I'm sure I had a slice of at least everything they offered! My personal favorite was the Porky Pie with bacon, roasted garlic, and a garlic cream sauce!

Overall, I had a very positive experience at Goat Hill Pizza.
author: Mark L.

description: Their pizza on my last trip there was the best I can remember and I've been coming infrequently for maybe 2 decades. Very friendly staff.
author: Josh F.

description:
This place makes a solid pizza.  The crust is delicious fresh and they use high quality ingredients.  I've even been in here when they had a locally sourced chanterelle pizza.  Salads are basic but good and the salad bowl (and chefs salad) can feed a few.  Service is fast and friendly.  They sell pitchers of beer at a reasonable price.  What else could you want?  

Their delivered pizzas aren't as good as those eaten in house.  I think the in-box steaming  ruins the crust.  It might be worth getting the par baked crust and finishing the cooking yourself if you have to eat this pizza outside the restaurant.
author: Paul T.

description:
We decided to drive across town today for lunch here, since I had bought one of those Groupon deals. 

I was pretty excited to check this place out, since I have heard so many good things about it. So you can imagine my disappointment when it didn't meet expectations.

First, we ordered a minestrone soup to share, and a med combo pizza. We waited about 15 min before our soup came, now you would figure with all that time, they would have spent it heating UP the soup....but NOPE! Soup came lukewarm. Although the vegetables were plenty and fresh, it just didn't taste as good when it's not piking hot.

The pizza was good, but I definitely had better elsewhere.  All the ingredients on there made the pizza soggy and soupy in the middle and it was salty as hell.

And worse yet, the SERVICE SUCKED!! Since it was so salty, I drank my entire glass of water quickly. No one came to refill it and I had to wave at least 5 times to get anyone's attention. Even then, the waitress never came by with the pitcher. Finally, my husband had to get up to grab a pitcher off the counter. You're better off bringing your own bottle of water, otherwise, be prepared to be thirsty.

I hardly ever leave a small tip, but I did this time. I'll never come back anyways. I'm also glad I used a groupon because I sure as heck would not want to pay full price for this.
author: Jenny T.

description:
TOTALLY UNDERWHELMING.

I came here because a friend had a groupon deal here and she had read amazing reviews of this place.  Boy, was it amazing.  Amazingly unimpressive and overrated, that is.  When I first entered the restaurant, I really liked the home-y feeling of the place.  The atmosphere is extremely family-friendly so it's quite noisy in there, but hey, I don't really mind that as long as some good food accompanies it.  

Nope, that was not to be.  Our party of three ordered a large pizza, half Mediterranean, half Californian.  The wait was maybe 10-15 minutes.  We kept ourselves occupied so it was  fine, but when the order came, we realized the kitchen got our order wrong and our half Californian turned into half Hawaiian.  The lady who we reported this to just kind of took the pizza away and then that was it.  After flagging down our waiter, he offered us complimentary garlic bread.  I don't know whether they were reject garlic breads or what, but I think even I can make better garlic bread than that.  It was soggy and soft and not appealing at all.  

When our pizza finally came, along came my disappointment as well.  The Californian, which contained artichoke hearts, tomatoes, and garlic was bland.  I just ate this last night and to tell you the truth, I don't even remember how it tasted like cuz I simply didn't care for it.  The Mediterranean was slightly better.  It had a bit more flavor, maybe due to the feta, but that was pretty much it.  The crust was too chewy for me, but that really depends your own individual tastes.  By the end of our dinner, my friend found a fork brushing the top of her hair inches from her face, because our waiter accidentally dropped it as he was cleaning up our table.  He was probably nervous cuz he sensed our frustration.  Poor guy.

One more thing: I really like to drink my water during a meal and I would appreciate it if they had refilled my water when it was just sitting there empty for the majority of the meal.  Maybe I would've had a better experience if I came with children but you probably won't find me coming here again.
author: Vanessa C.

description: 18 bucks for a small and that's the littlest amount I can get and pizza and salad only what's the point of having other stuff on your menu this with a Kurt staff that don't even tell me it's all you can eat night till I try and fail to order multiple things. This place sucks
author: Brendan L.

description:
Ok pizza, nothing super, nothing bad.

Cheese seemed too soft not rubbery enough--i'm not sure how to explain it.  The meats on the pizza were good but not top notch.  The crust was hard cornmeal type crust that was pretty bland.  It got the job done but wasn't amazing.
author: Mike I.

description:
This is the perfect place to go in the city for a chill dinner out with friends or your better half. With nice views of the city (go towards the back of the restaurant) and a laid-back atmosphere (the cute red and white checked tablecloth really adds to it), makes this place is a relaxed neighborhood joint I would frequent over and over again. In addition to all that, the food is great, at decent prices. 

Now for the negatives. I took off one star due to the average service provided here... although our main waitress was quite friendly, the rest of the staff isn't quite.. and one time they messed up and gave our order to another table! This made us wait an unnecessary 20 mins for another pizza. HOWEVER, our waitress noticed our annoyance and charged our drinks on the house. The second time we went here the service was decent which still makes this place an overall winner in my books!
author: Ankita I.

description:
Goat Hill Pizza has become a staple in my diet this summer. Every two weeks, I volunteer at the San Francisco Food Bank with One Brick. It's a great excuse to do some good, go out, and have a great meal.

This place is going to always hold a special place in my heart, since it's where I first shared a slice of pizza with a very special girl. We had mushroom pizza and root beer. She convinced me that the pesto was also worth a try. Later, I proved that the salad was worthy of consideration as well.

The place has good pizza. It's not New York. It's not Chicago. It's California. This means the crust is good: crisp and on the thicker side of thin. The toppings are fresh. The sauce is zesty. They have root beer in the bottle. They'll take reservations for groups. And, they are friendly and prompt.

Worth crossing town for this pie. If you're lucky, you'll meet someone amazing and change your world.
author: Dave B.

description: I love the crispy, chewy sourdough (San Francisco style) crust, never ever soggy or limp (my pet peeve)--I crave this crust, its not like authentic Italian woodfired, thin crust pizza (which I also love ).... but I dont think its trying to be, it is its own unique thing.  You have to try it.  Have been coming here for almost 20 years and have never been disappointed.  I neighborhood gem of a restaurant with a great neighborhood vibe, great for kids and families and groups.  Monday night all you can eat pizza and salad bar is a must try, but sometimes a long wait so get there early or go late.  The Greek is great or my personal favorite pepperoni and pineapple.
author: Anibel B.

description:
I had gotten a coupon in the mail from Goat Hill for a large pizza. After letting it sit on my desk for a couple of months, I decided to use it one night. I thought: How bad could a free large pizza be?

I looked on their menu and all their toppings looked so good! How could I choose? The biggest plus, I think was the fact that they will add chopped garlic to any pizza for free. Mmmm...garlic automatically makes everything better.

So I ordered for delivery a large pizza with chicken, pesto, and chopped garlic, and a side of wings. This was a dinner for two, so don't think it was all for me. The pizza was so big! And as for the taste...amazing! The pizza came piping hot and they even give you paper plates, utensils, and napkins. Apparently, they do have the hearts of starving and lazy students in mind.

I ordered from them a second time and did chicken, sun-dried tomatoes, and of course chopped garlic. They did not disappoint. Except this time, I had to fork over the money for the pizza. And although $25 for a large pizza sounds like a steep price to pay...it's pretty well worth it. We did without the wings this time...they weren't that great the first time.
author: Linna L.

description: We came here on a Monday night when they are offering their all you can eat option! And the pizza was just to die for! There are waiters walking around with options every couple of minutes. And if you are waiting for a special slice just let them know they will bring it to your table as soon as its ready. Great service and pizza. A must go to place in SF for great pizza!
author: Michelle I.

description:
The food is good - can't knock that. Had a greek veggie pizza and some garlic bread.

I went with a group of 8 and they stuck us in the back area where a big group can fit. But i think they can only fit 2 big groups at a time in the restaurant.

The reason for the 2 star rating is that they exemplify my biggest peeve - unnecessary waiting. There was a wait for the food, but that I can forgive because we were a big group. However, when we were done, we asked for the check and our waiter said he'd be right back with it. 15 minutes pass by and we're still waiting for our check. One of us goes up to check on what's going on and they tell him that our check is coming. and we wait another 10 minutes. Another one of us checks again and still no check. It's our check! it's hand written! we bough 2 pizzas, 2 orders of garlic bread, a salad, and ravioli. you list those and then you put the prices next to them. I was really confused as to why it was so difficult.

But we got the check eventually and unfortunately one of us tried to pay with credit card. the machine was broken, so they had to do the old fashion way, which was rubbing it on some paper. this took another 5-10 minutes. so a total of about a half an hour or so of just waiting for them to get their act together.

I don't think Goat Hill is worth the wait.

2 stars. =P
author: Brian M.

description: We have been living in the area and heard that this was staple Pizza joint in Potrero Hill and we had to try it. We definitely were not disappointed. The ingredients were fresh and the crust was relish. I am a big crust fan so the crispy yet soft inside crust was exactly what I like. I can see why so many people frequent this place - it really is a neighborhood staple.
author: Ashley M.

description: Enjoyed our cheese slices on Potrereo Hill .  The crust was really crisp and the dark red sauce was delicious.
author: K L.

description: Goat Hill Pizza rocks! The pizza was delicious. I ordered the vegetarian pizza and it was soooo yummy!  The sourdough crust was delish.  The customer service was terrible. I had to get up several times to ask for a menu, water, and to order. It wasn't even super busy when we came. Overall definitely worth driving too. Beware - parking sucks.
author: Michelle T.

description:
This is the first restaurant I ate at after moving into Potrero Hill. It's only two blocks away. I was super hyped after reading all the reviews about how delicious it would be. Got the cheese pizza slice a few times (each time hoping it'd be better than the last), but it's never quite hit the spot. I am not sure if it's the dough (which some people say is sourdough?) or what, but it just doesn't do it for me and isn't flavorful enough. Safeway's Signature Cafe pizza is far better (and cheaper). 

A 2 rating is on the harsh side - it's probably a solid 2.5 for me. I just have no desire to eat there again.
author: Sylvia L.

description: Pizza was good. Service was decent. Not busy on a thursday night, and easy to get a table. Nothing too memorable, and nothing bad about the place.
author: Rob R.

description:
Goat Hill is sometimes hit or miss for me, but most of the time it's a hit. I've had a few occasions where the pizza seemed so fresh with great toppings, then on other occasions it seemed as if I were eating 2 day old refrigerated pizza. Regardless, Goat Hill is a solid pizza joint with good crust that isn't too doughy. And extra points for being in my neighborhood. 

Reserving my 5th star for when they start delivering.
author: Jen D.

description: G O A T  H I L L  P I Z Z A -- yummy and Good for Vegans too.  You can get any Pizza you want with Vegan Daiya Cheese.  Any Pizzeria that does this has my full star -- 5 Star -- vote of confidence.  But I'll take it a step further-- they have the best crust in the city.  So go here, fellow plant based dieters.  You won't be sorry!
author: Charlotte R.

description:
My girl and I have been together for a little while now. Things have always been great between us until recently. This past year, I've packed on a few pounds which has caused a strain in our relationship. So, she made the point clear and simple to me. We couldn't continue on if I didn't lose the weight.

So, I worked hard at the gym and this past week I finally moved up a notch on my belt. Tensions have waned between us. Things are back to being good.

Secretly, I crept away to Goat Hill Pizza's all you can eat Mondays with some friends. I needed to be personally rewarded and the need to glutton was unbearable.

A variety of thin corn meal crust pizzas were deposited on my paper plate faster than I could devour. This feels like dim sum... Italian style, one of my friends remarked. The slices were smaller than the norm which allowed us to sample more pizzas. 

There were the standards... plain cheese... pepperoni... mushroom...
There were also... goat cheese... pesto... vegetarian
There were more with bacon... garlic... cheeseburger... jalapenos

After a while I had myself a mini hill of slices on my plate waiting to be consumed. A server drops off a double slice on top of that just to add insult to injury. Sorry, the slices are stuck together... he says with a sly grin.

Oh $10.95 scores you this carnage... plus you get free trips to the salad bar... if that wasn't enough for you already.

Good thing I left my belt at home... or she would of been pissed!
author: Sam T.

description:
Q.  Am I just too old, or am I the only one who finds SF pizza prices to be sky high compared to the rest of the world?   

A.  Please don't answer, I think I know what you'll say.  

We've been chowing down on Goat Hill Pizza for 30 years, and over that time the Potrero Hill pizzeria has gone through some changes and menu tweaks.  But one thing that's constant is their great pizza made with an original sauce and perfect crust.  And this pie is not suffocating in cheese like in those food commercials.  If you want "suffocating" be sure to ask for extra cheese.

Every pizza at Goat Hill has been sensational -- but the Vegetarian is still my favourite.  Now that they deliver beyond the Mission, I can regularly enjoy Goat Hill without travelling "clear over to Potrero Hill."

Because of the prices, I wouldn't categorize Goat Hill pizza as a great value.  But the quality overcomes price every time.  Note that if you're ordering a "large," you might make it "extra large" so you get the size you expect.  Everybody has their pizza preference, but you'd be hard pressed to find a better San Francisco pizza delivered to your door. 

The next time, I'll make mine an Hawaiian with extra sauce.  So good.
author: K P.

description: My company sponsored a meetup and since I'm out here Bossin' it up, of course, I got to put in the order for the meetup pizza which wasn't all meatza because Goat Hill has a wide variety of fancy pizzas in veggie and non-veggie styles. I basically picked up the phone and said give me some variety and they delivered 5 different pizzas which were all good. I put in the order a day in advance but maybe that wasn't even necessary.  Everything arrived on time and the cost was reasonable. If you're doing a meetup circa SOMA get at Goat Hill and they will deliver something for everyone in a timely manner for a good price. Now I'm gonna see about Goat Hill Pizza on West Portal!
author: Asher B.

description:
Really nice.

Thank you Groupon for the deal you had! My boyfriend and his sisters got the "Bay Pizza" was it?! And it was crunchy and good! Ravioli w/Meatball was good too! Definitely will be back to try the other pizzas. Service was great!
author: Vivian L.

description: Love the atmosphere, love the location, love the pizza! Been here twice now and have nothing to complain about, all praise on this end. It's great for a date, great for families, and even greater for kids.
author: Cory B.

description:
With its laid back atmosphere and live piano player, it's a great place to take kids. The food is yummy and fairly priced. Wine list could use some work, but the mark up isn't obnoxious. The staff is welcoming and engaging. There are good vegetarian options. And who doesn't love jalapenos on pizza? 

One pet peeve: Dirty mop smell.
author: Shannon W.

description: We get take out here every so often when we are feeling like yummy pizza.  I love that parking is easy and our orders are always ready in 20mins or less.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Terrible Service. Incredibly rude waitstaff/hostesses.

Couldnt comment on the food because, after waiting an hour for a table, i decided to eat elsewhere because the wait was not worth the rudeness of the staff.
author: Raza M.

description:
Somebody of my staff recommended this place. So I called and made reservation 2 weeks in advance for our company Christmas party on the 18th. We called a view times and even already told them what food we like to order. On the 16th 2 days before we called again to tell them there will be more people then expected. They told us they don't see us having a reservation after they confirmed it 2 week earlier.
So we reserved it again and everything was set. On the night of the 16th after all the invitation was send to my staff and everything confirmed we got a call they forgot that they closed course they have there own Christmas party. As a business owner myself I can't understand something like this and less how they stay in business
author: Frank N.

description:
Most importantly: TOTALLY awesome pizza. Crunchy, flavorful, substantial.

But. The hostess tonight? Freakin' CLUELESS. Like, we walk in, she's on the phone and clearly doesn't see us. So we wait. Then she gets off the phone and starts gabbing with the staff in the kitchen, who keep POINTEDLY LOOKING AT US while she's talking, clearly trying to inform her that, like, you know, she had customers and stuff. Then she turns around and starts sorting menus or something, still completely oblivious. Finally one of the kitchen guys comes out and very tactfully informs her we're standing there. HAH.

The lady who waited on us--I think she was the owner? Was a total sweetie. No complaints about anything else, and we'll definitely be back, and frankly, the whole "wow, dude, you really just DON'T GET IT, do you?" experience was actually pretty funny.
author: Veronika A.

description:
We had a groupon to eat at the restaurant and since this is in our neighborhood decided after a day of errands we'd sit down and have dinner here. We got a pitcher of beer some salad a small pie and some pasta. Food is good as it always is. The salad is always huge and they use home made ranch dressing +1. 

So why 5 stars? The place just has the coziest neighborhood feel. Growing up I had pizza places like this near my house I went to all the time so it was nice to experience that again. You could also tell lots of people from the neighborhood were eating here. It was a really really nice experience.
author: Hyung L.

description:
Absolutely perfect pizza with fresh everything. 
One thing- they cut the toppings in big pieces, so adding even an extra topping to your pizza makes it a crazy big salad.
author: Maria J.

description: My co-workers and I got treated to Goat Hill Pizza. We got 5 large pizza's and a half order of spaghetti with meatballs (since I can't eat dairy) The pizza looked sad. The ingredients didn't look fresh at all. When I looked at it I thought of Domino's pizza. Round Table does a much better job!! After examining the pizza I went over to my order to spaghetti. The one meatball they give you (which is an okay size) wasn't cooked all the way. It was still raw in the middle so I decided to save it for dinner when I can cook It some more. I did enjoy the spaghetti with the meat sauce that's why I decided to change my 2 star to a 3 star. Anyway I would say go somewhere else!
author: Wendy C.

description:
This was the first time I've ever left a buffet hungry.
If you are blessed with the virtue of patience, waste your time here waiting for the slowest service in history (excluding the drink guy).
God forbid you get seated in the back corner - salad bar graveyard - pizza is scarce.
Find a Round Table.
author: Bobby S.

description:
This establishment was my first Potrero Hill experience back in 1999.  While waiting for my SF friend to get home while visiting this past week, I decided it would be a perfect spot to reminisce and see how things had changed..... Well, I'm not so sure that was a good idea.

For single folks, keep in mind that this is a very family and kid friendly place.  Not bad in itself, but I was looking for something a little more.... quiet.  Also, for some reason, the windows facing Connecticut St. do not open, so there is no air flow through that corner of the restaurant with the counter facing outwards.  Not usually a problem, I'm sure, but on an 85 degree day in October, it was gruesomely hot from the pizza ovens.  I should have moved. 

The wine selections are good - overpriced as they are.  When handing me the menu with the specials printed on a sheet inside, I wasn't told that they were out of anything on the specials sheet.... but they were.  Disappointed!!

Friendly service but not very attentive, especially after the Sunday lunch rush.  I got up to refill my water twice because no one came around the corner to check on me.  

My walk down memory lane was not fantastic, and I sort of wish that I had checked out someplace that was new in the 'hood.....
author: rebecca b.

description:
Took the family out the westside fog and into the sun over on Potrero Hill for a change of scenery. The goal was also to have a family pizza night. 

Service was good, salad good, beer good, pizza was absolutely the worst I've ever had. Embarrassed those (not intentionally) sitting with me by taking 4 sets of paper napkins to suck the grease off the top of the pizza. Could not believe anyone would serve it the way it was. 

Took the leftovers home thinking it would be better as straight-out-of-the-breakfast. One bite and into the garbage it went. Too bad b/c it cost plenty. 

Kudos to the piano player, he was pleasant. Good place for a beer and listening to piano I suppose.
author: Brady R.

description:
Im pretty sure we would go back here, only because there is not much Pizzeria that serves thin crust...

I felt sorry for my friend Gessa for finding it too salty when we ordered it to go last week. Cholo brought me here for lunch today, on a warm day. Like always, he wants the table with a view...lol.

We ordered our Meat Lovers half with pineapple, yes for me. A couple of bottle of beers and we downed that pizza.

Except for our Server, whom he thinks he is so cool for making a comment that Cholo diidnt like, everything's A-ok.

I think we will come back.
author: Malou C.

description: Better than pizza hut, worse than round table.
author: Katya B.

description: Their pizza was pretty good I must admit, but really a lot of their other choices on the menu (like the Italian food) was mediocre at best. If you live in potrero hill area and you are looking for a pizza place, I would recommend it... but don't bother with the rest of the menu.
author: Jason B.

description:
A good choice on Monday night!

If you go on a non-Monday night, skip the pasta and stick with the pizza.
author: Miriam W.

description:
Pizza delivery with a couple beers on a drizzly Saturday night is always awesome. But when you get Goat Hill's Special Combination pizza with anchovies, it's even better. 

Except when little anchovy bones stick you on the roof of your mouth. That's not so fun. Little jerks.
author: Julia C.

description:
Ahhh I'm hungry for pizza.  Came here for some late lunch.  This is my date's favorite and according to him it's the best pizza place in the city.   I don't entirely agree but I do see myself dining here again.

I did enjoy enjoy the XL Portuguese pizza but i was wishing it had more meat in it.  Nice good thin crust with all the green onions and olives I want.  Tiramisu was a little disappointing but at least I got my sugar kick.
author: Pam S.

description:
Dear Goat Hill Pizza,

Thank you for the lovely birthday card and free pizza coupon! It's perfect. You were very sweet to think of me. See you soon!

Sincerely,
Carnley
author: Carnley P.

description: Lousy pizza experience tonight.  I'm not a pizza snob, but when I ask for a medium-well cooked pizza, I don't expect to have to eat it with a spoon.  Plus, the toppings were INCREDIBLY SCARCE!!  Small consolation that pizza arrived early and the wings were so-so.  That's the only reason this place got 2 stars and not 1.  Quoth the raven, nevermore!  At least not on my dime.
author: Lesley H.

description: This isn't a fancy type of pizza joint. What it is, is a joint that you want to go, drink a beer and eat a slice of meaty good pizza with a tasty dough. A great neighborhood joint.
author: K R.

description: OMG I found GOOD PIZZA in SAN FRANCISCO that isn't outrageously expensive! FINALLY! Thank you, thank you, thank you, Goat Hill Pizza! AND they delivered in HALF the time they said they would!  WOO!
author: Chelsea A.

description: Love that this location is right by my work - great sour dough pizza. Sometimes takes awhile for my order and sauce isn't evenly spread through-out on occasion -- but it is great sf pizza, especially for out of towers to try
author: John O.

description:
Cool spot! Let's keep this short and sweet:

Went with some 20 people after our kid's batizado (capoeira heyo!) so everyone was pretty on the hunger route. Ordered 3 pies for our table plus 3 separate check orders at two different times (Me and my teacher came in last) That is like....a server's nightmare. But lo and behold, service was snappy and rockin'. Good service is definitely a seller. 

Had the vegetarian sandwich just cause. Bell peppers, olives, onions, tomatoes, mozzarella, and pasta sauce on a toasted wheat roll. It was mighty bomb. I suggest adding a healthy douse of pepper flakes and reggiano. If it makes pizza better, it makes this sandwich better. Also had a few slices of the pizza. I found the garlic spinach feta pie a little strong on the garlic (and I love garlic) but I still loved it. Meat lovers was....well, meat lovers. Can't go wrong and there's no need to make it better! 

All in all a righteous spot! Beers, pizza, good service: can't go wrong. Easy as that.
author: Dzu N.

description:
The pizza can be really good, or can be pretty bad, depending on how busy they are, what you order, and it seems....where you sit?

Once I got a pizza that was so greasy there was a lake in the middle. Not a puddle, not a pond, but a lake. A Great Lake at that... No Thanks. 

Most of the time however, this is not so. In fact when that happened I was in a very large group with multiple pizzas coming and going.

All this aside, its affordable and has a GREAT view of the city if you can score the two tables next to the right window..
author: L P.

description:
There are a dozen other restaurants a block away. Go to another.

I swung by to order a couple slices. After being told it would be about five minutes, I asked at 15 minutes if it was done. "Not yet." At 20 minutes I asked again. I was told someone else took my order.

I don't mind mistakes, but I got no apology or anything. I just got my money back. Without the initial tip. What a waste of time.

Thanks, Goat Hill. And keep the tip.
author: James B.

description:
I've never been to the place, so my review is strictly on the pizza. I don't know the prices nor can I judge the delivery. Someone in the office usually orders and it magically shows up in the kitchen around lunch.

The pizza is just awesome. The crust is my favorite part of their pizza. One day I'd like to see where this awesome pizza comes from.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Special Combination- salami, pepperoni, Italian sausage, ground beef, mushrooms, green bell peppers, green onions, black olives and garlic chunks
That description alone should suffice your appetite. I love you San Francisco, and you've completely sold me on your environmentally and gastronomically-friendly ways, but at the end of the day I still believe Pizza + Healthy should be an oxymoron. If you're like me and a) have an insatiable appetite and b) like your pizza extra meaty + cheesy, put on your drawstring pants, call up Goat Hill, and order one Extra Large Special Combo for the win.
author: Mahsa K.

description:
The selection of different pizzas here is amazing. They have something for everyone. 

Fresh ingredients, superb crust but their sauce is slacking a little bit and it cost them a star. Will be back for years to come though.
author: Matt Z.

description: Came here on Monday Night which is "neighborhood night" all you can eat pizza and salad for $10.95. I'll have to admit, I didn't even venture back to the salad bar, I was too keyed into all the different pizzas they were bringing by. Sun-dried tomatoes and roasted garlic; goat cheese,  tomato, pesto; veggie lover; artichoke and feta; pineapple, jalapeno, and pepperoni they kept bringing 'em out and they were all a little different. They must've gone  through at least 12 different pies before they repeated any. Wasn't the best pizza I ever had but a great place to spend a Monday night with some friends.
author: Stephen S.

description: Dear God I've died and gone to Heaven. This pizza is to die for. Everything about it was delicious. Perfect crust, sauce and cheese. The flavor exploded in my mouth. Yummo! Try this pizza. I'm sure you will agree.
author: Tali L.

description:
Yes, it's a great deal but the pizza is meh with weird combos like onions and pineapple.  The salad bar was ok - I did like that they had garbanzos and beets.

The lady that seated us knows nothing about bus routes (and seemed put out when I had the audacity to ask...) so if you happen to need a bus there is one catty corner to the restaurant
author: Emily W.

description:
Goat Hill Pizza was essential in making my three years in Potrero Hill my favorite in the city to date. 

Flashback to February 1, 2004: We were trying to find a place in my new neighborhood to go eat after a day of heavy-duty moving into our new appartment and my boyfriend suggested this place. It wasn't a Monday night, but we loved it anyway. The pizza was great, the service was excellent, the views of the Bay were nice and it really had that neighborhood pizza parlor vibe that only a place that's been around for over 30 years can have. We quickly learned that their takeout is as good and that, of course, Monday-all-you-can-eat nights rock. 

Going every Monday night for three years probably did contribute to the 10 or so lbs I put on...but I couldn't stay away from Andrea (or big mama as we affectionately called her), Jeff, the dreamy motorcycle-riding host who is no longer there but who would always manage to seat us loooong before our table was really up in the queue, or the guys in kitchen who knew to put three orders in when they'd see us walk in (one of hawaiian, one of sauceless pizza with feta cheese, and one of ground beef and chives--weird, yes, I know but delicious). 

On summer nights when there's a long wait, it's fun to grab a pitcher of  something to enjoy while you wait. 

This is the place where everyone knew our name and thanks to Monday night pizza, I now eat pizza with almost any kind of topping on it. Having all the wacky random toppings to try on pizzas, broadened my horizons and checked my preconceived notions as to what could be good on a pie. From the sourdough crusts, to the ranch dressing...  oh yes, it's amore.
author: Dee I.

description:
This place is really far from where I live (Richmond), so I was upset that the pizza here is sort of watery and unflavorful.  My friends and I came here because of a groupon deal, but I don't know if it was even worth the gas and time spent searching for parking.  It's not necessarily bad pizza, but if this place was a delivery chain or something, I would definitely not choose this place over Round Table or Domino's.  

Got a pizza that was half chicken florentine and half combo.  The chicken was kind of dry and that part of the pizza was really soggy.  The combo side was not as soggy, but the sausage had no flavor.  I thought sausage was always seasoned, so I was really confused by the blandness.  

The servers/everyone who works here is really really nice.  So I write this review with a really really heavy heart.
author: Anna T.

description: Love the sour dough crust they use for their pizza's.  A nice old Italy vibe in a nice little neighborbood with good views of the city from atop Potrero Hill.
author: Chris V.

description: At Goat Pizza now.  Sourdough crust, so good, not sure why they don't do this everywhere.  Wine, not super expensive like the other dinner options nearby.  It's not fancy, if you're looking for that, just great pizza, great people, and great value.  I'm on loan from SD to SF for work and wish we had something like this back home.
author: John K.

description:
Have been here a good 4 times or so since being convinced by all the fabulous reviews on here to give it a try. 

The Setting:
The best seat in the house has to be in the back right corner against the window during sundown. The San Francisco skyline looks amazing from here, especially with the dim lights and the Gingham tablecloths :)

The Food:
The crispy sourdough is a nice change to regular pizza dough. Our favorite pizza so far has been the mediterranean with garlic cream sauce, spinach, red onion, garlic, and feta cheese. Had the artichoke corn chowder soup the other day and although it tasted fresh, it was really lacking in seasoning ( salt and pepper anybody). We have only ordered garlic cheese bread once. It came after our pizza and was hardly toasted so we returned it. 

The Service:

Is always lacking. The last time we were here our waiter never came to our table. We asked the host who our waiter was and he ended up taking our order. There also have been other times when we almost had to seat ourselves because there was no host in sight after several minutes of standing there waiting. Mind you there were waiters walking around doing nothing.

So I will continue to come when I am near the area, but it's not one of those places you bring people from out of town too either.
author: Melissa M.

description: Pizza is good but too pricey. Counter service is also bad when I come to pick up orders. Maybe they know that they are the only pizza place in the area, which lets them get away with the shifty service. 4 star pizza, 2 star prices but you guys gotta do something about the 0 star service.
author: Tommy C.

description:
This place has a crust you actually want to eat!

You know how people usually throw away the crust? The crust on their pizza is just as good or actually better than the pizza! Crunchy and on the medium to thinner side is how I would describe the bread -- yumm!

The office ordered from this place again. The pizza is good... made with fresh ingredients but still on the greasy side.
author: Jennie S.

description: Really 4.5 stars, but since I can't give halfzies I'll round up. The all-you-can-eat on Mondays is phenomenal. The pizza could be a bit better but overall this place rocks, especially for the price!
author: Art W.

description:
Maybe I'm spoilt but this pizza was okay. I thought for a 15$ plus a 3.50$ delivery charge the pizza would be a lot better...it was pretty plain (I got a cheese pizza but this is where the sauce should be better)..and they forgot my ranch  :(

I guess my search for excellent NY Style pizza will continue... and yes, I know we're in SF but I think the world's pretty small and if I can get excellent sushi and thai here, pizza should be a given! Any recommendations would be great!
author: Dalia M.

description: We got delivery, Cowan special which is the term coined by my in-laws for there "infamous among Friends and family" combo. Pepperoni, sausage, fresh tomato, garlic, spinach, mushroom....mmmm...goodness. The pizza was hot and delivered in less time than quoted. Icy cold ibc's with all you need to keep the kitchen clean! I would give 5 stars but I've eaten there once before but the pizza wasn't memorable. Tip: garlic and veggies really make it phenomenal!
author: Charlotte D.

description: Tasty. Fresh. Delicious.
author: Mel G.

description:
love their pizza, especially the crust.  the portuguese style pizza is really good, as is the deluxe (or whatever it's called)

have been many times and hope to go back in the future.
author: Oliver C.

description:
A quik journey up my side street..18th in search of satisfying and affordable grub ends at the front door of Goat Hill.  Cant believe its my first visit since taking up residency in da hood... But after seeing some recent pics I saw with goats on FB..I knew this was my Fri nyt eating bonanza.  

What else... a pizza heaven found at Goat Hill tonight...one with goat cheese, artichoke and sundried tom....yummy and rich...take out of course, since its downhill to home...and too crowded to dine solo.

Good service...but busy.  Nevertheless, my public eating manners went by the wayside, it was sooo good or I was hungry...or who needs manners when your home...lol..I have to wipe my hands on my pants now.

Glad I finally ventured another 2 blocks to find you!
author: Bryan G. W.

description:
Gave in to the yummy-smelling garlic last night after having seen the long lines on other evenings. Did not know that Monday is Neighborhood Night, which means all you eat pizza and salad for $10.95, and if you get there after about 6:30, expect to wait a long time. This all you can eat deal is great idea if you're on a budget or have trouble focusing, since it means you can get 1 small slice of 10 different kinds of pizza and it adds up a quite a lot of variety. Crust is semolina on the bottom, kind of crunchy like home-made (in a good way). Salad bar was ok, nothing great. We got a pitcher of Lagunitas for an additional $10. Reminded me of my grad school grease-eating days. In support of this hypothesis: guy next to us was talking about his science projects to his eating partner, who clearly believed every word he was saying (he was overselling it, in my opinion). 

The service here was harried but friendly. I wonder what it's like on a regular night, since the Monday night roundabout requires them to run back and forth calling out the names of the pizzas, in little circles all night long. Looks exhausting. 

Anyway I don't know if I would go back unless I happened to be craving four kinds of pizza at once. Of the ones I tried, the pesto goat cheese was good; the rest were fine but not terribly crave-worthy.
author: Sam Z.

description: This is very good pizza. We are native San Franciscans, and have tried many, many pizza places in the City. This is one of our favorites. The sourdough crust is delicious; thick enough to support the many toppings without getting soggy. The price is good, and the people have always been helpful and friendly. We also get the salads here, which are always fresh and very tasty. I prefer the Potrero location over the West Portal location. The food for some reason tastes better, and the parking is much easier.
author: Linda P.

description:
I really wanted to love this place since reading Corey Doctorow's futuristic sci-fi novel, 'Little Brother', about a teenager in Portrero Hill subverting the Department of Homeland Security and grubbin on Goat Hill Pizza while hacking like a bad ass, but fair is fair and this place is only fair. 

Sourdough crust though is good, if anything, its a superb idea and I think they execute it all well (but not like artisan quality mission breadmakers well). My boyfriend got a small jalapeno/pepperoni/roaster garlic/grilled red onion pizza (a make your own) which ended up being over $17 which is a lot of money for 5 slices. The roasted garlic was excessive, something like 25 whole cloves, maybe that would mean impressive to some, but I wasn't that into it.

I ordered the half order of spaghetti and meatballs ($7.95) because I was feinding pasta all day...face it, January 1st=carbo loading. It was a little too close to a Denny's experience for me. Not fresh pasta, the bolognese sause was way too chunky and just dished like a half cup on top. The meatball (ya, one, singular) was aight. It was a lot of food for the price, but dude, I don't know who could eat a full order, I bet you could feed 2 people easily with a half order. Oh, also, the table next to us ordered a bottle of their house red and it was Crane Lake...like the $2.99 bottle, like shit I wouldn't drink in college...this is California, San Francisco no less, I think they could do a little better quality.

The ambiance is cute and quaint, red checker plastic table clothes and kid's art everywhere. I wouldn't recommend sitting in the front half of the dining room because when the front door is open is f-ing cold up there.  Portrero Hill just rocks so its nice to get out there for a change, but I can't say I would make the trek again, although I know that my boyfriend disagrees, but he'll have to write his own review about how much he loved it.
author: Shannon H.

description:
I had a Groupon, and decided to use it this weekend after a trip to the California Academy of Science. 

We were greeted with smiles, and led to a table in the back of the restaurant that had a GREAT view of the city. I wasn't expecting this from a pizza joint!

We ordered a medium size half and half, half with California pizza and my boyfriend had the Florentine (I think thats what it was called). We also shared a salad which was a little on the pricey side. We skipped alcohol and had 2 diet cokes. 

Our server was friendly, the ambiance was great, it is easy to find parking in the neighborhood. As soon as you walk in, the aroma of a pizzeria hits you, like heaven. 

I'd come back again, but only if I buy another Groupon (which I will if they offer this deal again!) or if I get a coupon. Our original bill would of been $29 plus tip, which is a little on the pricey side for a medium pizza, 2 sodas and a salad. I will say that all the ingredients were fresh, which might be why the prices are a little on the high side. But with the Groupon the price was very fair and I was very pleased and walked out with an overall good experience.
author: Stacy S.

description:
Monday's best gig in town, all you can eat, 10.99....every imaginable ingredient on pizza served

Best Pizza in the area, Monday night is all you can eat by the slice, amazing selections...
author: Troy S.

description: The sourdough crust here is delicious! They have a variety of fresh and delicious toppings. I also enjoy their salads. I took off one star because the service has been consistently slow every time I've been there. Other than that, this is a great place to grab pizza!
author: Diana G.

description:
I talk about Goat Hill Pizza all the time and I'm always surprised that not more people know about it.  Or maybe they've heard of it, but have never been.  Or maybe it's just that most people I know are normal, not insatiable, raging fat-asses like me.  But gluttony is in my blood.  I can't help it if I start salivating when I hear the words "all-you-can-eat."

Goat Hill holds a special place in my heart, and not because the last time I ate there, I ended up outside on the curb, puking obscenely mere minutes before I was forced by an evil ex to board the 22 for a 45-minute nightmare ride back to the Richmond instead of just taking a cab (one of the few instances I would have been okay paying more than $2 on transportation).  No, I love Goat Hill because their pizza is magical.  My instincts tell me that this is because they make the crust with sourdough, and trust me -- my instincts are awesome.

Every Monday, Goat Hill hosts "Neighborhood Night," which means for $10.95, you get all the pizza you can stomach from 4pm-10pm, as well as unlimited trips to the (delicious, btw) salad bar.  As soon as you're seated, servers begin coming by to offer mini slices of fresh-out-of-the-oven pies boasting different toppings, some expected (pepperoni and black olives, anyone?) and some not-so-expected (anchovies, garlic, pineapple and linguica?  Pass).  Also, for those of you not super into eating the animals, there's always plenty of veggie pies making the rounds, so you have no excuse for being lame and not going.

You won't get seated unless your entire group is there, but you can buy beer and drink it outside while you wait -- pitchers of Anchor and Sierra Nevada aren't too shabby at $9.50 each.  You classier folk can get wasted off a liter of wine for only $11.25 (or drink even cheaper wine out of a travel coffee thermos -- my favorite trick -- on the bus ride over).  Be warned, however, that the ingestion of alcohol will leave less space in your body for food.  It may also cause you to do something you'll regret, like getting vajazzled. 

To maximize the enjoyment of your Monday night experience at Goat Hill, I suggest going with several friends and challenging them to a down-and-dirty, no-holds-barred, all-you-can-conceivably-stuff-in-your-face pizza-eating contest.  Just don't tell anyone that the "prize" for the champ is spending the rest of the night crouched over the toilet clutching his or her distended belly.  Oh, and it's absolutely non-negotiable that you come wearing elastic-waist pants.  High school gym shorts are preferable in case you get sweaty.  Eating is a sport, after all.

How many places can you go, spend $10.95 on pizza and salad and be so filled with food and happiness that you'll probably throw up later?  Now that's a deal.
author: Christy J.

description:
For $25 (including tax and tip), we enjoyed a Medium Pizza with our own choice of toppings including Chicken, Artichoke Hearts, Mushrooms, Chopped Garlic (free) and Garlic Cream Sauce in lieu of standard tomato sauce.  Super delicious if you love artichoke hearts and garlic!!  Really enjoyed the super thin crust and ample but not overwhelming amounts of stretchy cheese.  We also shared my cheapo version of "sparking" lemonade - half lemonade, half Sprite.  

Service was a mite slow, but nothing to complain about in our case.

All in all, good pizza option if you happen to be in Potrero Hill area.
author: J. P.

description:
I love me some Goathill, but when I saw my husband eating a piece and spitting something out, I was like "what's wrong?"  He was spitting out chunks of garlic.  Mind you, I asked for a sausage pizza 'light garlic.'  Maybe the garlic press broke? Off night?  OR Maybe the cook said 'I'll give you your light garlic!"
By all means order garlic on your pizza, but make sure you're not on a hot date!
author: anne m.

description:
this is my first time try this place also pick up order.
i would like give a 3 stars this time， 
pizza was so good and still crispy but we order a chicken wings was so bad 
it was tasting like frozen ones
but i will try something else when i am eat dinning there.
author: Tindy C.

description:
All you can eat pizza Mondays!
I love that.
Aside for that though, I find the food average at best.
But....
ALL YOU CAN EAT PIZZA MONDAYS!
author: Theo R.

description:
I like this crust and the spot was a 5-minute walk from my house. The sausage is house-made and I like the huge chefs salad and blue cheese dressing.

Very neighborhoody feel.
author: Claire M.

description: I went in here for lunch, and got two slices of the pizza of the day. I figured that for ~$3 a slice, I could probably finish two. I was wrong, the slices are huge. 2 slices is easily a dinner portion. The pizza had spicy sausage, red onions and feta, but not too much to overwhelm the palate. A solid place for lunch, I'll have to try it again for dinner!
author: Chris M.

description:
If you like New York style pizza (thin crust but good sauce) then this place is for you!
I got their regular pizza but my roommate, the very next day, loved my pizza SO much that she ordered one with spinach, extra tomatoes and mushrooms. I don't like mushrooms, but on this pizza? Amazing!
So if you want good pizza and a place to order ON TIME? This place is the best of the best! It's a tad bit on the expensive side but...it's pretty much worth it. Cheaper than flying to NYC to get good pizza.
author: Mollie L.

description:
A co-worker and fellow yelper, Jennifer K., suggested this place as her "going away" lunch (I'll miss you much, lady!). She raved about this place in her review, and now I can see and taste why.

Luckily for us, Goat Hill was able to accommodate, without any reservations, our party of 15 for a weekday lunch. It can be difficult to feed such a large party with varying tastes, but ultimately it was up to the special lady. But we had no problem with her decision: Chef's salad, buffalo wings, Greek pizza, and the special combination pizza. For the salad, we asked them if we could have all the dressings that they offered to serve on the side. They happily obliged. 

The wings were yummy! Cooked just right with a mildly sweet sauce. The chef's salad was equally as good with plenty of ingredients to fill you up if pizza is not your thing. But let me tell you - I devoured two slices of the Greek pizza! Toppings and sauce wasn't overdone, and the sourdough crust works well - no flimsy crusts here! I do enjoy all types of crusts - thick and chewy or thin and crispy - as long as the dough is good. But I have to say that sourdough crust here is a newly discovered favorite.   

Goat Hill is a close second to my other favorite pizza joint, Toto's in San Bruno. But so far GH is a favorite in SF.
author: Kimberly S.

description: Just around the corner too convenient not to go to. Getting pizza there almost every week, good but not great. Certainly not like in Italy. It's just a neighborhood joint. Mondays they have all you can eat...
author: Irina T.

description: The crust is super cornmeal-y.  Not my sort of thing.  But the service was good, friendly.  Not somewhere I would necessarily return but it ain't horrible.
author: Ruth M.

description:
All you can eat pizza Mondays!!!

Wow! Mondays are a good day to come here when you're really hungry and you want to make good use of your money. If you're down for some pizza $10.95 will get you satisfied. The "Neighborhood Night" allows you to get all you can eat pizza and salad for just half the cost of ordering an XL pizza at any other joint.

Great place to eat out with some buddies and best yet, you don't have to argue with each other on what to have for toppings. Everyone can be satisfied with all veggie pizzas, to all meat pizzas. I personally like every single pizza that comes out. Although, when I see a veggie pizza I hesitate because I don't want to fill up on veggies when I can on the meaty ones. Sometimes I give in though to the temptation because the veggie ones look the most colorful... and you know what they're actually really good and flavorful, but I want MEAT! 

Other than that the pizza is not fantastic, but on a Monday night it's well worth it. The crust and cheese is what it's all about when it comes to pizza and I feel like the crust just have the texture I would like, but to each their own.

Slices are cut small on Monday nights (my pics you can check out) , but at least you can try all different types of toppings and different combinations of pizza.
author: Michael J.

description:
Best pizza thin crust/dough in Potrero Hill/SOMA/Mission, sourdough!
A must stop for good pizza, salad and beer. good views, nice people, good food!

The Italian plates are not spectacular but they do have some good wings and killer vegetarian pizza's combo's.

Remember this is a pizza joint, not a formal diner. so they have Wine avail but it is usually too warm, as the diner can be warm...but thats what cold beer is for!  5 Stars for pizza and beer, other stuff don't affect my rating.

Monday night "Neighborhood Night" is a great deal too...
author: David W.

description: Love this Potrero Hill location. Awesome service with great wine by the glass selection. Favorite pizza Is just regular cheese pizza extra sauce and garlic. The porky pie is also good with the garlic cream sauce.
author: mary helen d.

description: Really enjoyed the salad and pizza. Service was not good though. Our family salad took a long time to come to our table. Once we got our salad, the pizza came immediately after. Had to get waitresses attention to ask for refills on our drinks after sitting there with empty glasses for a while. Also, when we got our check, it was wrong and had to be sent back to be corrected. We will be back, maybe it was just an off night. The pizza is great and the atmosphere is nice. We're from out of town and like this part of SF, very neighborly feel.
author: Debi B.

description:
If you come here on a Monday then this goes up to a 4.

You can't really beat AYCE pizza can you?!  Taste is good, nice to know they didn't compromise quality for quantity.  Pizza here is kind of like dim sum style.  Waiters and waitresses go around with a quite a variety of different pizzas!!!  The only bad part about this place is that it's kind of small, so if you have a large party you will have your fair share of waiting time.
author: Brian Y.

description:
Not sure I can add too much to 500+ reviews for Goat Hill Pizza.  But I thought I would give props to the Pizza Lunch I had there recently.

The Pizza Lunch is a slice of pizza with two toppings and either a soup or salad.  Since their lunch special pizza sounded interesting, I ask the server if I could have a slice of it instead of coming up with two toppings.  They oblige and I was satisfied - a plus!

But for the life of me, I cannot recall what was on the pizza.  Silly, but I think it was a sausage with various vegetables on it.  Next time, I will take better notes.   But this is a place where if you are adventurous with your pizza cravings, you can trust them to make a great special every day.  The salad is good too, as they load the salad plate.

Thanks Goat Hill Pizza, your lunch special is cheap and satisfying - a great deal!
author: Janet H.

description:
Anyone who knows me by now knows that I have a pizza problem. Meaning = I eat it all the time. So I know a good pizza when I meet one.

Thanks to my college bud Mike for taking me around his Potrero Hill 'hood and introducing me to Goat Hill Pizza.
