description: Good, cheap pizza.  Not Neapolitan style thin-crust, not deep-dish - just regular.  We enjoyed a few pies and an $18 bottle of Chianti.  You obviously get what you pay for, but we were okay with that as we were looking for cheap drinks.  Total neighborhood joint, great comfortable vibe.  A little off the beaten path so I probably wouldn't frequent regularly.  I do like that they sell by the slice too though.
author: Melinda C.

description: I have been eating at Goat Hill Pizza, 8 or 9 times a year, since the late 1970s.  I like their all you can eat pizza night (Mondays); they sometimes have live entertainment.  I like the ambiance, it is a quiet, friendly, laid back, San Francisco vibe.
author: lee d.

description: I was expecting a slice of Tuscany with fresh California ingredients and I got a little better than dominoes. I was really underwhelmed.
author: Angel B.

description: Some of the best delivery pizza in SF.  If you're hungry and want to stay at home - go for it!
author: Robert H.

description: I don't even remember how I found Goat Hill, but it is definitely the best for pizza.  The only problem is the parking, but for such good pizza I am willing to put up with that.  It always is crowded, but for some reason we always get a table.  Good service, and fantastic food.
author: Jan H.

description: Mon Night's all you can eat pizza, for $9, you must go for the experience. Fresh piping hot pizzas with some great mix of toppings are presented at your table for your choosing. Be picky, chew thoroughly, but don't bother eating the end crust if you don't want to. It's just filler any way. The roommate is always more than grateful when the pizza in the fridge is from Goat Hill
author: Jean W.

description: If you're a pizza fiend like me, you'll be a grinning fool when you go to the Monday buffet service.  After inhaling at least 8 or 9 slices, I think I kicked the crap out of that $9.95 buffet.
author: Helen C.

description: I do like the crunchiness of the crust, but its not my favorite pizza. I would totally go back, the lunch deal is fantastic under $10 for the soup/salad, garlic bread, pizza and arnold palmer is a-ok by me. And they have by the slice, which is super convenient.
author: Sydel S.

description: The pizza here is very good, and the all you can eat special on Monday night is one of the best deals in the city and a great way to try all the different kinds of pies they have.
author: Michael R.

description:
So far, I have to say this is the best crust of any pizza in SF I have tried. It is sourdough and works really well. 

They use fresh veggies and the italian sausage especially, is really good here. One other thing, the staff is really and they copies of the Onion for you to read as you wait. I recommend not going on Mondays if you have never been. On Mondays, they have a sort of pizza dim-sum, so you can get a lot of variety, but the quality is slightly hurried and slices are smaller. Go on another night and get a pie to really experience what their pizza is all about.
author: Rahul T.

description:
We had a very nice evening here recently; just a few of us, an extra large pizza, and a bottle of red wine.  Very nice.

The pizza's always good-- more of a standard, Round Table American type pizza (and I mean that in the best possible way), available in thick or thin crust and with copious tomato sauce, cheese, and toppings.  Don't go expecting a thin-crust minimalistic, true Italian style pizza like the kind you get at Pizzetta 211.  

What's more, it is table service from a friendly waiter/waitress and wine by the bottle prices are not at all excessive.  It makes me resent paying 3X for a bottle of wine at fancier restaurants.

I'll be going back to Goat Hill when in the area.
author: Dave N.

description: First timer. My friend Malou wanted thin crust pizza and pineapples so I thought I would try this place. She's been here before and said it was good. I placed the order for Hawaiian. The guy that answered was nice on the phone. The shorter lady with the blondish hair wasn't all that friendly and she didn't say thank you. I regretted the $1.XX change I left . She was nice to the guy after me and I know he didn't tip her. $25 later. Pizza smelled good. Got home and had a few slices and it was just too salty for me. There was a couple slices left over that I would usually take for lunch but when it came time to leave in the morning, I declined to bring it with me. And thought I would try having it for dinner that night and while at work I thought about dinner and decided to decline again. I apologized to the pizza gods for being wasteful and tossed it in the trash this morning before I left for work. - Last timer.
author: Gessa C.

description: Despite the screaming kids behind me, the swooning couple to my right (who swoons in a fluorescently-lit pizza joint?!), and the blind date before me (who turned out to be cool), I really liked this place and will try to go back. It's straight-up Californian sourdough pizza with American-sized toppings. Tasty, predictable, unpretentious, homey.
author: Surely I Am C.

description: Hey, if you want to eat for a week, the monday night all you can eat pizza thing is the thing, but frankly, I don't think the place is that great.  I live in the hood, and as it is, I may eat there once every two years.
author: Sam P.

description:
Weak sauce.  Actually, almost no sauce.  Very garlicky but lacking in acidity.  

Nice people, bad pizza.  SF pizza strikes outagain.
author: Srikanth S.

description: This is my favorite pizza in SF period. :) I love the crust and Monday Night All-You-Can-Eat is the BOMB!
author: Kim B.

description: Awesome, the wait staff was fun and funny. The food was great, only reason that they are missing a star is, no goat cheese. Feta, but no cheve
author: Zarah G.

description: I believe this was the first time I've been served iceberg lettuce since arriving in San Francisco. But...everything else (including the other salad toppings) was so yummy that I'm not going to sweat the light green stuff. Thumbs up to the California pizza and the veggie lasagna.
author: Leigh M.

description: I've been to Goat Hill once and it was a pleasant experience.  The neighborhood is nice but parking is quite difficult.  They seem to be busy almost every night but their staff gets people seated as soon as possible.  Their buffalo wings were great and their pizza is loaded with fresh ingredients.  Definitely worth a try.
author: Manton R.

description: Mmmm. Yummy. Not only was the pizza great, non greasy and tasty, but they gave me a great soup. And I am a soup aficionado (ahem) and I was impressed. Plus their Italian vinaigrette dressing reminded me of my old friend's mom's dressing that i used to covet as a small child...
author: Andie J.

description: I love the crust at Goat Hill Pizza! I will brave the parking, wait and did I mention parking, for GHP. I haven't tried the location at Harrison, I'm not even sure where the entrance is on that one. But 'nuf said. GHP is my hero!
author: Alia D.

description: Don't get the slices here.  So disappointing.  I ordered Hawaiian and received old cheese pizza pilled with pineapple and whole pieces of ham on top. WTF?  The funny thing is I was drooling over the next table's Hawaiian pizza the whole time I was waiting for my order, so the fact that our pizzas looked nothing alike only added to my dismay.  Hot wings were ok.  Beer was beer.  Seems like it would be a decent pizza joint if I lived in the neighborhood.
author: LaSha G.

description: Great meatballs, salad and garlic bread.  Average pizza -- not a lot of flavor on the toppings and the crust really didn't stand out to me.  The pizza size also seemed a little small.
author: Mitzi C.

description: I've heard a lot about this place and it's sourdough crust so I gave it a try.  I just moved to the city and had a housewarming, I ended up serving local items such as this pizza.  We ordered the meat combination, chicken florentine and plain cheese (the litmus test of all pizza places).  As other reviewers have commented they are very generous with their toppings and I really liked the crust.  I also like how it wasn't greasy.  I liked the cheese the best but I like my pizzas simple.  I heard there was a Monday night all you can eat for $8.95 so will have to check it out soon.
author: Cindy B.

description: Definitely spacious and great location.  Fairly decent pizza, nice crust, good options.  Not the best, not even close to the worst.  Somewhere deep in the middle.  And the price is right!
author: Abendigo R.

description: Wow this place got some darn good pizza. It's up the street from a buddy house so we decided to head out to grab a bite at this place since I've heard such great things. The pizza is not to big and not too small. Just right and is very tasty. Crust is good so if you're on one of those crazy carb diets... uhh stay away because you'll eat all of the crust!! Parking can be a bit of a challenge but you if you don't mind a leisurely stroll you'll be fine. Be sure to get a card to stamp for every pizza you order. You'll get that free pizza in no time. Great place and is a must visit!
author: Allan T.

description: This is amazing pizza. Stopped by on the way back from a Tahoe ski trip... still in ski pants. They didn't care - we got waited on right away and had some chicken, mushroom, and spinach pizza. Good crust and lots of toppings in fresh cheese. Highly, highly recommended!!
author: Paul B.

description: The pizza here is pretty good but not the best I've had.  I would come often since it was right by my apartment and they are pretty fast.  For the best deal go on Monday for all you can eat pizza!
author: Justin F.

description:
a haiku.

sourdough pizza
go mondays to bust your gut
for $9.99
author: Genevieve R.

description: Goat Hill, I love your pizza but you lose a star because of the insouciant way your host of a few evenings ago eyed the mountain of chewed crusts surrounding the table he lead us toward while murmuring "yeah, I'm not too worried about that". Well, we were worried enough that we went to the little Tapas place next door. Think about it, Goat Hill.
author: rachael s.

description: Saturday mid-evening, mildly busy.....Ordered an XL Cheese Pizza with Tomatoes after a long day of moving (We were starving so anything would have tasted good). Wasnt really impressed with the pizza we ordered, but other peoples pizza's/food looked really good. Quick service and good experience, but I think we could have had better food if we would have ordered something more tasty. Plenty of street parking.....Will go back since it is close to our new apt, but a little on the expensive side (IMHO)
author: Tom D.

description: When I first moved to the area a friend mentioned Goat Hill Pizza as the place to go.  After giving it two shots I have arrived at a verdict.. and the news is not good. Perhaps my expectations were set a bit high going in but it missed the mark for me. The ingredients were good quality i will give them that. The crust was not what  I like and the mix of cheese (or brand ?) was not my preference. The delivery was prompt and the people that took my order were nice as well. Final Grade -- C ---
author: Brian K.

description: My favorite pizza place in the city.  The sourdough crust is fantastic.  My favorite is the chicken florentine.  Get the free extra chopped garlic.  Be sure to come on Monday night for all you can eat.  (Unfortunately, everyone in your party must be present before you can be seated.)  Be sure to get your card stamped.  You'd be surprised how quickly that card fills.  We've gotten 2 free pizzas.
author: Michelle M.

description:
went here with my honey on Friday night as a last min bite. I have been here before and tried the pasta. stick with the pizza. the pasta aint bad and will satisfy a past craving in a pinch but they does pizza killer. i got the meat lovers and my better half got the greek gourmet. that with a few glasses of vino set me up.
along with outstandign pizza the service is great and its in my hood what more could i ask.
author: Jeff K.

description: God's own pizza crust. Don't go on Monday evening, because it gets crowded and I hate waiting. The salad bar is included in the deal, BTW. Such a deal. I always over-do it. Mmm.
author: Jonny A.

description: We stopped by here at late lunch because everything else around was closed. This place is very low key and the food is delicious. Everything we had was 5 stars. This is a fancy restaurant, more of a diner/ pizzeria. I highly recommend it.
author: Karolina D.

description:
using this pizza place for company lunch

they deliver on time and are very nice 

Saving point card became one of my hobbies !
author: Cindy N.

description: Eventhough the service sucked, the pizza made up for it.  They f'ed up my order and gave my meal for half off!  I don't know too many pizza places that would do that.  Also how many places will through on free garlic?  Not many!  It also passed my sausage rule where if the sausage comes in those tiny perfectly round shapes then you must leave rule!  They used the real stuff.   I must return for the neighborhood night!
author: Jason A.

description: Woww. Well I came here with my friends yesterday cause I cut school cause finals were all done and stuff so why not! My friend that comes to this restraunt a lot and says that it's totally awesome! I'm not really a pizza person so I'm like okay sure. We arrived and got a table....There was 4 of us and 3 of us never been there so my friend that introduced us to Goat Hill Pizza ordered some hot wings w/ ranch and a XL meat lovers pizza. The hot wings were the BESTTTTT! The hot wings aren't like any hot wings where theres HECKA red hot sauce all over the place. There wasn't a decent of sauce on it and it still tasted really good and hotttt. The pizza was really good too. Probably the best so far. [: Totally recommend it.
author: Didi L.

description: Great Pie!!!  Top 3 in the city ... eat there or pick up.  The delivery is all out of one location and not as good.
author: Travis L.

description: Good, basic pizza that's slightly gourmet but not too fancy. They offer all-you-can eat slices of various sorts on Mondays. Their salad bar is old-school, with canned beets and chickpeas and the like with dressing straight out of a big, plastic jar. And there's minimal ambience. But it's all about the pizza -- yum.
author: Tara M.

description: Had a tasting of their pizza at the recent Yelp Mighty event. I just thought the pizza was just ok and could have been better. I should cut them some slack since the pizzas were delivered to the event and I didn't exactly eat fresh from their store. I thought the crust was a lil too doughy and there was not enough umpph....but thanks tho for feeding all the hungry yelpers.
author: Yan M.

description: I've been here for 2 'first times'.  One was drunk after a Giants game.  The other for lunch during my first week of work, in my first real job (also a first because I didn't remember the first time).  Slacks and a dress shirt, I'm telling you.  Both great experiences, mostly for the food and the people who were dining alongside me.  One star off for the lady who's just not all that nice.  She's good at her job in all of the other ways, just not that nice.
author: Tim K.

description: Monday night all you can eat pizza!!! HEAVEN!!! Every pregnant woman needs to go here...3 of my co workers and I were pregnant at the same time and we would come here every Monday for all you can eat pizza.  The people that work there are so wonderful and attentive!  Oh yeah...and the pizza is sooooooo good!
author: Nancy P.

description: Best pizza in SF.  The sourdough crust is delicious and family night on Mondays is fun!
author: Devon D.

description: we wouldnt have found this place if it wasn't for our friend who lives on potrero hill. i'm glad he suggested it. i haven't had any thing other than the pizza, but it was great! i was hesitant about trying goat cheese pizza cuz the thought of anything from a goat is weird, but it was delicious!! the restaurant is small and cozy. and to make the experience even better, the guy at the register hooked it up with a free coke.
author: Joy V.

description: I really wish I liked Goat Hill's pizza more, considering it's a 15 walk from my place in SF -- but I can't :( I don't know why people go so crazy over this place, at most, I thought their pizza was OK (and I love thin crust!). I still think Amici's East Coast Pizza on King Street is better.
author: Joyce S.

description: These folks make some good pizza, my favorite is the Greek Gourmet and the veggie one is pretty good too.  I can also recommend their garlic bread but other than that I haven't explored the menu much more.
author: Derek D.

description: I came here because it's basically the closest place to eat before a show at Bottom of the Hill (Besides Bottom of the Hill itself, of course).  I notice this place had some pretty bad reviews, but I guess many are old, so you should ignore them.  We had excellent service and the pizza tastes great.  A couple friends and I dined in and shared a Large pepperoni pizza, which might have been on the small side for a large because 3 of us managed to finish it, but who knows maybe we were all especially hungry.  I think the price was average for the pizza, we didn't get anything else, I think I settled for water to drink, which I don't usually do, but I didn't have much money to begin with.
author: Todd V.

description: Sour Dough Crust.  Cheap & Tastey.  Neighborhood night - All you can eat Mondays!  Family &/or cronies environment and great view of the city.  If you are one of the few who are lucky enough to live in this neighborhood & love pizza(who doesn't), there's no need to look anywhere else than "Goat Hill Pizza".  If you don't live in the neighborhood - you should make a short trip someday to try this place out.  I would say GH is on par with North Beach Pizza and Amici's but the relaxed neighborhood feel & surroundings of Goat Hill makes everything easier to enjoy, including the pizza.  What can I say!  It's just happy/tastey pizza with no strings attached!  Salads are no frills but yummy and very salad quenching.  It's just the place to go and kick-it day or night with a friend, family or your laptop.  Great before or after a Giants game too!  Cheers!
author: Tim F.

description: Soy cheese pizza!  All you can eat mondays!  what more can you ask for?  I think it's comparable to Little Star and much closer to me.  Different style from Pizzetta's gourmet touch.
author: Janet S.

description: Um, I used to love this place until my friend and I both found hair in our slices. I still get grossed out thinking about it. If you plan on eating here, inspect your food before you take a bite.
author: NIcole N.

description: I love this place on MONDAY'S!!!!!!!  For about $9 you get all the pizza you can eat, and salad bar!  The pizza is served dim sum style, where they bring around different pizzas.  Take what you like.  The sourdough crust is very different than any other pizza place.  Great views, even better service!  But BE WARNED!!!  Get there early to avoid the crowds.  It gets really busy.  To maximize your eating, DO NOT EAT THE CRUST!!  But its soooo good anyway.  I like to dip the crust in the vinagrette.Turnover is pretty quick, but people eat for a while.  I recommend fasting for a day before coming on over.  Pace yourself!!  Park at the top of the hill to work off maybe an olive.  When I cannot possibly eat another slice, they bring my favorite, which I can never pass up ... the PESTO!  Small slices encourages mutiple tastings.
author: Michael M.

description: Perhaps it was the hours of walking like a restless and starved nomad in Potrero Hill, but when I had some pizza here, not only did I vow to come back time and time again, but it is a major selling point for a future move to Po Hill.  Incredibly tasty, great selection...I unfortunately did not get my salad, but managed to sample the ranch dressing, which was also very good.  Throw in the cozy atmosphere, and you've got the ideal pizza eating experience.
author: Tanya N.

description:
oooooo my first review as elite. wowzers. 

Not a bad place to go and get a nice pitcher of beer and some decent pizza. we went there last night for my roomie's bday, and he proceeded to get absolutely hammered and made a ton of inappropriate comments, all of which made me laugh harder than I had in a while. the inside isn't exactly classy (think red checkerboard tablecloths) but the pizza is good and it isn't too too expensive. 

since it's close to my pad I think I'll have to go back soon, but not a date place (unless it's a long term relationship thingy, so the romantic dates have already been taken care of)
author: David D.

description: Excellent pizza! I got pesto with spinach, so yummy! Great service. We asked the waiter why it was called Goat Hill and he told us the story. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Dani S.

description: The most amazing pizza and bruchetta. My friends and I were introduced to this place while at Baked. (a bakery up the street) A lady in there told us she came all the way from Berkley to eat here and we had to try it. So we did, and it was so delicious... So delicious that I mentioned it to my husband when we got home from SF and we took the kids out there the next day after spending a day in the city. We live two hours away, that is how amazing it is. Totally recommend it. Enjoy =)
author: Mary S.

description: Hungover from Yelp party + sausage pizza = heaven. Thank  you Goat Hill Pizza! You are my saving grace at this moment in my life.
author: Amanda L.

description: Went here after shooting a small part in an upcoming horror film (Reatrdead).  Dining here was payment for my time and what payment it was!  Great pizza and drinks in a classic pizzeria environment.  I wish I lived closer to Potrero Hill so I go could there all the time--but suffice it to say you should check it out for some of the best pizza in SF!
author: Lucas M.

description: Sourdough crust and free garlic upon request--what's not to like? Toppings are basic, but good. Very family friendly.
author: Jiga M.

description: eh, ok service. ok pie......  a bit soggy away from the crust. eh
author: MJ R.

description: Finally came to the famous Goat Hill Piazza after a night out at Thee Parkside. You could definitely tell the place's got a lot of history, with all the sentimental photos on the wall and everything. My three friends and I shared a large Californian pizza (artichokes and fresh tomatoes) and sausage on half. It was pretty damn good. We washed it down with a pitcher of anchor steam. The service was friendly and efficient. The only thing was the slices were pretty thin so I didn't feel like I was getting a lot. But our tab with tip was just $9 each. Excellent deal. Still, nothing beats deep dish pizza at Zachary's! Awww, have to go to Zachary's soon.
author: Linda L.

description:
This past weekend some friends and I were in the hood and decided upon Goat Hill Pizza for a late lunch (~2pm).  We got in, and while waiting to be seated (per the sign), noticed that 3 staff members were carving pumpkins for Halloween.  Okay so these guys have spirit, i thought to myself - great!  We were seated after a few minutes towards the back half of the seating area, and there were about 10 people in the restaurant at that time.

A lady (owner maybe?) came to take our order and my friend (mistakenly) asked how large the pizzas were.  Instead of giving us an answer, she rudely replied "It's written right on the menu".  So we checked the menu again and couldn't find it - and maybe we're blind - but I think that as someone in the service industry, she should have just given us a polite answer instead of pointing to the menu.  That was strike #1.

So we ordered food, and ice teas and lemonades (which are supposed to be bottomless) and got the drinks after a few minutes.  But the bottomless part never happened.  Strike #2.  In fact nothing after receiving the drinks ever happened.  

Maybe we were too patient... but after 1/2 hour we realized no one had been back to our table... no drinks, no food.  And by this time mind you, the restaurant was completely empty of patrons.  So no real excuse to take that long, right?

We kept talking amongst ourselves and at 50 minutes, my friend got up and asked the guy at the back of the kitchen who was sweeping up about our order.  He had no idea about our order and summoned a younger female waitress who came to our table and said, "oh let me check on your order, it should be out soon".  Then she went up and consulted with the (owner?) lady who started to check her computer for the order.  (i mean, really?  you need a computer?  it's a small place, there are no other customers, and your entire wait staff is at the front making jack-o-lanters instead of pizzas... it's not that hard to keep an eye on your only outstanding order, and your only foodless table).  She said the order never made its way to the kitchen blaming the computer for the glitch and apologized.

Never in my restaurant-dining-life have I experienced placing an order for 4 people in an EMPTY restaurant and have it (1) not be put through, and (2) not have anyone attend to us, even to refill our drinks if nothing else!!  We were completely ignored!!!  Strike #3.

So we upped and left in search of actual food.  We offered to pay for the drinks and she said don't worry about it (which was nice i guess), but after having waited over an HOUR, that was the very least she could do.

While this may have been a one-off experience, there are far too many AMAZING pizza places in the city with good customer service and ATTENTIVE wait staff/owners to bother coming back to one that has such abysmal customer service such as this one.  Also, judging by the other reviews, it seems that there's a pattern of rudeness and nonchalance by the staff here, and since we never got to try the pizza, that's really all it boils down to in this case.

Needless to say we won't be going back there again.
author: Ani S.

description: A cool pizza joint within Potrero Hill. Super-delicious sourdough crust and toppings- terrific with some cold beer and salad. Good ambiance and I always look forward to going back. Parking can be a challenge, so don't come too late.
author: Leroid D.

description: I went for all you can eat pizza night.  They served up great combos quickly but the crust wasn't the best I've had.  Also, my vegetarian friend had to wait a long time for vegi pizzas to come around.
author: Elena S.

description: Good pizza. Sourdough crust. Good service and they served us salad with four dressing choices.
author: Alyssa C.

description: The all you can eat pizza concept (mondays) boggled my mind.  It's great!  I love having a variety and I got to try so many different slices.  The saline level in my blood must've been sky high though b/c I had to keep chugging down the water.
author: Debbie Y.

description: Love the pizza and the views to the city. Friendly staff. Skip the spaghetti.
author: Laura B.

description: My first trip here was not on a Monday, but it was on the corporate dime, so it was practically the same thing.  Our group shared the veggie, chicken Florentine, pepperoni, and meat lover's pizzas.  I have to say, even though I usually don't like meaty pizza, that the meat lover's was really the best out of the bunch.  The crusts were especially tasty when dipped in their bleu cheese dressing, which actually had bleu cheese.  Add in a few pitchers of Sierra... bliss!
author: Nat K.

description: Slightly above average pizza but the neighborhood, the good times, and the fact it gives you something different to do and  eat on a Monday night make me love Goat Hill Pizza.
author: Lynn B.

description: Not a single goat, just excellent, thin-crust pizza and amazing garlic bread.  The salads are good and also full of garlic. Overall just a solid, comfortable, reasonably- priced place to eat.  Friendly and efficient service -- I have no complaints, except that I will not get pesto there again.  The pesto was oddly bitter.  Everything else I've ever had was really good.
author: Jude F.

description: Nice joint to drink beers, and talk about how the Giants are doing with the workers. The all you can eat monday's are awesome.  One of my Potrero favorites.
author: Phil M.

description: After eating at Little Star, this place is pretty disappointing. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good either. It was just pizza to me. Nothing special and nothing worth dreaming about. I definitely wouldn't come running back to this place. We had the chef salad to start. Pretty decent portion, but again... nothing great. We had the chicken florentine pizza and again.. not much to say... Not sure what everyone is raving about???
author: Denise L.

description: We get free pizzas on Monday and I can never turn it down!  My fave is the Hawaiian... something about their mozz, ham, and huge chunks of pineapple does it for me : )  They also have a great one with red onions, mushrooms, and green peppers.  I'm sure New Yorkers would complain but it's a decent slice on the Hill.
author: Tara G.

description:
ahh, i dunno.  the pizza is only so-so.  there are just so many other places with awesome pizza that i can only give it two stars.  sorry!

it's a good place for groups.  they didn't mind our rowdy bunch.  if you don't like their set pizzas, you can choose your own toppings.  my pineapple and jalapenos choice got out voted by the group so i had to settle for nibbling on the greek, the meat lover's, the californian and the special combination.  i stayed away from the pesto since i'm still traumatized from a pesto fiasco a decade ago not related to this place.
the seasoning is a little light so i was passing round the cheese and hot peppers.

i haven't tried out the pastas or sandwiches but i figured since the name is goat hill pizza...
author: Anh V.

description: 3.5 stars rounded up, for me.  This is not aspiring New York or Italian style pizza, but rather solid American-style sourdough tastiness.  To me, it tastes like nostalgia - what all those chain pizzas I ate growing up were aspiring to be.  This is the sort of pizza you order while watching a movie, and accompany with a cold tasty beer.   Yum.
author: Jess L.

description: The whole neighbohood smells like pizza... in a good way. All, thanks to this wonderful little find in the Potrero Hill district of San Francisco. I love this place. Monday nights are basically showdowns with your stomach as you can't help but scarf slice after slice of a variety of interting pie flavors. More restaurants need to step up and make pizza dimsum night!
author: Andrew W.

description: Bomb ass Hawaiian pizza.  Sweet pineapple plus sourdough crush equals fatty goodness.  Decent wings too.
author: Coco D.

description: There cannot be a better deal than Monday night all-you-can-eat-pizza at Goat Hill.  For less than $10 you get bottomless pizza and salad and man is it good!  The pizza is amazing and the salad bar suprisingly impressive.  Plus how fun is it to just sit there and have servers come by with piping hot pizzas, offering you slices?  It's just a good time.  Don't do it if you're in a hurry but if you're ready for a night of eating awesome pizza in a fun and lively atmosphere, you have to give it a try.
author: Jen S.

description: I want to like this place, I really do. Hell, we have it at the office at least once a month...but it is not good. The crust is dry, the majority of the time the pie is burnt beyond recognition and they always forget something in the delivery. One woman actually groans anytime she sees the delivery guy come in.  I don't get it, are you all just mesmerized by the Monday night special? Get ahold of yourselves people!
author: Colleen B.

description: Pizza is the perfect food.  and I am the perfect person to eat pizza!  How else can you get an all-in-one edible meal with all the 4-5 food groups in one dish?  Other pizza joints (and I will name names)... don't do it right. Domino's is too buttery and doughy.  Amici's... greasy and they often wind up burning their pies... Pizza is not meant to be served 'blackened'.  PIzza Za would definitely be a contender (a bit pricier), as would Zachary's (Chicago stuffed pizza) but in a different weight class.  Goat Hill offers you a clean, straight forward pie.  Nothing fancy, but just a great tasting slice of honest goodness.  Wash it back with some easy-priced (that's read ... bought from Costco) wines and you can please any simpleton.. like me.
author: Dale K.

description: Im hungry!  When you first enter, this place looks tiny.  Well, untill you look further back.  Quite abit of room here and the pizza speaks for itself.  Points!!
author: andrew l.

description: I have to say that while living on Potrero Hill, this place was a weekly thing for me.  Great food and the best pizza I ever had in the city.  Friendly service and you can actually find street parking!
author: Ben W.

description: we had the Mediterranean pizza - a bit too much spinach, but great feta. Pretty tasty.
author: Peter and Julie H.

description: Very casual and kick backed place. My friends actually picked out the pizza & salad....but they were both good.  I remember the salad having red onions and olives....I believe it had the house dressing which was good.  The pizza was a veggie which was pretty tasty.
author: Natacha M.

description: The sourdough crust improves the taste the most. If they didn't offer it I wouldn't go as much. It does cost a little more than other places. A medium pizza will go for about $20 without drinks.
author: Robin L.

description: nice cozy little efficient joint. loved the thin crust combination pizza. liked how they provide markers for the younger ones to draw pictures. the waitress was extremely nice and courteous. bro ate the all the leftover pieces that i brought home =)
author: con c.

description: Gotta Love It: This place just atomizes the local pizza joint. Looking around at the old Potrero Hill photos you feel the history. Great sourdough pizza crust.
author: Kristina C.

description: it was my son's first day of school and we thought we would celebrate with another family by going to pizza. Goat Hill or Haystack? we chose Goat Hill...Mistake! When we walked in we were greeted by a snarled looking woman that was not eager to help us. She asked us how many, I said 7 as her look got more sour than when we walked she proceeded to turn us away! Serious a business turning away a small group! Another Man walked out and said 7? give me a minute I will get you a table. We decided to stay because the kids were hungry.  The service proceeded the ladies attitude...Horrible! Our order was wrong and the waitress did not feel the need to come and check on us...I guess by our appearance they felt like we were not worthy of their snobby pizza. Well that's ok. When I am face with choosing a pizzeria best believe me I will not choose this judgmental place again, disgusted!  I wanted to contact the owner and let them know that they have a waitress that turns away business based on appearance but no contact info on the website.
author: Samantha B.

description: It's definitely no Dino's in Pacific Heights.  Decent monday night special, but go to Dino's for some delicious pizza & pasta.
author: Todd C.

description: The prices online don't reflect their actual prices and they charge for delivery. I tipped the driver well on top not knowing this...$35 for a small 'medium' wont order pizza here again!
author: Me L.

description:
All you can eat Pizza on Monday Nights for $11?! How can you go wrong. The pizza's good too. Funky toppings (Jalapeno, Pineapple, and Pepperoni. Try it! It's good.) They have all the regulars too if you're feeling not so adventurous. 

I'll def. be back next Monday. See you there!
author: Derek L.

description:
OK, I went back here. 

Wow, what a different experience! Instead of being seated in the front which to me is dreary, annoying, and the middle tables not-so-private, I was seated in the back corner with a window and a nice view. 

We ordered a medium pizza of the day, and for 2 people we could not finish it. At $16 it was a steal -- yummy sausage, artichoke and tomato! They also have draft beer on tap, $11 pitchers. You could order a pitcher, garlic bread for 3 people be stuffed and have a $40 bill... just don't get stuck in the front!

I'd give 4 stars if I didn't have to sit in the front sometimes, and if they weren't so rude to me on my birthday the first time I came here! I might go 4 stars eventually if I have some good repeat experiences
author: Brian E.

description: Sour dough pizza crust, garlic cream sauce on a meat lovers pizza, great views of the city.  Love this place!
author: Brenda B.

description: Of all the pizza joints in the city, this is my favourite. Besides the best sourdough crust in town, the ingredients are always fresh and the vibe is always cool. Whether you're looking to go on the cheap with friends on a Monday night, grab a slice or two on the way by after the gym, or looking to have a nice quiet evening with that special someone they've got the spot for you. Laid back and upbeat at the same time, they could hold down the corner of the neighborhood all on their own if needed - they *are* Potrero vibe, just like Farleys.
author: Troy E.

description: Monday night's all you can eat pizza buffet at Goat Hill is one of the best dinner deals in town at about $10pp.  To sweeten the deal, the pizza kicks ass - sourdough dough, with toppings from classic to exotic, all in generous amounts, brought piping hot to your table.  Be nice to the waitstaff and they'll remember it.  Skip the salad bar except for the ranch dip.  Be prepared to wait a bit for your table if you have more than 2 people or arrive at primetime.  A monday night tradition for me; I'm bummed when I can't go!
author: Eclipse T.

description: Good all around pizza that will please a group. The chewey crust will appease both the thick and thin crust lovers. Good sauce. Good toppings. Looks like you can even have beers deldivered? Awesome.
author: Casey D.

description: This is my favorite pizza place in SF...sourdough crust how can you go wrong?  The salads are really tasty as well.
author: Michelle M.

description: The portion of this pizza is big, there are alot of ingredients on the pizza itself but when you bite into the pizza you expect to taste something but I didn't and I ate two pieces just to make sure.  I had to add salt, pepper, cheese and red flakes to get some flavor.
author: May A.

description: Given the view of the city from the south (quite a unique perspective) and the all-you-can-eat Monday night pizza deal, this place is quite a treat. I enjoyed the pizza very much, especially the sourdoughy-ness of the crust, which is peculiar and different from other pizzas that I've had. You may want to avoid the Monday night frenzy though.
author: Joshua C.

description:
yum. i've been hearing about this place for years, and since i moved to potrero hill i've been here twice in one week. 

 first off, they have a lovely little dinner salad with garbanzos and pepperoncini and other yummy delights, and both dressings i've had - italian and blue cheese - were deelish. it's suprising how easy it is to fuck up a salad, so i'm always happy when i get a tasty one. 

the pizza was great, too, although i found myself adding salt, which i rarely ever do with any food. hmmm. if we could award 4.5 stars, i would, for this reason. 

service is just right, atmosphere is very pleasant, great views. i can't wait to try "neighborhood night" some monday.
author: jean w.

description:
goat hill is great hill!

their pizza is awesome. this is where i had a "goodbye SF" dinner. i think of garrick when i think of this spot.  

you can see the building i work in from goathill's back room!
author: Ameer N.

description: This place is just solid. Good pizza, good for groups, pitchers of beer, nice views of the city, good prices, neat pictures of potrero back in the old days. there is a lot to like.  Sure, it's nothing fancy or heart-stopping, it's just plain old solid. Last time we got the portuguese and the greek. both good.
author: Nima K.

description: The only pizza joint that I found in SF that does an authentic sourdough crust.  It is excellent.  Still very thin crusted body, but nice airy, yet hearty rim.  The pesto with tomato and black olives was delish.  More toppings than some of the other thin crust spots, so you actually feel like you're eating something substantial.  ME WANT SOME NOW!!!!
author: Betsy K.

description: My Husband and I just moved to Potrero Hill from Seattle, so we're trying all the restaurants in the neighborhood. We went here last night, and the service was great, the pesto & Italian sausage pizza we shared was really yummy. I can't wait to go again on a Monday for the all you can eat-fest!
author: Ashly M.

description:
take out, timely, tasty.

what more do you want?  no need to go anywhere else.

can't wait to try out all-you-can-eat just to stuff myself silly!
author: Sandy K.

description: Oh man...YUM!!!!! Don't exactly remember what I ordered but I know the pizza had artichokes on it, so get that one! The atmosphere was chill and super laid back, and everyone there seemed really neighborly and down to earth. I liked that my friend and I sat in there for four hours talking and they didn't try to push us out or hint that we should go.  Reasonably priced. I highly recommend!
author: Stephanie J.

description:
GH dont need another review.. but we just went again recently and its just so much fun that i have to share.
monday nite neighborhood nite is the way to go. its always warm and balmy in that area of pot hill, so waiting outside (with vino or beer in hand) helps make the wait tolerable.  the wait can get hairy, but go early-ish or late-ish and the wait aint so bad.  my pie lovin lover turned me onto monday nites 2.5 years ago and we have been countless times since and loves it.   
$10.95 for all you can eat slices with amazing gourmet toppings and salad bar to boot!?  how can you go wrong? the pizza is amazingly hot, fresh and so delish. they slice the pieces smaller, so you don't fill up too quick.  
this last time we went, one of the hosts came out and held a quick quiz show with prize! the questions he asked were impossible, but finally after the 4th or 5th question, someone got it! 
it was cute and fun.
author: Caroline S.

description: I love this place! The service and food are top notch. I wish we can come here every monday (all u can eat). I miss this place since my wife and I haven't been able to come now that we have a baby and our binge-eating dates have lessened. I really can't wait for my baby to be old enough to come eat here. Location is great. There's always parking in the neighborhood, the people are friendly, and the pizza(s) are excellent.
author: Cary S.

description: I stopped here for a quick lunch when i was in the neighborhood. The service was friendly and efficient, and I appreciate the free refills on the fountain drinks. The pizza was kind of puzzling. I found the crust extremely pleasant. It was really crunchy and had a nice, but not overpowering tang to it. The toppings, though, didn't really do it justice. We got the day's special, which was eggplant, pesto, and tomatoes. I don't know what I was expecting, but the tomatoes were NOT good. They were the barely pink, tasteless grocery store kind. The other toppings were better, but nothing special. I found the cheese quantity to be bordering on excessive, and I really like cheese. Nothing was WRONG exactly, but the crust was really delicious, and the toppings could have been on your average late-night delivery pizza. They could improve that situation and have a seriously tasty product. All in all, I would go back if I was nearby and wanted pizza, but I wouldn't make a special trip.
author: Julia G.

description: Came here with a group of friends after volunteering at the food bank so our appetite was huge. it took a bit of time to even order, much less get pizzas on the table. we ordered a cheese, a meat lovers, a veggie and a supreme. honestly it was all disappointing. the cheese pizza was all sauce and no cheese. I WANT CHEESE ON MY PIZZA! seriously! the meat lovers was the same, i couldnt pick out the pepperoni from the sauce cause there was no cheese to differentiate. the supreme and veggie had a miniscule more amount of cheese. honestly extremely disappointing. i could have better pizza in iowa i bet
author: Rich B.

description: My friends are huge fans of all-you-can-eat pizza-and-salad night. The iceberg lettuce and ranch dressing were yummy. The pizza itself is just OK though. Every slice, no matter what the topping, tastes effectively the same. Even the pesto version has a tomato and mozzarella base and you just can't taste the difference from the previous piece. So it gets boring really fast. Worth a try maybe once, but I'm not dying to go back. I will say however that the view from the back dining room is quite nice.
author: Heirloom Z.

description: This pizza is good. The sour dough corn mean crust is delish and the toppings are interesting. For only having a few beers on tap, the choices are good. What pushed me from four down to three stars is an annoying experience i had at the monday night "all you can eat" special. We got there (starving) at 720, and had decided if the wait was over 1/2 hr, wed try somewhere else. We were told definitively that the wait would be 20 mins for 2 of us.. We waited over and hr before we were seated and watched larger parties that had arrived way after us get seated. I realize that its hard to predict on all you can eat nights, but the system of seating parties didn't seem entirely fair and had we been given a better estimate we wouldn't have waited.. very frustrating.. Normally I would let this effect my rating, but the hosts were particularly nice to the masses who were waiting..
author: K A.

description: Compared to the "all you can eat" pizza posers of the East Bay, this place is a Pizza Smorgasbord.  You actually can sample the available "gourmet" offerings, not just cheese, pepperoni and plain breadsticks.  Granted, it's pricier than the East Bay joints, but infinitesimally more options than them as well.  Just the fact that you have vegetarian options is enough to convert me.  Word to the wise: show up early, or don't show up at all because the wait doesn't end at the door.  There is a lag time for the pizza also, so if you really want to experience "all you can eat" pizza, be prepared to stay at least 1 1/2 hours.
author: brenda b.

description: I like deep dish crust and my boyfriend prefers thin...which basically means we've never ordered a pizza without ending up in therapy the next day.  That being said, Goat Hill's crust is nice.  Not too thick, not too thin.  Five stars for saving my relationship!  Minus a star for charging $1.50 for a side of ranch dressing (which was awesome, btw, but not worth $1.50).
author: Dawn J.

description:
I love the pizza here but the service leads a bit to be desired. I got take out at the Potereo Hill location  2 Sundays in a row and both times when I went to pick it up I had to wait over over 15 minutes after the the time they said the pizza would be ready. 
On the second Sunday that I went to go pick up my order the cashier told me my pizza wasn't even in the oven. When I questioned him about why it was taking so long he looked at me and said "Weren't  you here last week, didn't you learn your lesson?" I love Goat hill's quality of food. Their pizza is great but I will never go back to the location on Potero Hill due to the service.
author: Sierra d.

description:
I've never been here not on a Monday night so I can't speak to that - but nothing is better then ending a long Monday work day with dim sum style pizza.  As soon as we walk in the door to put our name down I realize I am starving.  Even if I had a giant piece of cake an hour before, I still cannot wait to get seated and start stuffing my face. 
The wait is always worth it, and please, don't ever EVER be rude and try to sneak in without all your party there.  If we can wait for our slow moving friends that work in South Bay, so can you!  Plus, once we saw a table get chewed out for a surprise late arrival.  The rules are explicitly posted, and the girls started making a fuss about being yelled at just because they were "so young!"  
Well, considering all of them were drinking alcohol, I'd say they were way old enough to read a sign.  
I love the servers - they recognize us and are always friendly despite the fact they have been carrying around pizzas non-stop through the busy and crowded restaurant!   
My keys to Goat Hill:  grab stuff from the salad bar to eat between slices, eat the pieces with garlic at the beginning cause they will be overwhelming when you start getting full, and wear loose pants.
author: Adrienne W.

description: Hmmm...after reading all 4 billion reviews, we decided to check out Goat Hill as part of our quest to find the One True Pizza (which- full disclosure-- I am convinced resides somewhere on the West Side in Manhattan).  My take on GHP:  good enough, but not enough cheese!  Crust too thick!  Not enough sauce!  Weird, too salty seasoning!  Better than most pizza in SF (bar not high), but still a bit of a disappointment.  I will likely be back for pigout Mondays, but I'll have lower expectations.  The salad was really, really good -- perfect ranch dressing, just the way I like it.
author: Sheila W.

description: I've lived in SF for four months and have been here three times. The first was just dumb luck because we were looking in Potrero for a place to live. Well we don't live in Potrero and we've been back twice. It's just really nice there. The service is good and pizza and salads are pretty good too.The last pizza we had there was a little short on flavor but that may have just been a weak order on our behalf.
author: Raj T.

description: Yum! I love this place. We've only gotten delivery but their sauce is amazing as is the crust. A definite must try. We miss our pizza places in Chicago but this place makes that all better.
author: Jenn L.

description: Goat Hill makes decent, "better than the average delivery place" pizza.  The crust is unremarkable but not bad, and the tomato sauce is ok.  The pizza can't support some of the more elaborate topping combos, so you have to be careful if you order a deluxe-type arrangement because you might just end up with a puddle of food.  I started with the salad, where veggies were abundant and tasty.  The Sunday night ambiance was red and white plastic tablecloths, locals, and a guy on the end having dinner  alone.  I'd order for delivery and if I lived nearby might stop in, but since I dont live in the area I think it will be a while before I return.
author: philip k.

description:
While the pizza is excellent, and I've enjoyed it for years, I had a huge disappointment recently. After moving away from the Hill, my only option is to have my pizza delivered from the SOMA location. So I called last Friday for a delivery, but it never showed up. I called and talked to Roger about an hour after my initial order, and he assured me that it would be arriving any time since all pizzas had gone out, and didn't bother to ask me any details before he hung up on me. About an hour later I called back and he tried to brush me off, so I yelled at him and he then became a little more agreeable. He told me that the driver gave my pizza away to someone in Potrero Hill. I didn't know they delivered to Potrero Hill. He didn't do much to assuage my anger, other than to offer to bake another pizza. I didn't feel like waiting another two hours so I said no thanks. While he supposedly refunded my credit card, he didn't seem to concerned about customer service, and whether or not I'd ever order from them again. 

If this review was only about the pizza, I'd give it 5 stars. If it was just for the poor service from the delivery, I'd give it a negative star (if we could do that). So I'll compromise at 3 stars, but I won't be ordering from them again.

If you decide to order delivery, make sure your driver isn't Polat. He might give your pizza to someone else in a different part of the city from where you live.
author: Jake B.

description: It was over their delicious sourdough pizza and a $15 bottle of wine that my fiance and I decided that Potrero Hill would be our new home. A great pizza in a great neighborhood...can't wait to trek up the hill to go back!
author: Jaymee S.

description: This is one of the rare places where if you order pizza to go and you eat the pizza 1 hour latter it still feels pretty good
author: Alex A.

description: I love neighborhood night, so fun, and such good pizza and I love getting to try all the different varieties, I really like anchovies and my man not so much....so this is great for us.....we each get what we want. Plus cheap pitchers!!!! I wish I could go every Monday!
author: Adrienne G.

description: I absolutely love the veggie pizza with soy cheese. I just hope that the soy cheese doesn't contain and casein in it because it's the best soy cheese I've ever had, but I assume it's vegan because the first time I ever had Goat Hill Pizza was when I was working for Greenpeace and they'd order a soy cheese pizza for the vegans whenever we'd have socials or volunteer nights. I'm going to be greatly saddened if I find out the soy cheese isn't completely vegan.
author: Amanda M.

description: Pretty good pizza, but pretty sub-par service. I'd head back if in the area, but otherwise, probably not. The mushroom slice was excellent, while the cheese slice was just meh. As far as service, we had to ask to order and then no one returned to our table, despite the fact that I guzzled my coke and needed another.
author: K F.

description:
sourdough crust.  hawaiian pizza WITH jalapenos.  enough said.  when my mouth is watering for good pizza, this is definitely the first on my list.

monday night is the definite winner with the all you can eat . . . and for the other nights, get the hawaiian with jalapeno.  i was very hesitant at first, but once i tried it, i was sad i hadn't tried this years ago.

sourdough crust.  jesus, someone save me.
author: Jason J.

description: Best pizza in the city I've had so far. Not too greasy, and the place has a very "at home" feel. Service is very attentive and just plain nice. Haven't come for the "Monday Night" yet, but definitely plan to.
author: Kimberly P.

description:
On Monday nights this is the place to be if you love pizza.  You can't beat $10 for all you can eat pizza and salad bar.  Try to get there as early as possible and make sure all of your party is there as sometimes you can wait as long as 45 min for a table.  

Just make sure you wear loose pants!
author: Serena T.

description: Monday night - al you can eats are a great bargain!  Just bring your appetite.  If you are not a big eater, like I am, it might not be worth it.
author: Frank G.

description: This pizza isn't Italian at all!!! But neither is a cold anchor steam and having the Giants game on during a warm summer night! For some reason, the trio of beer, baseball, and pizza just takes me to a happy place. Oh yea...its probably because I'm American. Anyway..the pizza from Goat Hill gets the job done. I love the thin crust of Italian pizzas, but the lack of toppings and sauce makes it too wimpy for manly Americans. The flavor of deep dish pizzas are bold, but I HATE using a knife and fork when watching baseball. The special combo from Goat Hill has the crispy and delicious thin sourdough crust, but the tomato sauce, salami, pepperoni, beef, sausage, bell peppers, onions, olives will make you scream "USA". All of the ingredients were as fresh as can be. The only drawback was the center of the pizza. The toppings and cheese slid off the crust which became soggy after a while. However, the edge was perfection! The crunch you get when you bite into the edge can be heard all the way from ATAT park! I couldn't be happier sitting the couch with my belly hanging out and would definitely come back faster than you can say "Let's go Giants"
author: Siao W.

description:
The pizza is not very good. I have had better at Papa Johns. 
However the pizza is not the reason for the bad review, the service is terrible and the staff is unbelievably rude. 
It's definitely not worth climbing the hill for.
author: Sonja H.

description: Best pizza in SF. If you don't believe me, go. If you go and don't agree you know you still had a good experience, don't lie. Nice area, couple good bars for after dinner drinks.
author: aaron b.

description: Guy that answered the delivery line was a total jerk. Impolite and unprofessional. On top of that they told me it was going to be 45 -60 mins for delivery of my med. pepperoni. They must be really busy Sunday nights.  I like  the pizza, but not enough to put up with bad service.
author: Scott J.

description: I ordered a large pizza for delivery and it was not very hot.  The crust wasnt soft and kind of hard..not alot of flavor.  Maybe its better straight out of the oven.  The salad was good and the delivery was appx 30 minutes
author: May M.

description: Just moved to Potrero, and my Monday nights will never be the same.  There's a long wait on Monday, so get there early if you can.  If you can't, bring some good folks and hang out with the rest of the good crowd outside drinking and waiting for a table.  Once inside, prepare yourself for a treat.  The pizza served dim sum style will have you trying all kinds of lovely creations (chicken garlic jalapeno pineapple, for one), and they're all good.  Just remember to drive, because after all you can eat (and you will push your own boundries on this one.  Expect to say "This is my last piece" at least three times) walking upthe hill is not advised.
author: Jesse H.

description: How can anyone not love Goat Hill Pizza?  If you are feeling lonely on "neighborhood night" you will run into at least three people you know , their crust is sourdough and they have Prohibition on draft.  And although Monday night is great, I mostly prefer going any other night of the week, because I don't have to wait to get a table and I'm not good at waiting when I get a hankering for this yummy pizza.
author: Amy A.

description: I used to live in this neighborhood and loved Goat Hill.  Friendly people, good pizza, good old-fashioned hospitality at it's best.  Have never done Monday night feast, but it sounds wonderful
author: Todd S.

description: I've been hearing about this place for ages and finally got to eat there. Their pizza was a great change from all the greasy pizzas out there.
author: shari d.

description: Very good pizza.  Ahh yes, the Sour dough crust is why...now I remeber and my mouth is watering!  Go on Monday night for the all you can eat night to get a sampling of everything.  Then come back on Tuesday and get a Large of your favorite!
author: Pele N.

description: Best pizza deal on Monday nights... all you can eat for less than $10, with servers going around the restaurant with a variety of different and great pizza. Salad bar was pretty good, too. Get here before 6, though, or be prepared to wait 15-30 minutes. Haven't been on here on any other day.
author: Andy A.

description: Ordered Pizza for Take-Out. Medium friendly but very fast service, very good pizza even though it didn't quite reach my favorites in the City (North Beach & Za). What really dragged down the rating was how expensive this pizza is. Spent $20 on a large pizza that didn't deserve the name and only had 2 toppings. That's too much for pizza!!!
author: Heiko L.

description: Personally one of my favorite all time pizza joints.  Luckily for me it's right down the street from me, though I don't go as much as I want.  I love the thin crunchy crust.  MMM, my mouth is watering right now.  My favorite is the Hawwain because its not as salty, and a tad healthier than the traditional combinations.  Regardless, all the pizzas rock at Goat Hill.
author: Joe P.

description: hmmmmmmmmm goat hill.... man food.  hmmmmmmm.  Sierra hates this place because they have slow and sometimes rude delivery  but I'm in love with this cheesy pie!  hmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm.  If you have patience you have happy mouth and a full stomach. hmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
author: Bill S.

description:
Four stars from a biased New Yorker. 

Good pizza and high quality toppings. Salads are basic, but good.

They need to clean the ovens a bit more often to avoid charring the crust. Also, don't order the pasta dishes. These guys do one thing well and it's pizza.
author: D D.

description: I've only gotten delivery or take-out from here and have never eaten in, but I quite enjoy this place.  No, it's not the cheapest pizza in town, but the high-quality ingredients and interesting combinations of toppings make it worth the price.
author: Jen W.

description: Came here on a Saturday night with some friends and I really enjoyed the place and pizza. The place is pretty casual,  but has a nice atmosphere. I like the fresh ingredients they use on the pizza. Not the best pizza I had(New York's the best!) but very high quality and decent prices! Service very friendly and quick. I would definitely come back here and need to try the all you can eat.
author: Leon C.

description: Finally ventured to the PH last week to check out Goat Hill, as I'm in search of the perfect pizza. Soup and pizza shouldn't be too tough, right?  The sourdough crust was great, but the sauce overpowered the lightness of the toppings (we got the greek) and cheese (half regular, half soy). And the minestrone soup was way too garlicky for my taste (but it was vegetarian!). I think I'll stick with Pauline's, Gaspare's, and/or Pizzetta 211 for now.
author: Bee H.

description:
I used to be obsessed with this place, then over the years the so-so sauce made me care less.

Still happy to get a pepperoni to go, but if I didn't live so close I couldn't imagine trekking back for a pie.

Great neighborhood vibe at the place, however.
author: Rob P.

description: LOOOOOOOOOOOOVE the pizza here. SOOO tasty. It's cooked to perfection. Best pizza I've had anywhere!
author: Cris L.

description: Love the pizza.  This is my go to pizza for years before I moved to the neighborhood.  Crust is not to thick not to thin.  My parents love coming here when they visit from out of town.  Very friendly staff and casual atmosphere.  Looking forward to finally trying a neighborhood night.
author: Michael D.

description:
it's a keeper!  the 4 stars will stay!  went there for dinner tonight and got a large pie of half californian and half mediterranean.  garlic a little on the liberal side, but no worries if you're dateless or if your date is eating the same. ha!

as usual the place was packed and delivery boys still carrying out lots of boxes!

this is mos def a place to come and check out if you're ever in the bay area.  there's 2 locations to suit your needs.
author: ann.ie k.

description:
Average pizza at a gourmet price. Nothing too special about this place, mediocre crust, the sauce wasn't very high quality, toppings list was pretty much the basics. 
I didn't order a salad but the ones I saw at our neighboring tables looked pretty boring.  Beer prices were expensive. 
On the upside: quick and friendly service, good view of the city (if you sit in back), smells good from outside.
author: Brad Y.

description: Figured I've have to give my input since I am here almost every Monday (If you have read other reviews - you know what goes down on Mondays) curing my hangover from the weekend. Its no coincidence that Sundays always come back to bite me in the ass. But.... I cannot think of a better place to relinquish your depression than Goat Hill. As you are saying to yourself "I am never drinking again" or my favorite "I love this city but it will eventually kill me" (I have these thoughts on Mondays BTW) I sit down at Goat Hill with a Pizza and a Bottle of Wine and all my worries fade into the back of my mind. The service is OK, but I think that's what I like about. I mean you are at a pizza joint so I wouldn't want anyone waiting on me hand and foot anyways. Oh yeah, I also grab a few slices for the family before I head home for trips - They love the sourdough crust. All in all, this place is my Monday Sanctuary.
author: Stan W.

description: Their pizza has excellent quality toppings. A buttery and thinner crust. Im not sure the style pizza, but its one you wish that your delivery pizza tasted like. They dont do slices, but i hear on Mondays they have all you can eat pizza in the evening. If I lived near by Id probably be here once a week. Since I still gotta jump in the car for it, Im only there once a month or so. Well worth it!
author: H B.

description: I am not a pizza person, but the pizza we ordered was pretty good (thin crust with veggies). The delivery was very quick and the pizza was still pretty hot. Good customer service.  I like it better than the LIttle Star pizza.
author: Sophie N.

description: they've got some nice crispy pizza here.  definately in my top 3 pizza places to go to in the bay area.  the special combination came with a ton of flavorful toppings and a good amount of garlic.
author: Fotos C.

description: If you have a crazy two years old, this is the ultimate place to go! They are not only kid friendly, but they actually seem to enjoy having kids around. They know my daughter by name... what else can I say?
author: S. A.

description: Ordered the Portuguese pizza. Took roughly an hour and they did let me know in advance. The pizza was almost below average in terms of taste - the crust was decent but get chewy quickly when it cools down. The toppings didn't quite taste fresh - seemed like a mediocre job. I'm inclined to try it again to see if other pizzas are better here.
author: Harsh X.

description: good Pizza! love the monday nite all you can eat. OMG! makin me fatter.
author: Andy D.

description: Yummmmy.  So  I take my brother outside of the Cow Hollow bubble and into the wilds of PH.  Upon entering GH, we discover that its all you can eat Monday!  What dumb luck! What joy! The best part is that the slices are small, so if you are strategic you will be able to eat a LOT of pizza.  The boys managed to put away 10 slices each, which is still a long way from the record of 38.  However, there is always next Monday.
author: Cassandra E.

description: This is a really cool place to eat and relax.  The staff is always friendly and laid back.  I've been working my "frequent eater" punch cards in the hopes of a freebie, but I'd pay any day.  The cornmeal crust and free loads of chopped garlic on any pizza rock.  Mondays they do all you can eat....ridiculous for diets....
author: Richard P.

description:
Update: Went to Goat Hill this weekend and was sadly disappointed. The slices were about half the size they used to be, the toppings were pathetic (literally 3 very thinly sliced, small pieces of mushroom and about 4 or 5 small pieces of onion...come on!), and the crust was burnt. Maybe it was just a bad day? Alas, one star gone...

Why oh why does no pizza place in California seem to know how to make decent crust? I've asked myself (and friends) this question on more occasions than I'd like to remember?! Is it the climate? Doubt it. Is it the lack of good ingredients? Nope, don't think so. Do Californians really PREFER soggy, doughy crust (this was my friend's hypothesis)? Somehow I'm not buying that either, though.  Whatever the reason, six years of living in this city has taught me that, when eating pizza, unless you are ready to shell out some cash at a real Italian restaurant or lower your expectations significantly, you're going to be disappointed. That said, when I do try to, shall we say, adjust, my expectations, Goat Hill Pizza is the place I choose.  
The toppings are fresh, the sauce is flavorful enough, and while the crust is certainly not what I would call wonderful, at least you don't feel like you've just bitten into a piece of microwaved styro-foam. The salads are pretty decent too.
So...leave behind any expectations of crispy crust or east coast pizza and Goat Hill should do the trick.
author: SL N.

description:
goat hill is pretty steep, the angle of the hill that is..
prices are just right..

the greatest pizza in SF is the
goat hill pepperoni and garlic

make sure you are not a vampire before you eat it
or you will die

get your goat!
author: Danny D.

description: The salads here are so fresh and yummy. And the pizza is really good with an abundance of cheese and great-tasting sauce to create the perfect balance of pizza bliss. Don't come here if you're on a diet, as it will reverse all of your previous efforts and you will gain your weight back 5-fold. Mmm, I love being fat.
author: Laura S.

description: Pretty good pizza.  I'm not a huge sourdough bread fan but I'm fairly picky about my pizza.
author: Susan T.

description:
I was looking for a great pizza destination in the City and saw Goat Hill Pizza with 4 stars and 296 reviews.  I didn't get a chance to act until last Saturday, when I was in the neighborhood taking photos and hunger attacked.

So, I thought of Goat Hill Pizza - with such a cute name and such high praise from Yelpers -- how could we go wrong?  We should have stuck with the plan to go to Chez Maman. Seriously.  

The experience was just okay.  First of all, the wait-staff were slow and indifferent - especially considering it wasn't busy when we arrived!   When we first walked in and the hostess finally noticed us -- she waved us off and said she'd be with us in a minute.  Normally I would have waited, but we were cold and hungry, so I asked if we could just sit at the counter.   When a waiter finally showed up to give us our menus and then when we finally took our order, we chose the Mediterranean salad and a medium pizza (1/2 Hawaiian and 1/2 Gourmet Greek).  

It took more than 45 minutes after we ordered for the food to arrive.  The salad was okay -- iceberg lettuce, tomatoes, artichoke hearts, red onions, salami, etc  I was unimpressed with the choice of iceberg lettuce.  The pizza was mediocre -- the crust wasn't that great and the flavor was pretty boring (I expected garlic on our Greek Gourmet pizza) -- I only had two pieces because it wasn't really worth it.  It was pretty late in the day and I would rather go home and have something better.  We ate, paid our bill, and left.  The whole process was way too long and not worth it.  

Next time - if I am that close to Chez Maman, I am going there instead!
author: Sadie S.

description: I love GH Pizza, I really really do.  All you can eat pizza & salad on Monday nights is fabulous.  Go early unless you want to wait an hour for a table.  Lucky for me I live walking distance!!!
author: Jennifer B.

description: This place is awesome!! The Monday night all you can eat pizza & salad bar is the way to go. Yummmmmmmy!!!!
author: Donna L.

description: love the fact that you can get pizza by the slice w/ your choice of up to 3 toppings here.  however, they seem to just put cold toppings on top of a slice of cheese pizza and then re-heat it.  i got a slice w/ spinach, mushrooms, and artichoke hearts, and the veggies were not cooked all the way thru.  nevertheless, i can't complain at 1030 pm at night, and the crust was nice and crispy.
author: Helen T.

description: The combo pizza is quite tasty. These folks do a really good job with the crust (IMHO the most important pizza component). I recommend washing it down with a pint of Prohibition Ale.
author: Tim S.

description: Gone over there for lunch a few times.  Both times we had to wait and wait and wait for the wait staff to either take our order, refill water, or to pay the bill.  The food is great, but service is pretty sucky.
author: Steve W.

description: You can't beat the all-you-can-eat-pizza (and salad!) for $10 Monday nights.  Just be prepared to maneuver around all the sport teams and kids that go also to take advantage of the deal.
author: SFFoodie F.

description:
gut busting dim sum pizza mondays! 

service = so so
pizza = excellent
price is right

the best part.  all you can eat on mondays.  no crust.  just the good stuff.
author: Garyn W.

description: My coworker brings in his leftovers and MAN they are delicious !! i have tried a pesto vegetarian one, and then a salami and tomato one!! WOW!! the best pizza i have tried in a very long time!! last night i dreamt about it!! juicy and tasty and if you like garlic DOUBLE WHAMMY
author: Maria C.

description:
Good pizza is hard to find.  We'd heard about this place and made the trek from the Richmond District.  Oh how we wish we lived closer.  The pizza was good and the place was cute.  Don't know what the scene is when it's all you can eat pizza night, but we went around eight on a Sunday night and it was very low key.

We started off with a salad and though it was nothing special, it really hit the spot. When it came to the pizza,  were a bit nervous about the sour dough crust...woud it over power the other flavors?  Happy to report, it was just a good crispy crust, and we could barely detect any sourdough flavor.

This food is craveable and I'm sure we'll make the trek from time to time.
author: Steve J.

description:
not a fan - grossest wings I have ever seen. waiter was a douche. pizza is fair. beer is the usual price per pitcher.

don't know what the hell the other reviewers are smoking but i suspect this is their hood & i'm glad they like it. i like pot hill too - but not goat hill pizza.

maybe it was just that one time - but I probably will never go back in here.
author: Lawrence K.

description: I started coming here years ago when I had friends who lived nearby. The pizza was always pretty good - although I can't remember ordering anything else but the Hawaiian. Then I just stopped going. The reason? BAD ATTITUDE. On the phone, at the counter - they always seem to manage to make me feel lower than dirt. Never any apologies for wrong or late orders. No thanks for being such a loyal customer. Sorry, Goat Hill, Amici's may be a chain, but you can sure learn a lot from them about customer retention.
author: Rey L.

description: This is what I'm talking about when I'm talking about pizza. Crust and sauce is everything. It's the backbone of a pizza and Goat Hill gets the foundation right. They don't just slather on a lot of cheese and call it good like most places do. The toppings are quality, fresh, and in balanced proportion. I've only ever ordered delivery - which conveniently can be ordered from Goat Hill's website and in my experience is always quite speedy - so I can't comment on the in-store service or the restaurant itself but from what I hear it sounds pretty nice.
author: Anna N.

description:
all you can eat pizza??!

i would be there every monday night if i could

oh, and there's salad too

bring an empty stomach!!!
author: Eva S.

description: Friendly family place, good service. Pizza pretty good for SF. Nice place to sit around and chat.
author: Liboo K.

description: Great location and laid back environment.  The pizza always seems cold even when you eat in the restaurant.  Not bad over all but not even close to best in the City.  I still don't get why people wait forever out front for all you can eat night, at $10 how much money do you expect to save and how much pizza do you really plan to eat!!  At almost any pizza place in the city 2 people can order a large for about the same price!
author: Enzo S.

description:
Average at best.  I like the history of the place (great photos of the old neighborhood); but, the food is mediocre  - the kidney beans and garbonzo beans overwhelm the garden salad, and the pizza is soggy and bland.  I do, however, enjoy the lasagna - rich and cheesy, with  generous portions (1/2 order is plenty).  The service is friendly, but slow and inattentive.  

If you're looking for good pizza, go to Amici's.  Otherwise, get the lasagna to go.
author: Ben S.

description: Great neighborhood joint with guess what???...great pizza! Fun, friendly atmosphere, especially on Mondays Neighborhood Night. It's a good way to try out all of their different specialties. Good for pick up or dining in, though expect a long wait on Mondays if you don't arrive early.
author: Phil S.

description:
yeah, whatever. cant believe nobody said anything about the roaches joining you for dinner at your table. 

And come on the pizza isnt really that good ... its just in potrero hill.
author: Valerie K.

description:
Decent Pizza, but nothing to write home about...

Their prices online are out of date, and when called out on it, their comment - that's the way it is...so the meal was 25% more than I thought...and as everyone else knows...the place is already so damn expensive...will never go there again based on the customer service...

The food is the only reason it gets two stars.
author: Joe A.

description: Goat Hill is good but very inconsistent. I have eaten here some nights and been stoked outta my mind with how good the pizza was and other nights i have been disgusted with how terrible it was, Good thing is it has been good more than it has been bad. A plus is that they have some good Beers, a pretty cool atmosphere and it's so close to my house. I would say the price is fair. They are pretty slow when it's busy so i have started just ordering for pick up when i feel like goat hill.
author: Blake C.

description: It's always nice to have a local pizza place you can get behind. Goat Hill is good food and once I'm employed I expect I'll be frequenting the Monday night all you can eat. The only drawback is that they tend towards the pricey so not the best option for a late night pizza fix unless you're looking forward to throwing down the cash.
author: Marita M.

description: great atmosphere and great pizza!! they serve local beers from prohibition and anchor steam, have huge salads for a fair price and on the night I went had a great live piano player in.
author: alex m.

description:
Believe the hype. This IS good pizza.  I would go back but I wouldn't eat here again.    Allow me to elaborate....the way the restaurant is set up is a little strange.  There are 3 different dining areas.  There is one when you first walk in, the back dining room, and in between those areas is an awkward hallway with tables, where, in my opinion, tables shouldn't be.  This is where they sat us. Also, when we were about 3/4 done with our meal, a waitress sat a family of 4 right next to us, practically on our laps, while almost the whole dining room behind us had many open tables.  The tables are really close to each other, too close for comfort.  I felt uncomfortable to even continue having a conversation because all of a sudden I had 4 strangers listening.  I really don't understand why servers do that.  Do they not think people are going to care?  I could understand if the place was busy and there was nowhere else, but that wasn't the case at all. The restaurant is also very kid-friendly so if kids being kids isn't your thing, you'll want to order it to go.
