But with that being said, the pizza is really freaking good with a slightly upscale appeal but it's really not that type of restaurant.  I like how a small is big enough for two people. My only complaint would be that its slightly on the bland side but I added a little salt and it was perfect.  I would go back but next time we'll get it to go.
author: L. Renee D.

description: I am like Elaine from Seinfeld where I only eat the top portion of a pizza slice and not the hard crust. I have to say I pretty much ate the entire pizza slice  while dining at Goat Hill yesterday. Their Pizza's are unbelievable, my favorite is the Mediterranean, and you also can't go wrong with the good old pepperoni and sausage. I wish they would expand their beer selection to include some pilsner's. Great place to take some rowdy friends to party.
author: Robie G.

description: So freaking good on Monday nights.  The only problem arises when you get seated in an area far away from the kitchen and tables around you are not very kind and take two slices at a time.
author: Jake B.

description: A co worker and i , went over  to GHP for lunch last week . i had the meatball sandwich. it was awesome. the staff is very friendly. parking in that neighborhood really is bad though.
author: STEVEN D.

description:
Very kid friendly.  Busy.  Pizza was a little disappointing, they didn't get the toppings right.  Crust was crunchy and crispy (maybe thats how you like it?).  Meatballs were pretty good.  Dinner salad was a medium sized bowl with pepperocinis, beans and a good variety of fresh lettuce.
Interior is bland, some paintings but not much to look at.  Staff was friendly and helpful.
If this is your local pizza place you are lucky because there is much worse.  If you are a pizza aficionado, you probably need to try this place.  Otherwise, I'd keep looking.
author: Ryan R.

description: I love Goat Hill.  I love the all you can eat nights.  Who can beat the price or the delicious pizza.  They have so many combos there is a flavor for any type of pizza lover.
author: Christina C.

description: This is my favorite Pizza Place Ever!!!  I love the crust how it is sour dough.  The Special Combination pizza is my favorite.  The salads are really good too but don't normally have room after eating so much pizza.  I also like dipping their crusts into ranch dressing they provide for free.  Nice view of the city from the back fo the restaurant too.
author: Michael B.

description: Ok seriously, sourdough crust!  It really shouldn't take more convincing than that.  They make absolutely delicious pizza.  The hearty crust is just what you need when you're hungry but its by no means a thick pie.  Coming from Chicago, I consider myself a pizza connoisseur and its so hard to find good pizza this side of the Rockies but Goat Hill has become a regular for us.  My favorite toppings: sausage, green pepper and mushroom (major YUM!) and the hawaiian rocks too.  We always pick up instead of deliver so I can't comment on the delivery experience but its always ready quickly.  They do a neighborhood night on Mondays which is fun and dining in is a great experience too.  They also have a punch card program so after you get 12 pizzas you get your 13th free (any size).  We've gone through a few cards already.
author: Natalie B.

description: I went here after getting a groupon for the restaurant.  $20 of food/drinks for $10.  Husband and I went here and ordered an order of the chicken wings, 2 slices of pizza and a spaghetti with meatballs.  The spaghetti was pretty bad.  We didn't even take the leftovers home (and it was mostly leftovers).  That was pretty expected though since most pizza places don't have good pasta but the hubby can never resist spaghetti and meatballs.  The pizza was decent but not excellent by any means.  I got a slice with pesto and sausage and the husband got sausage with jalapenos.  Don't get me wrong, they were above average but not by much.  Maybe it was because we didn't get a whole pie, just individual slices so maybe the pizza had been sitting out for awhile and then reheated.  Especially since my company orders this pizza all the time and I remembered it tasting better.  Surprisingly the chicken wings was the standout item!  They were baked instead of fried and came with some delish ranch dressing on the side.  YUM!  Overall a great value for $15 (groupon + tax and tip).
author: Susan L.

description: ok pizza but they always burn the crust. at least what's delivered to my company.
author: Aaron S.

description: Goat Hill Pizza has been serving Potrero Hill for the past thirty years, and is best known for its Monday "Neighborhood Night," when all-you-can-eat pizza and salad is served from 5-10:00pm, for the amazingly low price of $8.95 ($4.95 for children ages 6-12). The salad is self-serve; friendly waitpersons circulate continuously among the tables, displaying trays of piping hot cheese and combination sourdough crust pies ranging from the standard to the exotic. This is possibly one of the best dining deals in the city, and definitely one of the most popular - expect to wait for a table unless you arrive very early or near closing. In addition to pizza, the menu offers pasta - spaghetti or homemade beef or spinach and cheese ravioli are available with vegetable, meat, or an outstanding pesto sauce in full or half portions; meat or vegetable lasagna; sandwiches (the hot Italian Sandwich, with salami, pepperoni, Italian sausage, green bell peppers, green onions, mozzarella and provolone cheeses, ripe olives, and pizza sauce on a French roll is a steal at $5.95), and salads. Red or white house wine is available by the glass, half-liter, or liter, and Anchor Steam, Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, Gordon Biersch Marzen, and Lagunitas Pils are sold by the mug, pint, or pitcher; bottled beers are also available. Always a treat, but if you join the party on Monday night, you're guaranteed to become a regular.
author: Gourmet G.

description:
wost place ever

seriously.  not only did these faggy douche bags ask my friends 'why people have to ask such stupid questions' in response to his question about if they took his credit card.

THEY TRIED TO STEAL MY PHONE!

im not even making this up.  i accidently left it there, on the only table that was in use, us being the only people there, late in the day.

so i leave, then im like oh fuck my phone, so i call and ask if they have it, and theyre like no, sorry, no phone here.  and im like dude bullshit, ill tell you exactly where it is, and hes like sorry man, click.

SO IM LIKE FUCK NO NIGGA and walk back over.. oh wait, they are now closed.  its like 3pm wtf.

so i knock, someone comes to the door and is like sorry were closed.  im like dude i need to grab my phone, i was JUST here, ill get it.  so i push my way in and go to the dining area.  as soon as some guy sees me, he scurrys off and goes into the other room.  im like wtf man??  then he comes back out and gives me my phone.  i didnt say anything, just took it and left.

AND THEN I CALLED THE HEALTH DEPARTMENT AND REPORTED THEM FOR HAVING BUGS IN THE KITCHEN
author: Jason H.

description: The "dim sum" serving style with the pie is brilliant. Good stuff.
author: Jeff B.

description: meh.  tried the pesto and the vegetarian.  not impressed.  the pizza just didn't go together well with its toppings.  the pesto was better than the vegetarian, but still not really worth eating.
author: H. L.

description: I have been going to Goat Hill for 20 years and finally get a chance to write a review.  I believe this is the best crust and toppings and friendly service in the city.  I have tried to go other places but this is the place I always come back.
author: janet c.

description: i don't care what other people think of cornmeal crust, Goat Hill still makes a good pizza. it just goes with it nicely & gives it good flavor. of course everyone knows about Monday neighborhood nights by now. and to wash down all that pizza with a Lagunitas or an Anchor is sublime.
author: Chris C.

description: Goat Hill is great pizza made and served by great people in a great neighborhood in this great city.  Portrero Hill was once called Goat Hill and sometime in recent history someone started this urban delight and started selling some damned fine pizza.  Really good ingredients, fine staff, good vision and delivery and a commitment to the neighborhood and city, along with human values make this a really fine community partner for many causes they support in many different ways.  I stopped by last week and ordered a sausage and onion to take home, and read the paper while waiting, the local paper from the hill, and damn if when I got home they'd made a mistake or I mad and it was a mushroom and onion pizza with at least a pound of really fine shrooms, great crust, sauce and cheese, blistered just right and crunchy, crispy the right way.  I wanted to cry because I hate shrooms, but it was too late to call back and exchange it, they'd closed.  Still my SF favorite for many reasons.
author: Stu S.

description: wonderful window views and delicious pizza. great lasagna as well and good customer service. plus latinos doing all the cooking go figure! no wonder its so good! thanks goats
author: Jim L.

description: I was having the worst day of my life. My cat had fleas and I found out I was getting laid off of work. I drank the day away at Pop's and woke up in a gutter in Potrero Hill. Naturally, the first thing I thought was not, "Why is the word 'BUTTS' written on my arm in sharpee," but "PIZZA!!!!" I sauntered over to Goat Hill were I was greeted by the most delightful gent. He was tall and classy and looked like the sort of man who knows all the lyrics to "Puttin on the Ritz." He seated me promptly at a table overlooking that glorious city that had wronged me so. Suddenly, I remembered that I was lactose intolerant and said "FUCK!!!! FUCK" really loudly. My dear host rushed over to ask what was the problem and how could he solve it. I told him my digestive troubles and he said, "Why, we have soy cheese here at Goat Hill!" I smiled and clapped my hands and we did a jig. My pizza was so delicious, it was if Julia Child came back from the dead and cooked it herself. And it was all mine. Greedily, I scarfed down the entire thing, along with a pitcher of Anchor Steam. In the midst of this gluttony, I remembered where that extra tube of Advantage was and remembered how fun it is to be unemployed. I salute you Goat Hill.
author: Ginny M.

description: after hearing so many people gush about goat hill, i finally checked it out this past weekend.  while the pizza was good (we had the portuguese), i didn't find it spectacular.  the mediterannean dinner salad i had beforehand, however, was topped with the most amazing olive oil i've ever had....  mind you, the salad was hardly unique, but my stomach's just rumbling imagining the scent of that olive oil....
author: Roshni R.

description: phone order taker = in a rush just wanted to get the order over with he kept saying anything else anything else ??? gosh man chill , they were out of a lot of thing and he kept saying oh the potrero one has it , well that didnt do me any good becuz u said they dont deliver alright chill again please !!!, pizza ok nothing extraordinary, salad mmm i shouldve drank water at home , wings burned burned , super burned anf then burned again .... the only good thing about my order was the diet coke becuz it was in a can from the coca cola company , to make things perfect the  delivery guy thinks he is nicolas cage  in 60 seconds alright well maybe these guys were having a crazy day , sorry u guys had to read all this ! cheers
author: NAEL K.

description: their neighbhorhood night (all you can eat pizza, dim sum style, for $8.95) is a great choice!
author: Jill k.

description: I love Neighborhood Night!  All you can eat pizza dim sum style!  The service is great and once they get to know you, they start bringing your favorites right to you.  For example, I'm the girl that gets pineapple pizza delivered to her piping hot out of the oven.  They make you feel special at Goat Hill and I like to feel special.
author: Shalom G.

description:
i had the luxury of living down the street from this godsend.  many times i've braved the elements (overcast skies suck) and walked up the steep hill to grab a slice of heaven. i actually lived on the other side of the freeway and could have avoided the hill climb, but would walk my canine companion around the block to kill time while waiting for the slice. i've often been tempted to buy a whole pie to take home, but can not be trusted with any more than i can inhale in a 5 minute span.
a word of advice to the folks that feel compelled to get the most bang for their buck on the monday all you can eat night... DONT. though it may be worth the coin, your money is better spent grabbing a pie all your own than sitting around waiting for the server to bring out something you really want. you tend to feel like a douche after you grab 4 slices and hear the grumbles of the peeps sitting in the back corner. those poor bastards...
author: Jeremiah J.

description: For pizza, Goat Hill is pretty good.  Their salad dressings are homemade which is always a plus in my book.  The historical photos of Potrero Hill also help provide the customer with an interesting experience.  I'll go back.
author: Darren V.

description: It's all about Monday nights: all you can eat pizza.  Give yourself plenty of time 'cause the wait is long.   Somehow the pizza just isn't the same on other nights...
author: David D.

description: I walked in singing happy birthday in my head to myself, as it was, in fact, my birthday.  My sister and brother in law were taking me out to eat, and after going to the fusion restaurant down the street and smelling the deliciousness eminating from this place, I decided we must try it.  We went overboard with the appetizers, meatballs with cheese, salad, garlic bread and buffalo wings.  Oh yeah, and some pizza please.  Combination and -I think- the Californian (artichoke hearts in it, you figure it out).  We stuffed ourselves on the delicious apps, honestly, five stars for that, the salad was great, really delicious, fresh and crunchy lettuce with firm and delicious tomatoes (I am not usually a fan of the red squishy things, but I made an exception today, they were truely divine), the meatballs were tender and truely "ummy".  By the time the pizza came along, our ferver had reduced quite a bit, but what we had was yum, yum, yummy.  *sigh*.
author: Asha H.

description: i do prefer thick crusts, but goat hill pizza is pretty tasty...
author: charlotte s.

description: wow, pizza again? yes its cuz my new roomie likes it. 3 of us, 2 pizzas. we had them delivered, and i forget how long it took, but not too long (to castro). One pizza had spinach and chicken and i think feta. it was very good. The other one had chicken and tomatoes and hmm maybe pesto? i cant remember, and the menu page isn't working right now but wow it was soo good. that one got eaten up in 2 seconds. i want some now. they were not greasy and were very fresh tasting. i'd go back.
author: Merredith L.

description: Great pizza. Have been coming here for years but I must admit that once I find a pizza place I love, I rarely venture out to other pizza places.  I have never been disappointed. The only reason I am giving Goat Hill 4 stars is due to the fact that I used to live in Chicago and have yet to find pizza in SF that comes close, although I realize that it is in a class of it's own.
author: Kim R.

description: good pizza, distinguished by SOUR DOUGH crust! cute pot hill establishment. monday night is all you can eat pizza night.
author: Lijia X.

description: Good place to go for a quick bite for lunch.  However, watch for short change. Make sure you count your change before leave.
author: Wilma S.

description: delish! probably my favorite pizza ever...anyone I've introduced to it loves it. generally go for the pep or spinach and feta, but the meditteranean combo was pretty good. their blue cheese dressing is amazing as well, so I'd recommend the salad.  now that they deliver, I can be even more of a lazy bum...
author: Marie W.

description: Quite a far trek for pizza...unless of course you actually live in Potrero. April is pizza month so I thought I'd try something new and a little out of my bubble. Goat Hill is mainly known for their all you can eat Monday special but I didn't want to fight the crowd so decided to check this place out on a slow Sunday night. The wine selection was small and mediocre. They did have some decent bottles of beer by the bottle. We started off with a salad which was chock full of tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, feta cheese.  The garlic bread that came with the salad was warm, crispy on the outside, and soft on the inside. We ordered the specialty pizza with everything on it. What was great about this pizza was that it was filled with toppings and the crust was not too thick, not too thin and super crispy --- even on the bottom. I would definitely recommend this place if you're in the area...check out their other locations. But not sure I'd travel back as there are pizza joints in my neighborhood that satisfy the same craving.
author: Josephine H.

description: my roommates and i went here last night for their all-you-can-eat pizza which takes place every monday night. there was a little bit of a wait, say 20 minutes for a party  of four. i was thinking that the pizza slice would be normal size, but they are little slivers, i guess so you can sample a lot and not get too full. i might have gotten here at the wrong time, because at one point there were about 4 meat pizzas circling and only one veggie. my roommate (also a veggie) asked one of the servers if we could have more vegetarian pizzas come out, and she snapped at us, saying, "well, there are a LOT of vegetarians here." sheesh, sorry! eventually more veggie pizzas came out and i ate about eight slices. i left full and bloated.
author: Oleya P.

description: i was very surprised to see this place get 4 stars...my own experience there wasnt great. the place was pretty empty when we went (around 2.30 in the afternoon), but for some reason, our small pizza still took over 30 minutes to make, then we had to have them remake it since the crust was waaaay overdone in my opinion. so basically, it took us 45 minutes to get a small, so-so, crunchy pizza. and i am soooooo not a crunchy crust girl. i love my pizza hot, cheesy, melty, chewy. i guess it was my fault i came to the wrong place. :(  i probably wouldnt go here again, esp since there are some pretty good pizza options in the city...namely Haystack, Extreme Pizza, North Beach Pizza.
author: Miss Lili F.

description: came here for the monday all-you-can eat.  it was a good value, but the pizza really was only okay.  it's nice to have the variety of the different pizzas, but i wouldn't say that it stands out from any other pizza joints.
author: Robyn F.

description: I went on a Tuesday night.  We had a reservation and it was probably a good thing becuase it was packed!  The pizza smelled great and the taste did not disappoint.  We tried a pesto, meat lovers and vegetarian and all were great.  Plus they have pitchers of Anchor Steam for $10.  Can't beat that!  I hope to go back soon!
author: Marie N.

description: There is nothing better than finishing up a tough Monday at work only to realize it's "Neighborhood Night" at Goat Hill Pizza. Arrive early (by 6 p.m.) or expect a wait...but then again if you aren't seated right away you can stand outside and enjoy a pitcher of Speakeasy Prohibition Ale. Yum Yum!  This place is definitely kid-friendly so expect to don your patience cap if you aren't used to screaming three year olds. On the flipside this is the kinda place that makes you appreciate living in the city. Where I grew up in the midwest our only pizza option was Pizza Hut or Minsky's! Lucky little bastards who get Goat Hill.  I do have one idea for the owners of Goat Hill--make a special sign for the vegetarians to place on their tables so they aren't bombarded with pizzas topped with carnivorous pickings. It would save the staff from wasting time and the restaurant's patrons from having to explain for the 50th time of the night they don't eat pepperoni, sausage, chorizo or chicken.   Other than that this place is superb!!
author: Marils R.

description: Delicious sourdough crust, ample toppings, and a very authentic pizza-pasta feel inside. For $4.95, you can't beat their Pizza Lunch, which includes a nice green salad and a very large (you could fold it if it wasn't so crispy!) slice of Goat Hill's pizza with 2 toppings of your choice. Delivery is also great!
author: Jackie C.

description: This isn't the best pizza in the worls (or even San Francisco) but they have 2 great things: the salad bowl (comes with garlic bread) and Monday Night All You Can Eat. For those alone I give it 5 stars!
author: JS M.

description: The service sucks, especially on weekends. They do not send complete orders, if you call back to ask for the rest of the order, they say they will fix the situation, and they will actually not. They claim there is no manager on site, and that you have to wait until Monday to talk to someone to help fix their mistakes and send the complete order. Please do yourself a favor and stay away from this business. Awful and shameful!!! This is Better Business Bureau material, and that is what they are getting right after this review. Ridiculous, too bad the food is acceptable, service like this will bring the whole thing down.
author: Lucian I.

description: not the great NY slices I grew up on, but some of the best San Francisco pizza
author: hunter w.

description: So here's where Goat Hlll falls, a step up from Deja Vu but under Little Star. It's not deep dish, but I respect the fact they use sourdough to make the crust perfectly crunchy.
author: Daniel C.

description: This is my favorite place for pizza in San Francisco.  The pizza tastes great.  I lived in many cities including NYC and this pizza is as good as any I have had.  The atmosphere is very casual.  We have been there on the all you can eat Mondays and have had an opportunity to taste test many different pizza selections.  Loved it!  Also, they have really simple dinner salads that are extremely fresh and compliment the meal well!  Sometimes parking is a challenge depending on the day and time you go there.
author: Melanie J.

description: I had the very best pizza of my life here.  They have soy cheese (yay veg friendly!), the crust is divine, and the toppings (I chose artichoke hearts, mushrooms, and anchovies) are generous but not overwhelming.  I paired my meal with a pint of Prohibition Ale (delicious) and savored every minute of my dining experience.  I'll be back, often.
author: C. M.

description: love goat hill, especially when i'm enhanced.
author: boner time j.

description: Monday night all you can eat. They bring out a lot of veggie pizzas and there's a salad bar included. Get there early. Excellent pizza with great toppings (olives, sun dried tomatoes, feta, spinach, mushrooms, pesto, etc...). I am usually full for 2-3 days after eating here.
author: Sarah J.

description: Exceptionally good pizza!  Best pizza I've had --- and my husband and two kids agree!  Crust is thin and sourdough.  Ingredients are very fresh.  So far, the best I've had there is the chorizo pizza,  Try their soup --- homemade and top notch.  Don't come with a totally empty stomach because they do take a little while to get food on your table --- but that's the price to pay for such fresh pizza.
author: Katharine P.

description: Pretty good Pizza, I especially liked the sourdough crust. Pitchers we're only like $8 and they had a pretty fair selection. I might end up there again.
author: Mike B.

description: we had goat hill pizzas delivered for an event and despite sitting around for a while before it reached my mouth, it was absolutely delicious. the crust was chewy and dusted with cornmeal and the cheese/sauce were high quality and uber tasty. mmmmgood
author: Dana D.

description: My favorite pizza in the city.  Granted I live nearby, but the sourdough is very tasty (with pepperoni or just cheese).  They also have great meatballs.  It's the rare neighborhood institution that actually has good food.
author: Brett H.

description: I guess a neighborhood pizza place doesn't have to be good because they already have a captive audience that will eat there out of convience. That explains how I've eaten here 15 times and only been satisfied for 5-6 of them. The pizza was OK and the salad was OK. However more than once I was served a slice that tasted as if it had been refrigerated/frozen and reheated. I hate eating leftover pizza at home because of that texture. It is totally inappropriate to serve pizza like that in a pizza restaruant. The service here is sometimes spotty meaning they act like it is a burden that you are there. People, the reason you even get a paycheck is because the customer is there! I am your paycheck. This place is often drafty. It could be a really cute neighborhood joint and the kind of place you'd love to go on a cold, rainy night, except it has a tired look to it and needs a thorough cleaning and isn't welcoming.
author: Paris E.

description: wow, monday night all you can eat pizza was great. i was there once and already want to come back. it was good. the atmosphere was friendly. the pizza dough was thin, crusty and small size so you can try different ones.
author: VICTORIA H.

description: Single handedly the most disgusting pizza I've ever had in my life. I'm including cafeteria pizza from when I was 12. The crust could have doubled for toasted cardboard, would not have known the difference. Folks, is it possible to make such horrilble pizza? Trader Joe's frozen $5 pizza rocks the cheese off this crap. I tried it once years ago, and decided to give them a second chance recently. With all the positive reviews I'm left thinking one thing...SF is full of people who don't know what good food tastes like. Horrible. And just in case you think I'm a gourmet food snob, guess again.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Despite the fact that I used to live in Potrero Hill. I had never been to Goat Hill Pizza.  I went last night for the first time for all you can eat night. Once you get a table you are welcome to ravage the salad bar and the hostess informed me the servers bring different pizzas around to the table. The salad bar was really great, but at first I was a little disappointed as the first three pizzas that came out all had meat on them. I thought being a vegetarian that I may not get my money's worth here. After 30 minutes without being able to say "yes" to a slice of pizza I mentioned to one of the servers that my boyfriend and I were vegetarians and hadn't been able to eat anything yet. After that they really took care of us. The servers started bringing the veggie pizzas to our far corner of the restaurant first to make sure they would not run out. We definitely left with full bellies! The pizza was pretty good too, with some daring combinations like jalapeno and pineapple. I will absolutely go back.
author: Elle B.

description: Good food, but really slow.  I've only dined in once during lunch and it took almost an hour to get 2 pizzas at the end of the lunch hour.  Delivery is just as fast or faster.
author: Drew M.

description: they got my order wrong.  dude said he would give me a discount on my next pizza, i just wanted the correct pizza delivered like what every other pizza place would do.  i said if they did not send the pizza that i ordered i would never order from them again.  he said "ok"  i said "ok thank you."  and then hung up.  decent pizza but never again.  =)
author: michael k.

description: What a messed up experience:  We took some German friends there last night; party of 10 (some well behaved kids were with us).  From the moment we got there, we were informed of the RULES of the dive in an army style manner.   All of the staff, besides the servers (my son pointed out that they were very nice) were unbelievably rude.  If felt almost like a joke, but it wasn't...my husband arrived and wanted to sit with us; some nutty waitress jumped towards the table and forbade him to sit down, "sorry against the rules, which are strictly enforced".  She yelled at me as I offered him a piece of my pizza.  He was ordered to sit at a table near ours.  He left the place.  I asked for the manager; some large-framed pressure cooker.  I am a very polite person and tried to get our feelings across-nope: "We don't want you here, you can leave"...Well, ... what to say; "Better service in former East Germany", my friend added.  The kids were stunned...So are we.  What the heck?!?!
author: Silvia V.

description: the monday night buffet is amazing.  rather than grabbing stale old pizza from a serving line, waiters zip around delivering fresh piping-hot pizza literally faster than you can wolf it down.  the only caveat is that there was a substantial wait for two people even at 5:45pm.
author: Matthew M.
